author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Sometimes it comes down to a choice," Magnus said. "Between saving one person and saving the whole world. I've seen it happen, and I'm selfish enough to want the person who loves me to choose me. But Nephilim wil always choose the world. I look at Alec and I feel like Lucifer in Paradise Lost. 'Abashed the Devil stood, And felt how awful goodness is.' He meant it in the classical sense. 'Awful' as in inspiring awe. And awe is well and good, but it's poison to love. Love has to be between equals."

author: Rudyard Kipling,
title: “You must learn to forgive a man when he's in love. He's always a nuisance.”

author: Scott Lynch,
title: “Quit being so hard on yourself. We are what we are; we love what we love. We don't need to justify it to anyone... not even to ourselves.”

author: Carrie Jones,
title: “I want you to want me because you want me, not because of grief, not because he is not here. I want you to love me for me. I want you to kiss me first and not because you need me to help you, but because you need to kiss me.”

author: Fulton J. Sheen,
title: “The difference between the love of a man and the love of a woman is that a man will always give reasons for loving, but a woman gives no reasons for loving.”

author: Allen L. Roland
title: “Love is making friends with fear because fear is the constant companion of intimacy ~ and when you bring fear out of the darkness and into the light, you realize it was an illusion based on our own insecurities.”

author: Zoe Sugg
title: “I've decided that I'm not going to try to squeeze myself into a friendship that hurts me anymore. I'm going to let her go and just be friends with people who make me feel good about myself.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Love has no limitations. It cannot be measured. It has no boundaries. Although many have tried, love is indefinable.”

author: Ricky Lee,
title: “Hindi mo pwedeng mahalin ang isang tao nang hindi mo minamahal ang hilaga, silangan, timog at kanluran ng kanyang paniniwala. Kapag nagmahal ka’y dapat mong tanggapin bawat letra ng kanyang birth certificate. Kasama na doon ang kanyang libag, utot at bad breath. Pero me limit. Pantay-pantay ang ibinibigay na karapatan sa lahat ng tao upang lumigaya, o masaktan, o magpakagago, pero kapag sumara na ang mga pinto, nawasak na ang mga puso, nawala na ang mga kaluluwa at ang bilang ay umabot na sa zero, goodbye na. Pero, the memory of that one great but broken love will still sustain you, tama nga na mas matindi ang mga alaala.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Like you're riding a train at night across some vast plain, and you

author: Eric Micha'el Leventhal
title: “We are at our most powerful the moment we no longer need to be powerful.”

author: Jenny Han,
title: “Peter will love Lara Jean with all his heart, always”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “and all I could think was that I would like to spend every morning for the rest of my life waking up beside her”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Holy mother!"

author: Banksy
title: “A recent survey or North American males found 42% were overweight, 34% were critically obese and 8% ate the survey.”

author: John Maynard Keynes,
title: “The long run is a misleading guide to current affairs. In the long run we are all dead.”

author: Woody Allen
title: “If God exists, I hope he has a good excuse.”

author: Susan Beth Pfeffer,
title: “If God wanted a world filled with saints, He never would have created adolescence.”

author: Gena Showalter,
title: “Should I pull on a shirt?" he asked with hint of amusement. I WILL NOT BLUSH. "No." He'd be doing the world a favor if he never wore a shirt again, but I wasn't going to tell him that part. "You're fine.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “Well,” she said. “I’m frustrated.”

author: Michel de Montaigne,
title: “The greater part of the world's troubles are due to questions of grammar.”

author: Stephanie Perkins,
title: “Closed. Plenty of time to see it later, remember?" He leads me into the courtyard, and I take the opportunity to admire his backside. Callipygian. There

author: Sojourner Truth
title: “I'm not going to die, I'm going home like a shooting star.”

author: J.R. Ward
title: “Yo, cop. We're heading for Screamer's. You wanna come?"

author: Dr. Seuss,
title: “I box in yellow Gox box socks.”

author: Jim Butcher,
title: “I love being a wizard. Every day is like Disneyland.”

author: Stephen Colbert,
title: “Clearly, America has no shortage of metaphorical opportunities for the poor.”

author: A.S. King,
title: “I was also built from delusional optimism and folly.”

author: David Eddings,
title: “I thought you said you were the one in charge!" Ce'Nedra exclaimed.

author: jeaniene frost
title: “You can hear my dreams? God, you must never get any quiet. I'd be shooting myself in the head if I were you.”

author: Brian Regan,
title: “That’s why I admired that kid who spelled it wrong on purpose so he could sit down. He knew he wasn’t going to win, so why stand there for 3 hours.

author: John Sandford,
title: “I'm so horny the crack of dawn isn't safe.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “We should be careful to get out of an experience only the wisdom that is in it and stop there lest we be like the cat that sits down on a hot stove lid. She will never sit down on a hot stove lid again and that is well but also she will never sit down on a cold one anymore.”

author: Madeleine L'Engle,
title: “Meg, don't you think you'd make a better adjustment to life if you faced facts?"

author: Mark  Lawrence,
title: “Running ain't no bad thing. Leastways if you run in the right direction.”

author: Lisa Kleypas,
title: “I spent most of my youth hauling sides of beef and pork to my father's shop. Carrying you is far more enjoyable."

author: Jennifer Egan,
title: “It was the hat. He looked sweet in the hat. How could a man in a fuzzy blue hat have used human bones to pave his roads?”

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
title: “The champagne was dead. So it goes.”

author: Bill Cosby
title: “If you want to be seen, stand up.

author: Richard P. Feynman,
title: “– and pompous fools drive me up the wall. Ordinary fools are alright; you can talk to them and try to help them out. But pompous fools – guys who are fools and covering it all over and impressing people as to how wonderful they are with all this hocus pocus – THAT, I CANNOT STAND! An ordinary fool isn’t a faker; an honest fool is all right. But a dishonest fool is terrible!”

author: Janet Evanovich,
title: “Ranger is an unusual name," she managed. "Is it a nickname?"

author: David Levithan,
title: “now, if there's anything stupider than buddy lists, its lol. if anyone ever uses lol with me, i rip my computer right out of the wall and smash it over the nearest head. i mean, it's not like anyone is laughing out loud about the things they lol. i think it should be spelled loll. like what a lobotomized person's tongue does. loll. loll. i can't think anymore. loll. loll! or ttyl. bitch, you're not actually talking. that would require actual vocal contact or <3. you honestly think that looks like a heart? if you do, that's only because you'v never seen scrotum. (rofl! what? are you really rolling on the floor laughing? well, please stay down there a sec while i KICK YOUR ASS)”

author: John Muir
title: “The mountains are calling and I must go.”

author: Robert Heinlein,
title: “Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.”

author: Sinclair Lewis
title: “We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.”

author: Woody Allen
title: “Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.”

author: أحلام مستغانمي,
title: “الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا

author: Tiffanie DeBartolo,
title: “Did you really want to die?"

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.”

author: Cheris Kramarae
title: “Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.”

author: Charles Chaplin
title: “Life is a beautiful magnificent thing, even to a jellyfish.”

author: Emily Dickinson
title: “If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.”

author: Pablo Picasso,
title: “Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. ”

author: Nora Ephron
title: “What are you going to do? Everything, is my guess. It will be a little messy, but embrace the mess. It will be complicated, but rejoice in the complications.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.”

author: Ben Okri
title: “The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.”

author: Dalai Lama XIV
title: “My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”

author: Cormac McCarthy,
title: “You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.”

author: Lois Lowry
title: “It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.”

author: Aldous Huxley
title: “Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”

author: Ayn Rand,
title: “Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “But-" Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.

author: William Shakespeare
title: “My only love sprung from my only hate!

author: James Lecesne
title: “This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Jace?"

author: Sarah Kay
title: “If I should have a daughter…“Instead of “Mom”, she’s gonna call me “Point B.” Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say “Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of "parties" with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.”

author: Erica Jong
title: “I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....”

author: Christopher Moore,
title: “People, generally, suck.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Hello, Harry" said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones."

author: viggo mortensen
title: “You don't have to make something that people call art. Living is an artistic activity, there is an art to getting through the day.”

author: Rumi
title: “The ground's generosity takes in our compost and grows beauty! Try to be more like the ground.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Whoever you are, or whatever it is that you do, when you really want something, it's because that desire originated in the soul of the universe. It's your mission on earth.”

author: Werner Herzog
title: “Do you not then hear this horrible scream all around you that people usually call silence.”

author: Simone de Beauvoir
title: “It is in the knowledge of the genuine conditions of our lives that we must draw our strength to live and our reasons for living.”

author: Alyson Noel,
title: “While we may judge things as good or bad, karma doesn't. It's a simple case of like gets like, the ultimate balancing act, nothing more, nothing less. And if you're deteremined to fix every situation you deem as bad, or difficult, or somehow unsavory, then you rob the person of their own chance to fix it, learn from it, or even grow from it. Some things, no matter how painful, happen for a reason. A reason you or I may not be able to grasp at first sight, not without knowing a person's entire life story—their cumulative past. And to just barge in and interfere, no matter how well-intentioned, would be akin to robbing them of their journey. Something that's better not done.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Stop comparing yourself to others. Always strive to improve yourself to become better today than you were yesterday to serve those around you and the world.”

author: Joseph Conrad
title: “Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear”

author: Pat Conroy,
title: “I wanted to become the seeker, the aroused and passionate explorer, and it was better to go at it knowing nothing at all, always choosing the unmarked bottle, always choosing your own unproven method, armed with nothing but faith and a belief in astonishment.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “In the final analysis it is between you and God, it was never between you and them anyway.”

author: Orson Scott Card,
title: “You’re not a human being until you value something more than the life of your body. And the greater the thing you live and die for the greater you are.”

author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
title: “Music, my rampart and my only one.”

author: Lindy West
title: “Don’t tell thin women to eat a cheeseburger. Don’t tell fat women to put down the fork. Don’t tell underweight men to bulk up. Don’t tell women with facial hair to wax, don’t tell uncircumcised men they’re gross, don’t tell muscular women to go easy on the dead-lift, don’t tell dark-skinned women to bleach their vagina, don’t tell black women to relax their hair, don’t tell flat-chested women to get breast implants, don’t tell “apple-shaped” women what’s “flattering,” don’t tell mothers to hide their stretch marks, and don’t tell people whose toes you don’t approve of not to wear flip-flops. And so on, etc, etc, in every iteration until the mountains crumble to the sea. Basically, just go ahead and CEASE telling other human beings what they “should” and “shouldn't” do with their bodies unless a) you are their doctor, or b) SOMEBODY GODDAMN ASKED YOU.”

author: Santosh Kalwar,
title: “Every single desire can lead to dream and every single dream has possibility to become reality.”

author: Suzy Kassem,
title: “REMEMBER YOUR GREATNESS

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “Cake is happiness! If you know the way of the cake, you know the way of happiness! If you have a cake in front of you, you should not look any further for joy!”

author: Sarah McLachlan
title: “We're constantly being told what other people think we are, and that's why it is so important to know yourself.”

author: Catherine Doherty
title: “What you do matters — but not much. What you

author: Myles Munroe,
title: “You must decide if you are going to rob the world or bless it with the rich, valuable, potent, untapped resources locked away within you.”

author: Rachel Naomi Remen,
title: “Most of us lead far more meaningful lives than we know. Often finding meaning is not about doing things differently; it is about seeing familiar things in new ways. ”

author: Dean Koontz,
title: “When we make our own misery we sometimes cling to it even when we want so bad to change, because misery is something we know. The misery is comfortable.”

author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib A.S
title: “You must be humble, as it is one of the greatest [forms of] worship.”

author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib A.S
title: “Not to have a thing is less humiliating than to beg it.”

author: Chris Brady
title: “No guts, no story.”

author: Stan Lee
title: “Coming from your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man!”

author: Violet Weingarten
title: “Is life too short to be taking this shit, or is life too short to be minding it?”

author: Mya Robarts,
title: “The human touch is that little snippet of physical affection that brings a bit of comfort, support, and kindness. It doesn’t take much from the one who gives it, but can make a huge difference in the one who receives it.”

author: Richard Bach
title: “The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.”

author: Stan Lee
title: “Nuff said!”

author: Cecelia Ahern,
title: “life's kind of like a painting. A really bizarre, abstract painting. You could look at it and think that all it is, is a blur. And you could continue living your life thinking that all it is, is just a blur. But if you really look at it, really see it, focus on it, and use your imagination, life can become so much more. The painting could be of the sea, the sky, people,buildings, a butterfly on a flower, or anything except the blur you were once convinced it was.”

author: Sharon Creech,
title: “Sometimes you know in your heart you love someone, but you have to go away before your head can figure it out.”

author: Emery Allen
title: “You don't need another Human Being to make your life complete, but let's be honest. Having your wounds kissed by someone who doesn't see them as disasters In your soul, but cracks to put their love into, Is the most calming thing In this World.”

author: Lemony Snicket
title: “In love, as in life, one misheard word can be tremendously important. If you tell someone you love them, for instance, you must be absolutely certain that they have replied "I love you back" and not "I love your back" before you continue the conversation.”

author: George Bernard Shaw,
title: “What you are to do without me I cannot imagine.”

author: Alex Flinn,
title: “I love you, I thought. But I didn’t say it. It was not that I feared she would laugh in my face. She was far too kind for that. My fear was a greater one— that she won’t say it back.”

author: Milan Kundera,
title: “Tomas did not realize at the time that metaphors are dangerous. Metaphors are not to be trifled with. A single metaphor can give birth to love.”

author: Tasaro,
title: “...mencintai itu, kadang mengumpulkan segala tabiat menyebalkan dari seseorang yang engkau cintai, memakinya, merasa tak sanggup lagi menjadi yang terbaik untuk dirinya, dan berpikir tak ada lagi jalan kembali, tapi tetap saja engkau tak sanggup benar-benar meninggalkannya.”

author: Michel Foucault
title: “The strategic adversary is fascism... the fascism in us all, in our heads and in our everyday behavior, the fascism that causes us to love power, to desire the very thing that dominates and exploits us.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “I loved you long before you loved me. It's the only thing I have you beat at, and I'll bring it up every chance I get.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “Maybe we shouldn't be looking for love. Maybe we should be looking for a person. Because maybe you can find love in a person, but not have that person. So if you look for love, what you will find is love. But if you want to belong to someone, and you want someone to belong to you, you should look for a person.”

author: Mercedes Lackey,
title: “The great love is gone. There are still little loves - friend to friend, brother to sister, student to teacher. Will you deny yourself comfort at the hearthfire of a cottage because you may no longer sit by the fireplace of a palace? Will you deny yourself to those who reach out to you in hopes of warming themselves at your hearthfire?”

author: Kiera Cass,
title: “It's the most wonderful and terrible thing that can ever happen to you," she said simply. "You know that you've found something amazing, and you want to hold on to it forever; and every second after you have it, you fear the moment you might lose it."

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “Doubt thou the stars are fire;

author: Kahlil Gibran,
title: “When love beckons to you, follow him,

author: Suzanne Collins
title: “Having an eye for beauty isn't the same thing as a weakness...except possibly when it comes to you.”

author: Gaston Leroux,
title: “Know that it is a corpse who loves you and adores you and will never, never leave you!...Look, I am not laughing now, crying, crying for you, Christine, who have torn off my mask and who therefore can never leave me again!...Oh, mad Christine, who wanted to see me!”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “You know," he said, "under normal circumstances, you inviting me to the bedroom would be the highlight of my day."

author: Ayn Rand
title: “Love should be treated like a business deal, but every business deal has its own terms and its own currency. And in love, the currency is virtue. You love people not for what you do for them or what they do for you. You love them for the values, the virtues, which they have achieved in their own character.”

author: Heather Hepler Love Maybe
title: “When you really love someone, you see all their mess and their brokenness and you love them anyway. In fact, seeing all of that sort of makes you love them more.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “In God there is no hunger that needs to be filled, only plenteousness that desires to give.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Love is on every side, and no one's side. Don't ask what Love can do for you.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Fear can’t be reasoned with. Neither can hate. They’re like love. They’re almost identical emotions. That’s why Ares and Aphrodite like each other. Their twin sons – Fear and Panic – were spawned from both war and love.”

author: Robin LaFevers,
title: “One heart cannot serve two masters.”

author: Lois Lowry,
title: “Things could change, Gabe," Jonas went on. "Things could be different. I don't know how, but there must be some way for things to be different. There could be colors. And grandparents," he added, staring through the dimness toward the ceiling of his sleepingroom. "And everybody would have the memories."

author: Friedrich Nietzsche,
title: “Love, too, has to be learned.”

author: Richard Bach
title: “The opposite of Loneliness is not Togetherness , It's Intimacy”

author: Boris Pasternak,
title: “You and I, it's as though we have been taught to kiss in heaven and sent down to earth together, to see if we know what we were taught.”

author: Andrea Gibson
title: “I would kiss you in the middle of the ocean during a lightning storm cuz I'd rather be left for﻿ dead than wondering what thunder sounds like.”

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “I don’t love you as if you were the salt-rose, topaz

author: Stephanie Perkins,
title: “Yes, St. Claire. I like you. But I can't say it aloud, because he's my friend. And friends don't let other friends make drunken declarations and expect them to act upon them the next day”

author: George Sand
title: “There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.”

author: Stephenie Meyer,
title: “You know I love you right?”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Value your parabatai," he said. "For it is a precious bond. All love is precious. It is why we do what we do. Why do we fight demons? Why are they not fit custodians of this world? What makes us better? It is because they do not build, but destroy. They do not love, but hate only. We are human and fallible, we Shadowhunters. But if we did not have the capability to love, we could not guard humans; we must love to guard them. My parabatai, he loved like few ever could love, with all and everything. I see you are like that too; it burns more brightly in you than the fire of Heaven”

author: Eartha Kitt
title: “It’s all about falling in love with yourself and sharing that love with someone who appreciates you, rather than looking for love to compensate for a self love deficit.”

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “And there is my payment the rubies in your cheeks. Are you properly scandalized by your wicked behavior? If you were Catholic, you'd singe the ears of the priest you confessed to. Do you remember making me swear to repeat all those naughty actions agian, no matter what you said this morning?"

author: Tahereh Mafi,
title: “Lift your hips for me, love.”

author: Hafiz
title: “Your love should never be offered to the mouth of a Stranger / Only to someone who has the valor and daring to cut pieces of their soul off with a knife / Then weave them into a blanket to protect you.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “For some people, “the point of no return” begins at the very moment their souls become aware of each others’ existence.”

author: Marie Lu,
title: “Day leans in toward me. He reaches up to touch my face. I can tell it still hurts him to use his fingers, and his nails are dark with dried blood. "You're brilliant," he says. "But you're a fool to stay wish someone like me."

author: Toni Morrison,
title: “In this here place, we flesh; flesh that weeps, laughs; flesh that dances on bare feet in grass. Love it. Love it hard. Yonder they do not love your flesh. They despise it. They don't love your eyes; they'd just as soon pick em out. No more do they love the skin on your back. Yonder they flay it. And O my people they do not love your hands. Those they only use, tie, bind, chop off and leave empty. Love your hands! Love them. Raise them up and kiss them. Touch others with them, pat them together, stroke them on your face 'cause they don't love that either. You got to love it, you! And no, they ain't in love with your mouth. Yonder, out there, they will see it broken and break it again. What you say out of it they will not heed. What you scream from it they do not hear. What you put into it to nourish your body they will snatch away and give you leavins instead. No, they don't love your mouth. You got to love it. This is flesh I'm talking about here. Flesh that needs to be loved. Feet that need to rest and to dance; backs that need support; shoulders that need arms, strong arms I'm telling you. And O my people, out yonder, hear me, they do not love your neck unnoosed and straight. So love your neck; put a hand on it, grace it, stroke it and hold it up. and all your inside parts that they'd just as soon slop for hogs, you got to love them. The dark, dark liver--love it, love it and the beat and beating heart, love that too. More than eyes or feet. More than lungs that have yet to draw free air. More than your life-holding womb and your life-giving private parts, hear me now, love your heart. For this is the prize.”

author: Patrick Rothfuss,
title: “Denna is a wild thing," I explained. "Like a hind or a summer storm. If a storm blows down your house, or breaks a tree, you don't say the storm was mean. It was cruel. It acted according to its nature and something unfortunately was hurt. The same is true of Denna.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “I know I want you," he heard himself say, all his vows and his honor all forgotten. She stood before him naked as her name day, and he was as hard as the rock around them. He had been in her half a hundred times by now, but always beneath furs, with others all around them. He had never seeen how beautiful she was. Her legs were skinny and well muscled, the hair at the juncture of her thighs a brighter red than that on her head. Does that make it even luckier? He pulled her close.

author: Zadie Smith
title: “Time is how you spend your love.”

author: Robert James Waller,
title: “It's clear to me now that I have been moving toward you and you toward me for a long time. Though neither of us was aware of the other before we met, there was a kind of mindless certainty bumming blithely along beneath our ignorance that ensured we would come together. Like two solitary birds flying the great prairies by celestial reckoning, all of these years and lifetimes we have been moving toward one another.”

author: Audrey Niffenegger,
title: “‎I never wanted to have anything in my life that I couldn't stand losing. But it's too late for that.”

author: Marilyn Vos Savant
title: “I believe that love--not imitation--is the sincerest form of flattery. Your imitator thinks that you can be duplicated; your lover knows you can't.”

author: Michael Morpurgo,
title: “I can hate you more, but I'll never love you less.”

author: Tina Reber,
title: “I never understood how men could remember all those details about sports but, yet, were incapable of remembering where they set their car keys or wallet.”

author: Alexandra Adornetto,
title: “I prayed for all his dreams to come true. I prayed that I would always be able to connect with him--even if I was no longer on earth.”

author: Ellen  Hopkins,
title: “Real love finds you once, if you're lucky.”

author: Nizar Qabbani
title: “My lover asks me:

author: فریدون مشیری / Fereydoon Moshiri
title: “بیمار خنده های توام بیشتر بخند

author: Rachel Hawthorne,
title: “Falling in love should be the easiest thing in the world, but it's not.”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “Maybe you expected marriage to be perfect - I guess that's where you and I are different. See, I thought it would be all about making mistakes, but doing it with someone who's there to remind you what you learned along the way.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “I have come to the conclusion never again to think of marrying, and for this reason, I can never be satisfied with anyone who would be blockhead enough to have me.”

author: Sunshine O'Donnell,
title: “Love is an engraved invitation to grief.”

author: Carl Sagan,
title: “In the vastness of space and the immensity of time, it is my joy to share a planet and an epoch with Annie.

author: Colleen Houck
title: “Wow. I didn’t think it was possible for him to look any more intoxicating than he already did. But a leather clad Ren standing next to the gorgeous racing motorcycle holding his helmet made my brain go numb. I had kind of a this-is-your-brain-on-drugs moment, only mine was more like a this-is-your-brain-on-seeing-Ren-in-tight-leather moment. If they’d been smart, the Ducati Company should have used him in a commercial and given him the bike for free.”

author: Tasha Alexander,
title: “It's delicious to have people adore you, but it's exhausting, too. Particularly when your own feelings don't match theirs.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.”

author: Katy Perry
title: “You think I'm pretty

author: Dean Koontz,
title: “Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.”

author: Alan Moore,
title: “Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.”

author: C. J. Cherryh
title: “Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!”

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: “The life given us, by nature is short; but the memory of a well-spent life is eternal.”

author: Joyce Carol Oates
title: “A daydreamer is prepared for most things.”

author: Roberto Bolaño,
title: “Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “If the moon smiled, she would resemble you.

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Don't let the muggles get you down.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked.

author: Toni Morrison
title: “You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “I just want to be wonderful.”

author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
title: “However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”

author: Robert Frost
title: “The best way out is always through.”

author: Ned Vizzini,
title: “I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “I like people too much or not at all. I've got to go down deep, to fall into people, to really know them.”

author: Alice McDermott
title: “We are surrounded by story.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Moths," repeats Will. "You're afraid of moths?"

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
title: “To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced

author: Ray Bradbury,
title: “We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?”

author: Garth Stein,
title: “[T]he race is long - to finish first, first you must finish.”

author: Melissa Marr,
title: “We are what we are, neither a good or as bad as others paint us. And what we are doesn't change how truly we feel, only how free we are to follow those feelings.”

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: “At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us.”

author: Tan Malaka
title: “Idealisme adalah kemewahan terakhir yang hanya dimiliki oleh pemuda.”

author: E.A. Bucchianeri,
title: “Well, if it can be thought, it can be done, a problem can be overcome,”

author: Thomas A. Edison
title: “Study, along the lines which the theologies have mapped, will never lead us to discovery of the fundamental facts of our existence. That goal must be attained by means of exact science and can only be achieved by such means. The fact that man, for ages, has superstitiously believed in what he calls a God does not prove at all that his theory has been right. There have been many gods – all makeshifts, born of inability to fathom the deep fundamental truth. There must be something at the bottom of existence, and man, in ignorance, being unable to discover what it is through reason, because his reason has been so imperfect, undeveloped, has used, instead, imagination, and created figments, of one kind or another, which, according to the country he was born in, the suggestions of his environment, satisfied him for the time being. Not one of all the gods of all the various theologies has ever really been proved. We accept no ordinary scientific fact without the final proof; why should we, then, be satisfied in this most mighty of all matters, with a mere theory?

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.”

author: Douglas Coupland,
title: “And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?”

author: Jonathan Ames,
title: “I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained.”

author: Sarah   Williams,
title: “Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light;

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: “The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?”

author: Stephen King,
title: “A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.”

author: Stephen R. Covey,
title: “But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
title: “Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer
title: “I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”

author: Charles Bukowski
title: “There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out

author: David Mitchell,
title: “Dreams are shores where the ocean of spirit meets the land of matter. Dreams are beaches where the yet-to-be, the once-were, the will-never-be may walk awhile with the still are.”

author: Ezra Taft Benson
title: “My young sisters, we have such hope for you. We have such great expectations for you. Don't settle for less than what the Lord wants you to be...

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Do not try to explain feelings. Live everything intensely and treasure what you feel as a gift from God.”

author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni,
title: “I am buoyant and expansive and uncontainable--but I always was so, only I never knew it!”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Only children believe they're capable of everything.”

author: Cecelia Ahern,
title: “at your weakest, you end up showing more strength; at your lowest, you are suddenly lifted higher than you’ve ever been. They all border one another, these opposites and show how quickly we can be altered.”

author: Brené Brown,
title: “Vulnerability is not weakness, and the uncertainty, risk, and emotional exposure we face every day are not optional. Our only choice is a question of engagement. Our willingness to own and engage with our vulnerability determines the depth of our courage and the clarity of our purpose; the level to which we protect ourselves from being vulnerable is a measure of our fear and disconnection.”

author: Anaïs Nin,
title: “I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.”

author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,
title: “I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.”

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “You cannot pick and choose what parts of her to love.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.”

author: Groucho Marx
title: “Humor is reason gone mad.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!”

author: Jarod Kintz,
title: “I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.”

author: Bruce Lee
title: “I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.”

author: Sarah Vowell,
title: “Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now."

author: Maya Angelou
title: “Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!

author: Epicurus
title: “Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.”

author: Neil Jordan,
title: “Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?”

author: Ernest Hemingway,
title: “All thinking men are atheists.”

author: Amie Kaufman,
title: “The universe was here before you, and it will go on after you. The only way it will remember you is if you do something worthy of remembrance.”

author: Steven Erikson,
title: “The heart of wisdom is tolerance.”

author: Forrest Curran
title: “For your past, for your flaws, and ultimately for your stress; I judge no one whom I’ve met along the way because in a sense we were all wounded in our own ways.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Simplify your life. You don't grow spiritual, you shrink spiritual.”

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: “To oppose something is to maintain it... You must go somewhere else; you must have another goal; then you walk a different road.”

author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi,
title: “Most parents try really hard to give their kids the best possible life. They give them the best food and clothes they can afford, take their own kind of take on training kids to be honest and polite. But what they don't realize is no matter how much they try, their kids will get out there. Out to this complicated little world. If they are lucky they will survive, through backstabbers, broken hearts, failures and all the kinds of invisible insane pressures out there. But most kids get lost in them. They will get caught up in all kinds of bubbles. Trouble bubbles. Bubbles that continuously tell them that they are not good enough. Bubbles that get them carried away with what they think is love, give them broken hearts. Bubbles that will blur the rest of the world to them, make them feel like that is it, that they've reached the end. Sometimes, even the really smart kids, make stupid decisions. They lose control. Parents need to realize that the world is getting complicated every second of every day. With new problems, new diseases, new habits. They have to realize the vast probability of their kids being victims of this age, this complicated era. Your kids could be exposed to problems that no kind of therapy can help. Your kids could be brainwashed by themselves to believe in insane theories that drive them crazy. Most kids will go through this stage. The lucky ones will understand. They will grow out of them. The unlucky ones will live in these problems. Grow in them and never move forward. They will cut themselves, overdose on drugs, take up excessive drinking and smoking, for the slightest problems in their lives.

author: Walter Mosley
title: “The first thing you have to know about writing is that it is something you must do everyday. There are two reasons for this rule: Getting the work done and connecting with your unconscious mind.”

author: Natalie Goldberg,
title: “I write because I am alone and move through the world alone. No one will know what has passed through me... I write because there are stories that people have forgotten to tell, because I am a woman trying to stand up in my life... I write out of hurt and how to make hurt okay; how to make myself strong and come home, and it may be the only real home I'll ever have.”

author: Hugh MacLeod
title: “The only people who can change the world are people who want to. And not everybody does.”

author: Forrest Curran,
title: “We become so absorbed in our flaws and faults that we forget that it is better to be a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without. To have flaws is beauty in itself, a fact so frightening that we hurry to hide them from sight and tarnish the whole in the process of comparing ourselves to others.”

author: Forrest Curran,
title: “As I naturally go through a full range of emotions in my life, I mustn’t feel ashamed for feeling lost, for it is honest and human to feel such.”

author: Forrest Curran
title: “One day in my shoes and a day for me in your shoes, the beauty of travel lies in the ease and willingness to be more open.”

author: Forrest Curran,
title: “Some we proudly display on our arms, while others we shyly conceal. Tattoo the moments of sorrow as well as the moments of splendor and beauty. Tattoo in an acknowledgment and tribute to home, and tattooing your beliefs that define who you are. Whether we intended to or not, every moment of our lives are tattooed to our heart.”

author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,
title: “I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.”

author: Walt Whitman
title: “Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.”

author: Lemony Snicket
title: “If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.”

author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,
title: “The Secret Garden was what Mary called it when she was thinking of it. She liked the name, and she liked still more the feeling that when its beautiful old walls shut her in no one knew where she was. It seemed almost like being shut out of the world in some fairy place. The few books she had read and liked had been fairy-story books, and she had read of secret gardens in some of the stories. Sometimes people went to sleep in them for a hundred years, which she had thought must be rather stupid. She had no intention of going to sleep, and, in fact, she was becoming wider awake every day which passed at Misselthwaite.”

author: Faraaz Kazi
title: “Beauty is the only human aspect which cannot be captured on any canvas howsoever hard an artist tries. At the most, the undaunted artist can replicate the beauty on paper but what is a replica in comparison to the original! The humbling resemblance can only be respected, not truly adored.

author: William S. Burroughs
title: “A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. ”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.”

author: Walter Tevis
title: “I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”

author: Thomas Pynchon
title: “Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.”

author: Zora Neale Hurston
title: “Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.”

author: Margaret Atwood,
title: “Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.”

author: جبران خليل جبران
title: “لا تجالس أنصاف العشاق، ولا تصادق أنصاف الأصدقاء، لا تقرأ لأنصاف الموهوبين،لا تعش نصف حياة، ولا تمت نصف موت،لا تختر نصف حل، ولا تقف في منتصف الحقيقة، لا تحلم نصف حلم، ولا تتعلق بنصف أمل، إذا صمتّ.. فاصمت حتى النهاية، وإذا تكلمت.. فتكلّم حتى النهاية، لا تصمت كي تتكلم، ولا تتكلم كي تصمت.

author: John Green,
title: “When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.”

author: Edmund Burke
title: “Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Accept yourself, your strengths, your weaknesses, your truths, and know what tools you have to fulfill your purpose.”

author: Douglas Adams,
title: “He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.”

author: Anne Sexton,
title: “Watch out for intellect,

author: Lemony Snicket,
title: “Well-read people are less likely to be evil.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.”

author: Marvin Bell
title: “Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.”

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
title: “The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “There are much worse games to play.”

author: Gertrude Stein
title: “We are always the same age inside. ”

author: Virginia Woolf
title: “I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “I restore myself when I'm alone.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “No good deed goes unpunished.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “We pencil-sketch our previous life so we can contrast it to the technicolor of the moment. ”

author: Cameron Dokey,
title: “Unhappy memories are persistent. They're specific, and it's the details that refuse to leave us alone. Though a happy memory may stay with you just as long as one that makes you miserable, what you remember softens over time. What you recall is simply that you were happy, not necessarily the individual moments that brought about your joy.

author: Spencer W. Kimball
title: “Jesus said several times, “Come, follow me.” His was a program of “do what I do,” rather than “do what I say.” His innate brilliance would have permitted him to put on a dazzling display, but that would have left his followers far behind. He walked and worked with those he was to serve. His was not a long-distance leadership. He was not afraid of close friendships; he was not afraid that proximity to him would disappoint his followers. The leaven of true leadership cannot lift others unless we are with and serve those to be led.”

author: Laurell K. Hamilton,
title: “No name-calling truly bites deep unless, in some dark part of us, we believe it. If we are confident enough then it is just noise.”

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
title: “We're miserable because we think that we are mere individuals, alone with our fears and flaws and resentment and mortality.”

author: Marjane Satrapi,
title: “I want to be justice, love and the wrath of God all in one.”

author: Jimmy Buffett
title: “I'd rather die while I'm living than live while I'm dead. ”

author: Gabriel García Márquez,
title: “Muchos años después, frente al pelotón de fusilamiento, el coronel Aureliano Buendía había de recordar aquella tarde remota en que su padre lo llevó a conocer el hielo. Macondo era entonces una aldea de 20 casas de barro y cañabrava construidas a la orilla de un río de aguas diáfanas que se precipitaban por un lecho de piedras pulidas, blancas y enormes como huevos prehistóricos. El mundo era tan reciente, que muchas cosas carecían de nombre, y para mencionarlas había que señalarlas con el dedo".”

author: Winston S. Churchill
title: “This is not the end, this is not even the beginning of the end, this is just perhaps the end of the beginning.”

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: “When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy”

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: “Only when we give joyfully, without hesitation or thought of gain, can we truly know what love means.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Have to? Of course you have to! But only because of you, Harry, won't rest until Voldemort is finished! Think now, for once, if you have never heard of the prophecy! What would you do?”

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,
title: “In the end, you feel that your much-vaunted, inexhaustible fantasy is growing tired, debilitated, exhausted, because you're bound to grow out of your old ideals; they're smashed to splinters and turn to dust, and if you have no other life, you have no choice but to keep rebuilding your dreams from the splinters and dust. But the heart longs for something different! And it is vain to dig in the ashes of your old fancies, trying to find even a tiny spark to fan into a new flame that will warm the chilled heart and bring back to life everything that can send the blood rushing wildly through the body, fill the eyes with tears--everything that can delude you so well!”

author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,
title: “Words were different when they lived inside of you.”

author: John Green,
title: “I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “You're a guardian angel now." I was still too much in awe to wrap my mind around it, but at the same time I felt amazement, curiosity...happiness.

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?"

author: Betty Smith,
title: “Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.”

author: Steve Jobs
title: “Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.”

author: Stephen King
title: “Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.”

author: Mae West
title: “When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. ”

author: Hank Green
title: “Read books. Care about things. Get excited. Try not to be too down on youself. Enjoy the ever present game of knowing.”

author: Alex Sanchez
title: “The pressures on gay teens can be overwhelming--to keep secrets, tell lies, deny who you are, and try to be who you're not. Remember: you are special and worth being cared about, loved, and accepted just as you are. Never, ever let anyone convince you otherwise.”

author: Marilyn Monroe,
title: “just because you fail once, it doesn't mean you're going to fail at everything. keep trying, hold on, and always, always, always believe in yourself because if you don't, then who will? so keep your head high, keep your chin up, and most importantly, keep smiling because life's a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.”

author: Aidan Chambers,
title: “I thought how lovely and how strange a river is. A river is a river, always there, and yet the water flowing through it is never the same water and is never still. It’s always changing and is always on the move. And over time the river itself changes too. It widens and deepens as it rubs and scours, gnaws and kneads, eats and bores its way through the land. Even the greatest rivers- the Nile and the Ganges, the Yangtze and he Mississippi, the Amazon and the great grey-green greasy Limpopo all set about with fever trees-must have been no more than trickles and flickering streams before they grew into mighty rivers.

author: Libba Bray
title: “I change the world, the world changes me.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “If I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.”

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: “Inspiration comes of working every day.”

author: Julie Garwood,
title: “A woman can't do anything about her appearance. Either she's pretty or she isn't. But her character is quite another matter.”

author: Les Brown
title: “Align yourself with people that you can learn from, people who want more out of life, people who are stretching and searching and seeking some higher ground in life.”

author: Sara Raasch,
title: “The most powerful magic of all is choice.”

author: Spencer Johnson,
title: “He knew sometimes some fear can be good. When you are afraid things are going to get worse if you don't do something, it can prompt you into action. But it is not good when you are afraid that it keeps you from doing anything.”

author: Steve Maraboli,

title: “Personally, I like it much better when someone else does the decision making. That way you have legitimate grounds to whine and complain. I tend to find both whining and complaining quite interesting and amusing, though sometimes--unfortunately--it's hard to choose which one of the two I want to do.

title: “I've tried to get the angel to watch MTV so I can learn the vocabulary of your music, but even with the gift of tongues, I'm having trouble learning to speak hip-hop. Why is it that one can busta rhyme or busta move anywhere but you must busta cap in someone's ass? Is "ho" always feminine, and "muthafucka" always masculine, while "bitch" can be either? How many peeps in a posse, how much booty before baby got back, do you have to be all that to get all up in that, and do I need to be dope and phat to be da bomb or can I just be "stupid"? I'll not be singing over any dead mothers until I understand.”

author: Jean Kerr
title: “Do you know how helpless you feel if you have a full cup of coffee in your hand and you start to sneeze? ”

That's his job!”

title: “There must be a mistake," I said.

author: Rachel Caine,

author: Rick Riordan,

author: Terry Pratchett,

author: Jerome K. Jerome,

author: Harper Lee,
title: “Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.”

author: Jeanette Winterson,
title: “You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Adrian smiled and clasped my hands, taking a few steps toward me. "And as for who you are, you’re the same beautiful, brave, and ridiculously smart caffeinated fighter you’ve been since the day I met you.” Finally, he put “beautiful” at the top of his list of adjectives. Not that I should have cared.

title: “The only sea I saw Was the seesaw sea With you riding on it. Lie down, lie easy. Let me shipwreck in your thighs.”

title: “Sometimes I turn around and catch the smell of you and I cannot go on I cannot fucking go on without expressing this terrible so fucking awful physical aching fucking longing I have for you. And I cannot believe that I can feel this for you and you feel nothing. Do you feel nothing?”

He’d been wounded far, far worse and shrugged it off. But then, there had been no woman with sun kissed by the sunset and eyes of storm gray to tear into him for daring to get himself hurt.”

author: Colleen Houck
title: “I felt overwhelmed. I didn’t expect a first kiss to be so…life altering. In a few brief moments, the rule book of my universe had been rewritten. Suddenly I was a brand new person. I was as fragile as a newborn, but instead of the doctor placing me in my mother’s arms, he’d put me in Ren’s. What would Ren do with me? Would he draw me near, soothe me, and teach me about this new world or would he reject me and tell the doctor there must be some mistake. There was no way to know. What a breakable and delicate thing a heart was, no wonder I’d kept mine locked away.”

author: Tera Lynn Childs,
title: “I don't believe it,' Quince says with absolute certainty. ' I don't believe anything magical can make someone more in love.' [...] He looks me right in the eye as he says, 'Love is already the strongest magic in the world.”

author: Lance Armstrong,
title: “The night before brain surgery, I thought about death. I searched out my larger values, and I asked myself, if I was going to die, did I want to do it fighting and clawing or in peaceful surrender? What sort of character did I hope to show? Was I content with myself and what I had done with my life so far? I decided that I was essentially a good person, although I could have been better--but at the same time I understood that the cancer didn't care.

author: Osho
title: “Love is not a relationship, love is a state of being; it has nothing to do with anybody else. One is not "in love", one is love. And of course when one is love, one is in love – but that is an outcome, a by-product, that is not the source. The source is that one is love.”

author: Marie Sexton
title: “You can’t control what others think. The only thing you can control is yourself. Some people will look down on you for your choices in life, no matter what they are. You can’t do anything about that. The only thing you can do is decide how to live your own life. And to hell with everybody else”

author: Frederick William Faber
title: “There are souls in this world who have the gift of finding joy everywhere, and leaving it behind them when they go.”

title: “Secangkir kopi yang dengan tenang menunggu kau minum itu tidak pernah mengusut kenapa kau bisa membedakan aromanya dari asap yang setiap hari kau hirup ketika berangkat dan pulang kerja di kota yang semakin tidak bisa mengerti kenapa mesti ada secangkir kopi yang tersedia di atas meja setiap pagi”

author: Confucius
title: “No lake so still but it has its wave.

author: Cath Crowley,
title: “If you don't want a generation of robots, fund the arts!”

author: John Piper
title: “Your daddy is standing in a swimming pool out a little bit from the edge. You are, let’s say, three years old and standing on the edge of the pool. Daddy holds out his arms to you and says, “Jump, I’ll catch you. I promise.” Now, how do you make your daddy look good at that moment? Answer: trust him and jump. Have faith in him and jump. That makes him look strong and wise and loving. But if you won’t jump, if you shake your head and run away from the edge, you make your daddy look bad. It looks like you are saying, “he can’t catch me” or “he won’t catch me” or “it’s not a good idea to do what he tells me to do.” And all three of those make your dad look bad.

author: Billy Graham
title: “We are the Bibles the world is reading; We are the creeds the world is needing; We are the sermons the world is heeding.”

author: Theodore Roosevelt

author: Colleen Houck,
title: “Pulling the chair out for me, he invited me to sit.

author: R.J. Palacio,
title: “I think we're too young to be dating. I mean I don't see what the rush is." Summer says.

author: Jen Campbell,
title: “CUSTOMER: Do you have this children's book I've heard about? It's supposed to be very good. It's called "Lionel Richie and the Wardrobe.”

author: John Green
title: “I don't know where people got the idea that characters in books are supposed to be likable. Books are not in the business of creating merely likeable characters with whom you can have some simple identification with. Books are in the business of creating great stories that make you're brain go ahhbdgbdmerhbergurhbudgerbudbaaarr.”

author: Rachel Hawkins,
title: “You know, I can see more than just the future or the past."

author: Jennifer Crusie
title: “Heartache often drives us to consume things we wouldn't otherwise, such as an entire pint of Caramel Pecan Perfection high-fat ice cream, covered in ganache, the crack cocaine of frozed dairy. Twelve hundred calories per pint, six hundred and eighty of which are fat calories, but is only dulls the pain for the moment, there's that carb fog while you're standing at the sink shoving it in your face, and then it's over and you feel...used. Like a cheap pickup the Dove people seduced and abandoned in your kitchen, leaving you with sticky hands and an empty cup and a still-broken heart, except now you're mad at Dove, too.”

author: Jim Butcher,
title: “I'm amazing and studly, but I have limits.”

author: Johannes Brahms
title: “If there is anyone here whom I have not insulted, I beg his pardon.”

author: John R Lindensmith

author: Laurell K. Hamilton,

author: Wodehouse

author: Meg Cabot,
title: “This was very exciting. I'd never had two boys get into a fight over me before. The fact that one of the boys was my stepbrother, however, and held about as much romantic appeal for me as Max, the family dog, somewhat dampened my enthusiasm. And Michael wasn't much of a catch, either, when you actually thought about it, being a potential murderer and all. Oh, why did I have to have such a couple of losers fighting over me? Why couldn't Matt Damon and Ben Affleck fight over me? Now that would be truly excellent.”

author: Marjane Satrapi,
title: “You are putting yourself in serious danger...'

author: Yogi Berra
title: “I'd give my right arm to be ambidextrous.”

author: Bohumil Hrabal,
title: “He was a gentle and sensitive soul, and therefore had a short temper, which is why he went straight after everything with an ax...”

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “I don't mind foreigners. God save the queen!" he squeaked and ran.”

author: W. Somerset Maugham
title: “If 50 million people say something foolish, it is still foolish.”

author: Yogi Berra
title: “We made too many wrong mistakes.”

author: A.A. Milne,
title: “When I was One,

title: “How do you deal with it?" Kami asked Jared. "The laughing at nothing and occasionally stopping dead in your tracks."

author: Suzy Toronto,
title: “Life is All About How you Handle Plan B

author: Louise Rennison,

author: Morrissey
title: “I don't mind if you forget me.

author: Selena Gomez
title: “Everything happens for a reason and, something better will come along for me!”

author: Deb Caletti,
title: “I shouldn't have to be a liar to make someone love me. I shouldn't be so afraid of losing someone that I'll do anything to make them stay.”

author: Sherry Argov,
title: “That's the big picture, your happiness. And health. You should never care what a man thinks of you -- until he demonstrates to you that he cares about making you happy. If he isn't trying to make you happy, then send him back from "whence" he came because winning him over will have no benefit. At the end of the day, happines, joy...and yes...your emotional stability...those comprise the only measuring stick you really need to have.”

author: Rebecca Solnit,
title: “The desire to go home that is a desire to be whole, to know where you are, to be the point of intersection of all the lines drawn through all the stars, to be the constellation-maker and the center of the world, that center called love. To awaken from sleep, to rest from awakening, to tame the animal, to let the soul go wild, to shelter in darkness and blaze with light, to cease to speak and be perfectly understood.”

author: Molly Ringle,
title: “And I got out of there without punching anyone, kicking anyone, or breaking down in tears. Some days the small victories are all you achieve.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “Love is bullshit. Emotion is bullshit. I am a rock. A jerk. I'm an uncaring asshole and proud of it.”

author: Roman Payne,
title: “Mine was the twilight and the morning. Mine was a world of rooftops and love songs.”

author: David Mitchell,
title: “We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love.”

author: Antonio Porchia
title: “I know what I have given you...

author: Megan Whalen Turner,
title: “He didn't marry you to become king. He became king because he wanted to marry you.”

author: Libba Bray,

author: Anne Fortier,
title: “There is lust and then there is love. They are related, but still very different things. To indulge in one requires little but honeyed speech and a change of clothes; to obtain the other, by contrast, a man must give up his rib. In return, his woman will undo the sin of Eve, and bring him back into Paradise.”

title: “I want your most vital organ. I want it to be mine.”

author: Santosh Kalwar
title: “No human should mislead another by promising them something they know to be untrue.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “I don't care," said Seth. "I would have done it. I would have sold my soul for you. You and me...I told you. Something's always going to keep us near each other...even if we aren't together.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Set the standard! Stop expecting others to show you love, acceptance, commitment, & respect when you don't even show that to yourself.”

author: Karen Kingsbury

author: Adrienne Rich,
title: “No one has imagined us. We want to live like trees,

author: Tere Liye,
title: “Lepaskanlah. Maka besok lusa, jika dia cinta sejatimu, dia pasti akan kembali dengan cara mengagumkan. Ada saja takdir hebat yang tercipta untuk kita. Jika dia tidak kembali, maka sederhana jadinya, itu bukan cinta sejatimu. Hei, kisah-kisah cinta di dalam buku itu, di dongeng-dongeng cinta, atau hikayat orang tua, itu semua ada penulisnya.

author: Emily Giffin,
title: “I love him wholly and unconditionally and without reservation. I love him enough to sacrifice a friendship. I love him enough to accept my own happiness and use it, in turn, to make him happy back.”

author: Anne Michaels,
title: “Love makes you see a place differently, just as you hold differently an object that belongs to someone you love. If you know one landscape well, you will look at all other landscapes differently. And if you learn to love one place, sometimes you can also learn to love another.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “Maybe that's it, [...] [w]ith what you were talking about before. The world being broken. Maybe it isn't that we're supposed to find the pieces and put them back together. Maybe

author: Erich Fromm,
title: “The faculty to think objectively is

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “Katniss: I’m coming back into focus when Caesar asks him if he has a girlfriend back home.

author: Jack Kerouac,
title: “So shut up, live, travel, adventure, bless and don't be sorry”

author: Louis C.K.
title: “Pamela, I’m in love with you. Yeah, it’s that bad. You’re so beautiful to me. Shut up! Lemme tell you. Let me. Every time I look at your face or even remember it, it wrecks me - and the way you are with me - and you’re just fun and you shit all over me and you make fun of me and you’re real. I don’t have enough time in any day to think about you enough. I feel like I’m going to live a thousand years cause that’s how long it’s gonna take me to have one thought about you which is that I’m crazy about you, Pamela. I don’t wanna be with anybody else. I don’t. I really don’t. I don’t think about women anymore. I think about you. I had a dream the other night that you and I were on a train. We were on this train and you were holding my hand. That’s the whole dream. You were holding my hand and I felt you holding my hand. I woke up and I couldn’t believe it wasn’t real. I’m sick in love with you, Pamela. It’s like a condition. It’s like polio. I feel like I’m gonna die if I can’t be with you. And I can’t be with you. So I’m gonna die - and I don’t care cause I was brought into existence to know you and that’s enough. The idea that you would want me back it’s like greedy.”

author: Wendy Wasserstein
title: “The trick. . .is to find the balance between the bright colors of humor and the serious issues of identity, self-loathing, and the possibility for intimacy and love when it seems no longer possible or, sadder yet, no longer necessary.”

author: John Irving,
title: “It´s natural to want someone you love to do what you want, or what you think would be good for them, but you have to let everything happen to them. You can't interfere with people you love any more than you're supposed to interfere with people you don't even know. And that's hard, ..., because you often feel like interfering -you want to be the one who makes the plans.”

author: Lucy Maud Montgomery,
title: “When I left Queen's my future seemed to stretch out before me like a straight road. I thought I could see along it for many a milestone. Now there is a bend in it. I don't know what lies around the bend, but I'm going to believe that the best does.”

author: Kazuo Ishiguro,
title: “If you are under the impression you have already perfected yourself, you will never rise to the heights you are no doubt capable of.”

author: St. Augustine
title: “In my deepest wound I saw your glory, and it dazzled me.”

author: Norton Juster,
title: “... what you learn today, for no reason at all, will help you discover all the wonderful secrets of tomorrow.”

author: Sigmund Freud,
title: “My love is something valuable to me which I ought not to throw away without reflection.”

author: Isak Dinesen

author: Ronald Regan
title: “The future doesn't belong to the light-hearted. It belongs to the brave.”

author: David Livingstone

author: Phil Lester
title: “Be yourself. Don't worry about what other people are thinking of you, because they're probably feeling the same kind of scared, horrible feelings that everyone does.”

author: Ray Bradbury
title: “Sometimes you just have to jump out the window and grow wings on the way down.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Stop blaming outside circumstances for your inside chaos.”

author: Mary Oliver,
title: “Last Night the Rain Spoke to Me"

author: Nelson Mandela
title: “I AM THE MASTER OF MY FATE AND THE CAPTAIN OF MY DESTINY.”

author: Pete Wentz
title: “Everyones greatest fantasy is to walk away from the life (they think)you lead”

author: Jackson Pearce
title: “Books didn’t make me wallow in darkness, darkness made me wallow in books.”

author: Isaac Asimov
title: “It has been my philosophy of life that difficulties vanish when faced boldly.”

author: Nancy D. Solomon
