author: Francesca Lia Block
title: “Stories are like genies...They can carry us into and though our sorrows. Sometimes they burn, sometimes they dance, sometimes they weep, sometimes they sing. Like genies, everyone has one. Like genies, sometimes we forget that we do.

author: R. Kelly
title: “I belive I can fly, I believe I can touch the sky. ”

author: Hlovate,
title: “Hidup hanya ada erti pada yang bahagia.”

author: Aaron Sorkin,
title: “Can you say why America is the greatest country in the world?

author: robert m drake
title: “Maybe I hope too much. Maybe I dream too much or maybe I love too much to just give up on you.”

author: Thomas Merton,
title: “It is therefore of supreme importance that we consent to live not for ourselves but for others. When we do this we will be able first of all to face and accept our own limitations. As long as we secretly adore ourselves, our own deficiencies will remain to torture us with an apparent defilement. But if we live for others, we will gradually discover that no expects us to be 'as gods'. We will see that we are human, like everyone else, that we all have weaknesses and deficiencies, and that these limitations of ours play a most important part in all our lives. It is because of them that we need others and others need us. We are not all weak in the same spots, and so we supplement and complete one another, each one making up in himself for the lack in another.”

author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
title: “There is no rest for the person who has envy, and there is no love for the person who has bad manners.”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “I was my own woman.

author: Criss Jami,
title: “If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.”

author: Vince Lombardi
title: “Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence”

author: Richard G. Scott
title: “We become what we want to be by consistently being what we want to become each day.”

author: Colleen Hoover,
title: “There are moments in every relationship that define when two people start to fall in love.

author: Les Brown
title: “Live out of your imagination instead of out of your memory.”

author: Aristotle
title: “Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?”

author: Rachel Caine,
title: “Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane”

author: Alyson Noel,
title: “I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.”

author: Taylor Swift
title: “This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.”

author: John Lennon
title: “I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.”

author: Carlos Castaneda
title: “You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.”

author: George Orwell
title: “The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.”

author: Markus Zusak,

title: “Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.”

author: Charles Dickens,
title: “It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.”

author: David Nicholls,
title: “This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.”

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
title: “You're something between a dream and a miracle.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.”

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,
title: “Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”

author: Jean-Paul Sartre

author: Judith McNaught,
title: “There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.”

title: “I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”

author: J.K. Rowling,

title: “I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.”

author: T.S. Eliot,

author: Jim Butcher,
title: “But there were some things I believed in. Some things I had faith in. And faith isn't about perfect attendance to services, or how much money you put on the little plate. It isn't about going skyclad to the Holy Rites, or meditating each day upon the divine.

author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley,
title: “I know it is hard for you young mothers to believe that almost before you can turn around the children will be gone and you will be alone with your husband. You had better be sure you are developing the kind of love and friendship that will be delightful and enduring. Let the children learn from your attitude that he is important. Encourage him. Be kind. It is a rough world, and he, like everyone else, is fighting to survive. Be cheerful. Don't be a whiner.”

author: Sherry Argov
title: “When a man sees you are happy with him but you can be just as happy having nothing to do with him, that’s when he won’t want to leave your side. When you are happy, you are sexy.”

author: P.C. Cast & Kristin Cast
title: “Give me strength, not to be better than my enemies, but to defeat my greatest enemy, the doubts within myself. Give me strength for a straight back and clear eyes, so when life fades, as the setting sun, my spirit may come to you without shame.”

author: Vince Lombardi
title: “It's not whether you got knocked down; it's whether you get back up.”

author: Roy T. Bennett

author: Ellen DeGeneres
title: “Things will get easier, people's minds will change, and you should be alive to see it.”

author: Steve Maraboli,

author: Indira Gandhi
title: “You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.”

title: “Total paranoia is just total awareness.”

author: Avril Lavigne
title: “You're not alone

author: Idowu Koyenikan,

author: Sivananda
title: “This world is your best teacher. There is a lesson in everything. There is a lesson in each experience. Learn it and become wise. Every failure is a stepping stone to success. Every difficulty or disappointment is a trial of your faith. Every unpleasant incident or temptation is a test of your inner strength. Therefore nil desperandum. March forward hero!”

author: Vince Lombardi
title: “I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious." ”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Sometimes the best of gods gift's arrive by the shattering of all the window panes.”

title: “Life is short. Kiss slowly, laugh insanely, love truly and forgive quickly”

title: “Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.”

author: Voltaire
title: “L'homme est libre au moment qu'il veut l'être.”

author: Farid Attar,
title: “The home we seek is in eternity;

author: Anthony Robbins
title: “In life, you need either inspiration or desperation.”

author: Tim Burton
title: “We all know interspecies romance is weird.”

author: Ayn Rand
title: “I want you, Hank. I'm much more of an animal than you think. I wanted you from the first moment I saw you - and the only thing I'm ashamed of is that I did not know it. I did not know why, for two years, the brightest moments I found were the ones in your office, where I could lift my head to look up at you. I did not know the nature of what I felt in your presence, nor the reason. I know it now. That is all I want, Hank. I want you in my bed - and you are free of me for all the rest of your time. There's nothing you'll have to pretend - don't think of me, don't feel; don't care - I do not want your mind, your will, your being or your soul, so long as it's to me you will come for that lowest one of your desires. I am an animal who wants nothing but the sensation of pleasure which you despise - but I want it from you. You'd give up amy height of virtue for it , while I - I haven't any to give up. There's none I seek or wish to reach. I am so low that I would exchange the greatest sight of beauty in the world for the sight of your figure in the cab of a railroad engine. Amd seeing it, I would not be able to see it indifferently. You don't have to fear that you're now dependent on me. It's I who will depend on any whim of yours. You'll have me anytime you wish, anywhere, on any terms. Did you call it the obscenity of my talent? It's such that it gives you a safer hold on me than on any other property you own. You may dispose of me as you please - I'm not afraid to admit it - I have nothing to protect from you and nothing to reserve. You think that this is a threat to your achievement, but it is not to mine. I will sit at my desk, and work, and when the things around me get hard to bear, I will think that for my reward I will be in your bed that night. Did you call it depravity? I am much more depraved than you are: you hold it as your guilt, and I - as my pride. I'm more proud of it than anything I've done, more proud than of building the Line. If I'm asked to name my proudest attainment, I will say: I have slept with Hank Rearden. I had earned it.”

author: Virginia Woolf,
title: “To love makes one solitary.”

author: Rae Carson,
title: “I think sometimes when we find love we pretend it away, or ignore it, or tell ourselves we’re imagining it. Because it is the most painful kind of hope there is.”

author: Cornelia Funke,
title: “Dustfinger still clearly remembered the feeling of being in love for the first time. How vulnerable his heart had suddenly been! Such a trembling, quivering thing, happy and miserably unhappy at once.”

author: Renee Ahdieh,
title: “Love is a force unto itself, sayyidi. For love, people consider the unthinkable...and often achieve the impossible. I would not sneer at its power.”

author: Atticus Poetry,
title: “We are made of all those who have built and broken us.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “And besides . . . I don’t want to leave you. Er, you guys.”

author: Shannon Alder
title: “Soul connections are not often found and are worth every bit of fight left in you to keep.”

author: Thomas Mann,
title: “Nothing is more curious and awkward than the relationship of two people who only know each other with their eyes — who meet and observe each other daily, even hourly and who keep up the impression of disinterest either because of morals or because of a mental abnormality. Between them there is listlessness and pent-up curiosity, the hysteria of an unsatisfied, unnaturally suppressed need for communion and also a kind of tense respect. Because man loves and honors man as long as he is not able to judge him, and desire is a product of lacking knowledge.”

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: “True love always makes a man better, no matter what woman inspires it.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Then she was kissing him as she had never kissed him before...and it was blissful oblivion, better than firewhisky; she was the only real thing in the world.”

author: Alexandra Bracken,
title: “—I don't want to lose you

author: Colleen Houck,
title: “We looked at each other for a minute, not saying anything, but I could feel the air between us shift. It became thick, sultry, and tangible—like when the air changes right before a storm. I could feel its power envelop me as it brushed across my skin. Even though I couldn’t see it, I knew a storm was coming.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “He didn't realize that love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves its own mark.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,
title: “He looked at her as a man might look at a faded flower he had plucked, in which it was difficult for him to trace the beauty that had made him pick and so destroy it”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Marie, let’s suppose that two firemen go into a forest to put out a small fire. Afterwards, when they emerge and go over to a stream, the face of one is all smeared with black, while the other man’s face is completely clean. My question is this: which of the two will wash his face?

author: Victor Hugo ,

author: Tess Gerritsen,
title: “The heart makes its choices without weighing the consequences. It doesn't look ahead to the lonely nights that follow.”

author: Susan  Fletcher,
title: “Kisses open doors, I've noticed. That one gesture can unlock secrets, ease open feelings. It can't be prevented--these kisses just are. It's how they work. They break into basements you never knew you had.”

author: Aberjhani,

author: Khalil Gibran,

author: K.A. Tucker,

author: Ilona Andrews,
title: “If I fought for them and was crippled, they would all say nice things,and then they would replace me and forget I was ever there. You would stay with me. You would take care of me, because you love me. I love you too, Kate. If you ever became hurt, I would not leave you.

author: Osho
title: “In love the other is important; in lust you are important”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “I don't look for love. Love looks for me." "Why?" "Because it needs me. Because I'm not afraid of it.”

author: Colleen Houck
title: “I’m not the kind of man to bottle up my feelings, Kells. I don’t sit up in my room pining away, writing love poems. I’m not a dreamer. I’m a fighter. I’m a man of action, and it will take all of my self-control not to fight for this. When something needs to be done, I do it. When I feel something, I act on it. I don’t see any reason why Ren deserves to get the girl of his dreams and I don’t. It doesn’t seem fair that this happens to me twice.”

author: Colleen Hoover,
title: “I don’t want to be your first, Fallon. I want to be your last.”

author: Margaret A. Edwards
title: “Too many adults wish to 'protect' teenagers when they should be stimulating them to read of life as it is lived.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.”

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
title: “How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.

author: John W. Campbell Jr.
title: “History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.”

author: Ian Fleming,
title: “You only live twice:

author: Zig Ziglar,
title: “Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.”

author: Walt Disney
title: “All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.”

author: Hafiz
title: “Even

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: “Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?”

author: Taylor Swift
title: “I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.”

author: Nadezhda Mandelstam,
title: “I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.”

author: Victor Hugo,
title: “To love another person is to see the face of God.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.”

author: Aristotle
title: “Hope is a waking dream.”

author: Tennessee Williams,
title: “What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.”

author: Robert Frost
title: “Freedom lies in being bold.”

author: Daphne du Maurier
title: “Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.”

author: John Green,
title: “But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Demon pox, oh demon pox

author: Simone de Beauvoir
title: “I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself”

author: Jonathan Kellerman
title: “Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. ”
