author: Doris Lessing,
title: “What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.

author: Dan Brown,
title: “Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.”

author: Victor Hugo,
title: “The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Treat everyone with politeness and kindness, not because they are nice, but because you are.”

author: Agatha Christie,
title: “The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.”

author: Julie Kagawa,
title: “Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?”

author: Roald Dahl,
title: “A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.”

author: Mae West
title: “Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,

author: Tahereh Mafi,
title: “Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.”

author: Helen Keller,
title: “Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.”

author: Flannery O'Connor
title: “She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.”

author: R.J. Palacio,
title: “I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.”

author: Victor Hugo,
title: “Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.”

author: John Green,
title: “When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.”

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,
title: “We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.”

author: Rachel Carson
title: “The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.”

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: “The question is not what you look at, but what you see.”

author: Sherman Alexie,
title: “If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.”

author: Rose Wilder Lane
title: “Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.”

author: Charles Darwin,
title: “A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.”

author: Khalil Gibran
title: “One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life.”

author: Mae West
title: “I never loved another person the way I loved myself.”

author: Bob Marley
title: “Don't forget your history nor your destiny”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Until you change how you get things done, you'll never know what works best.”

author: Gabrielle Zevin,
title: “Love stories are written in millimeters and milliseconds with a fast, dull pencil whose marks you can barely see, they are written in miles and eons with a chisel on the side of a mountiantop”

author: Margaret Mead
title: “There is no greater insight into the future than recognizing...when we save our children, we save ourselves”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “This is who the fuck I am.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “If there is anything that links the human to the divine, it is the courage to stand by a principle when everybody else rejects it.”

author: John Eldredge,
title: “We think you'll find that every woman in her heart of hearts longs for three things: to be romanced, to play an irreplaceable role in a great adventure, and to unveil beauty. That's what makes a woman come alive.”

author: Marcus Aurelius,
title: “Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?”

author: Wendell Berry
title: “What I stand for is what I stand on.”

author: Jim Rohn
title: “Either you run the day or the day runs you..”

author: Amy Poehler
title: “It’s never overreacting to ask for what you want and need.”

author: Benito Mussolini
title: “It is better to live one day as a lion than 100 years as a sheep.”

author: Neil Armstrong
title: “That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “And I remembered something else that makes us human: faith, the only weapon in our arsenal to battle doubt.”

author: Barbara Kingsolver,
title: “Sugar, it's no parade but you'll get down the street one way or another, so you'd just as well throw your shoulders back and pick up the pace.”

author: Anne Lamott,
title: “...most of the time, all you have is the moment, and the imperfect love of the people around you.”

author: Charles Dickens,
title: “And a beautiful world we live in, when it is possible, and when many other such things are possible, and not only possible, but done-- done, see you!-- under that sky there, every day.”

author: W.H. Auden,
title: “I am sure it is everyone’s experience, as it has been mine, that any discovery we make about ourselves or the meaning of life is never, like a scientific discovery, a coming upon something entirely new and unsuspected; it is rather, the coming to conscious recognition of something, which we really knew all the time but, because we were unwilling to formulate it correctly, we did not hitherto know we knew.”

author: Cecelia Ahern,
title: “Hope like that, as I thought before, doesn’t make you a weak person. It’s hopelessness that makes you weak. Hope makes you stronger, because it brings with it a sense of reason. Not a reason for how or why they were taken from you, but a reason for you to live. Because it’s a maybe. A ‘maybe someday things won’t always be this shit.’ And that ‘maybe’ immediately makes the shittiness better.”

author: Philip Pullman,
title: “because he's Will”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “Arrogance on the part of the meritorious is even more offensive to us than the arrogance of those without merit: for merit itself is offensive.”

author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
title: “The nourishment of body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others.”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “If we were to one day encounter a form of life more powerful and intelligent than our own, and it regarded us as we regard fish, what would be our argument against being eaten?”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
title: “The house, the stars, the desert -- what gives them their beauty is something that is invisible!”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “The difference between me and other people is that they all walk around with onion skins wrapped around them. Pre-meditations, pretentions, the faces that they present to the world, the faces that they present to themselves.. onion skins that come in layer after layer. They're on the inside of all that. And I... I am the inside of the onion skin walking around. I am only me.”

author: Ursula K. Le Guin,
title: “It's a rare gift, to know where you need to be, before you've been to all the places you don't need to be.”

author: Demi Lovato,
title: “Go ahead and believe that no one shines brighter than you. Become amazing, and be happy.”

author: Amit Ray,
title: “Searching outside of you is Samsara (the world). Searching within you leads to Nirvana.”

author: Frederick Buechner,
title: “Listen to your life. See it for the fathomless mystery it is. In the boredom and pain of it, no less than in the excitement and gladness: touch, taste, smell your way to the holy and hidden heart of it, because in the last analysis all moments are key moments, and life itself is grace.”

author: Dorothy Day
title: “The greatest challenge of the day is: how to bring about a revolution of the heart, a revolution which has to start with each one of us?”

author: Evanescence
title: “Don't try to fix me, I'm not broken...”

author: Ted Dekker,
title: “Dive deep. Drown willingly”

author: Friedrich von Schiller,
title: “To save all we must risk all.”

author: Chris Heimerdinger,
title: “There are only two forces at work in this world- black and white. Only people are grey.”

author: Oliver Sacks,
title: “I cannot pretend I am without fear. But my predominant feeling is one of gratitude. I have loved and been loved; I have been given much and I have given something in return; I have read and traveled and thought and written. I have had an intercourse with the world, the special intercourse of writers and readers.

author: L.M. Montgomery,
title: “I've done my best, and I begin to understand what is meant by 'the joy of strife'. Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.”

author: Stormie Omartian,
title: “It's not about finding ways to avoid God's judgment and feeling like a failure if you don't do everything perfectly. It's about fully experiencing God's love and letting it perfect you. It's not about being somebody you are not. It's about becoming who you really are.”

author: Fred Rogers
title: “It's a beautiful day in this neighborhood,

author: Lillian Hellman
title: “It's a sad day when you find out that it's not accident or time or fortune, but just yourself that kept things from you.”

author: Nelson Mandela
title: “Sometimes it falls upon a generation to be great, you can be that generation”

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “So that's my wish for you, and all of us, and my wish for myself. Make New Mistakes. Make glorious, amazing mistakes. Make mistakes nobody's ever made before. Don't freeze, don't stop, don't worry that it isn't good enough, or it isn't perfect, whatever it is: art, or love, or work or family or life.”

author: Victor Hugo,
title: “This first glance of a soul which does not yet know itself is like dawn in the heavens; it is the awakening of something radiant and unknown.”

author: Margaret Peterson Haddix,
title: “I want to Live! Not Die, Not Hide, LIVE!”

author: Lynn Austin,
title: “Faith don't come in a bushel basket, Missy. It come one step at a time. Decide to trust Him for one little thing today, and before you know it, you find out He's so trustworthy you be putting your whole life in His hands.”

author: Michelle Paver
title: “Evil exists in us all, Torak. Some fight it. Some feed it. That's how it's always been.”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “Like a missing tooth, sometimes an absence is more noticeable than a presence.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “True beauty lies in purity of the heart.”

author: Shiv Khera,
title: “Under Adverse conditions - some people break down,some break records”

author: Jacqueline Winspear
title: “Grace isn't a little prayer you chant before receiving a meal. It's a way to live.”

author: Leigh Bardugo,
title: “What is she to you anyway?"

author: Giacomo Casanova
title: “If you have not done things worthy of being written about, at least write things worthy of being read.”

author: Pittacus Lore,
title: “You kick ass Sam. And don't forget it”

author: Ayn Rand,
title: “She smiled. She knew she was dying. But it did not matter any longer. She had known something which no human words could ever tell and she knew it now. She had been awaiting it and she felt it, as if it had been, as if she had lived it. Life had been, if only because she had known it could be, and she felt it now as a hymn without sound, deep under the little whole that dripped red drops into the snow, deeper than that from which the red drops came. A moment or an eternity- did it matter? Life, undefeated, existed and could exist. She smiled, her last smile, to so much that had been possible.”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “It was the living who ignored the strange and wonderful, because life was too full of the boring and mundane.”

author: Gloria Steinem
title: “Rich People plan for three generations

author: Anna Freud
title: “I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence, but it comes from within. It is there all the time.”

author: Amit Ray
title: “Enjoy the limitless bliss consciousness here and now. The reality of you lies much beyond your sensory perceptions and boundaries.”

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,
title: “People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “What's up?" I asked.

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “The things you used to own, now they own you.”

author: Haruki Murakami
title: “But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead."

author: Ellen Bass
title: “to love life, to love it even

author: David Levithan,
title: “If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.”

author: Nicole Krauss,
title: “there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.”

author: Gore Vidal
title: “The unfed mind devours itself.”

author: Philip José Farmer
title: “Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.”

author: Toni Morrison,
title: “Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.”

author: Colleen Hoover,
title: “There are three questions every woman should be able to answer yes to before they commit to a man. If you answer no to any of the three questions, run like hell."

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.”

author: Jandy Nelson,
title: “Maybe some people are just meant to be in the same story.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “You are okay?" he asked. "Not eaten by monsters?"

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.”

author: Seamus Heaney,
title: “If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ...

author: Jennifer Egan,
title: “I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,
title: “If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--"

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “The earth laughs in flowers.”

author: W.E.B. DuBois
title: “Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.

author: Louisa May Alcott,
title: “I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.”

author: David Mitchell,
title: “Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.”

author: Ernest Hemingway,
title: “Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Frank stared at her. "But you throw Ding Dongs at monsters."

author: Andrew Davidson
title: “If you listen to the wind very carefully, you'll be able to hear me whisper my love for you.”

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: “I wanted movement and not a calm course of existence. I wanted excitement and danger and the chance to sacrifice myself for my love.”

author: Ilona Andrews,
title: “What's that?"

author: Karen Marie Moning,
title: “Was he a good kisser, Ms. Lane?” Barrons asked, watching me carefully.

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “It was sad music. But it waved its sadness like a battle flag. It said the universe had done all it could, but you were still alive.”

author: Eoin Colfer
title: “Artemis: "Right, brothers. Onward. Imagine yourself seated at a cafe in Montmartre."

author: Augusten Burroughs,
title: “Just as I had long suspected, a person didn't really need math for anything anyway. Maybe some people did. Some limited people.”

author: Stephen Colbert
title: “Wikipedia is the first place I go when I'm looking for knowledge... or when I want to create some.”

author: Shannon Hale
title: “He smiled in a way that made me want to kiss him right on the spot. Or the lips. Whichever was closer.”

author: Derek Landy,
title: “Plans are invitation to disappointment.”

author: Christopher Moore,
title: “Oh, sweetie, I'm sorry, you can't have a baby brother, because that would mean that Daddy had sex, and that's never going to happen again.”

author: Kerstin Gier,
title: “Hearts can't be broken because they're made of marzipan.”

author: J. Conrad Guest,
title: “I used to think Romeo and Juliet was the greatest love story ever written. But now that I’m middle-aged, I know better. Oh, Romeo certainly thinks he loves his Juliet. Driven by hormones, he unquestionably lusts for her. But if he loves her, it’s a shallow love. You want proof?” Cagney didn’t wait for Dr. Victor to say yay or nay.

author: David Foster Wallace
title: “The integrity of my sleep has been forever compromised, sir.”

author: Stanisław Lem,
title: “On the surface, I was calm: in secret, without really admitting it, I was waiting for something. Her return? How could I have been waiting for that? We all know that we are material creatures, subject to the laws of physiology and physics, and not even the power of all our feelings combined can defeat those laws. All we can do is detest them. The age-old faith of lovers and poets in the power of love, stronger than death, that finis vitae sed non amoris, is a lie, useless and not even funny. So must one be resigned to being a clock that measures the passage of time, now out of order, now repaired, and whose mechanism generates despair and love as soon as its maker sets it going? Are we to grow used to the idea that every man relives ancient torments, which are all the more profound because they grow comic with repetition? That human existence should repeat itself, well and good, but that it should repeat itself like a hackneyed tune, or a record a drunkard keeps playing as he feeds coins into the jukebox...

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “And he knew that at that moment, they understood each other perfectly, and when he told her what he was going to do now, she would not say ‘be careful’ or ‘don’t do it’, but she would accept his decision because she would not have expected anything less of him.”

author: Tahereh Mafi,
title: “Please," he says. "I'm begging you to stop."

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “You don't have to say I love you to say I love you," you said with a shrug. "All you have to do is say my name and I know."

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “What are you wishing for?' Grace interrupted. 'To kiss you,' I said to her.”

author: John Green The Fault in Our Stars
title: “He shook his head, just looking at me.

author: Mandy Hale,
title: “Better to put your heart on the line, risk everything, and walk away with nothing than play it safe. Love is a lot of things, but “safe” isn’t one of them.”

author: Roald Dahl,
title: “A whizzpopper!" cried the BFG, beaming at her. "Us giants is making whizzpoppers all the time! Whizzpopping is a sign of happiness. It is music in our ears! You surely is not telling me that a little whizzpopping if forbidden among human beans?”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “Granny was an old-fashioned witch. She didn’t do good for people, she did right by them.”

author: Lisa Mantchev,
title: “Could we wear spandex and blow things up?”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “I will describe my eyes and then begin the story. My eyes are blue and resplendent. Now I will begin the story.”

author: Agatha Christie,
title: “No, my friend, I am not drunk. I have just been to the dentist, and need not return for another six months! Is it not the most beautiful thought?

author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips,
title: “I happen to be immature, undisciplined, and self-centered, pretty much a little boy in a man's body, although I'd appreciate it if you didn't quote me on that.

author: Patsy Clairmont
title: “Normal" is just a setting on your dryer.”

author: Mark Twain,
title: “I was sorry to have my name mentioned as one of the great authors, because they have a sad habit of dying off. Chaucer is dead, Spencer is dead, so is Milton, so is Shakespeare, and I’m not feeling so well myself.”

author: Dave Barry
title: “Although golf was originally restricted to wealthy, overweight Protestants, today it's open to anybody who owns hideous clothing.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Even now, despite Angeline's watchfulness, she'd occasionally oscillate between random topics, like how shepherd's pie wasn't a pie at all and why it was pointless for her to take class in typing when technology would eventually develop robot companions to do it for us.”

author: Diablo Cody,
title: “He is the cheese to my macaroni.”

author: Margery Williams Bianco,
title: “You become. It takes a long time. That’s why it doesn’t happen often to people who break easily, or have sharp edges, or who have to be carefully kept. Generally, by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in your joints and very shabby.

author: Wm. Paul Young,
title: “So many believe that it is love that grows, but it is the knowing that grows and love simply expands to contain it.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “Take it from me: love has all the lasting permanence of a rainbow- beautiful while it's there, and just as likely to have disappeared by the time you blink.”

author: J.R. Ward,
title: “Falling into ruin was a bit like falling in love: Both descents stripped you bare and left you as you were at your core. And both endings are equally painful.”

author: E.L. James ,
title: “I want my world to start and end with you.”

author: Susan  Fletcher,
title: “Love is blind, they say--but isn't it more that love makes us see too much? Isn't it more that love floods our brain with sights and sounds, so that everything looks bigger, brighter, more lovely than ever before?”

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “Kitten, your hands are heaven and your eyes are my home.”

author: Meša Selimović
title: “Everyone says love hurts, but that is not true. Loneliness hurts. Rejection hurts. Losing someone hurts. Envy hurts. Everyone gets these things confused with love, but in reality love is the only thing in this world that covers up all pain and makes someone feel wonderful again. Love is the only thing in this world that does not hurt.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “he is both the source of my happiness and the one i want to share it with.”

author: Helen Keller,
title: “The one I felt and still feel most is lack of time. I used to have time to think, to reflect, my mind and I. We would sit together of an evening and listen to the inner melodies of the spirit, which one hears only in leisure moments when the words of

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “…well just call me Hannibal Lecter. With cleavage.”

author: Rachel Caine,
title: “Bite me, Goth princess,” Shane called from the back. “Not literally or anything.”

author: Ransom Riggs,
title: “Will you quit shouting and let me bleed in peace!”

author: Wodehouse
title: “I mean to say, I know perfectly well that I've got, roughly speaking, half the amount of brain a normal bloke ought to possess. And when a girl comes along who has about twice the regular allowance, she too often makes a bee line for me with the love light in her eyes. I don't know how to account for it, but it is so."

author: Taylor Swift,
title: “I rode an elevator with a guy who was whistling the tune of 'this is the song that never ends'. Putting that on me? Come on dude..”

author: Brian Tracy
title: “You have within you,right now,everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.”

author: William Goldman,
title: “And when she at last came out, her eyes were dry. Her parents stared up from their silent breakfast at her. They both started to rise but she put a hand out, stopped them. ‘I can care for myself, please,’ and she set about getting some food. They watched her closely.

author: Christopher Poindexter
title: “She writes things with her movements that I for the life of me could never write with a pen.”

author: Jane Austen,
title: “Elizabeth's spirit's soon rising to playfulness again, she wanted Mr. Darcy to account for his having ever fallen in love with her. 'How could you begin?' said she.

author: Colleen Houck
title: “I could feel the warmth of his presence as if a soft blanket had been wrapped around my soul, around my heart. It held me and protected me. It sheltered me and I knew I wasn’t alone anymore.”

author: Leigh Bardugo,
title: “This goes to show you that sometimes the unseen is not to be feared and that those meant to love us most are not always ones who do.”

author: Morrissey
title: “To me you are a work of art, and I would give you my heart - that's if I had one.”

author: Rupi Kaur,
title: “love will come

author: Joseph Kesselring,
title: “Insanity runs in my family, it practically gallops”

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez,
title: “He recognized her despite the uproar, through his tears of unrepeatable sorrow at dying without her, and he looked at her for the last and final time with eyes more luminous, more grief-stricken, more grateful than she had ever seen them in half a century of a shared life, and he managed to say to her with his last breath: “Only God knows how much I loved you”

author: Haruki Murukami,
title: “Why?" she screamed. "Are you crazy? You know the English subjunctive, you understand trigonometry, you can read Marx, and you don't know the answer to something as simple as that? Why do you even have to ask? Why do you have to make a girl SAY something like this? I like you more than I like him, that's all. I wish I had fallen in love with somebody a little more handsome, of course. But I didn't. I fell in love with you!”

author: Lauren Oliver,
title: “I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.”

author: Frank Zappa
title: “If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.”

author: Bei Dao
title: “In the world I am

author: Audre Lorde,
title: “Your silence will not protect you.”

author: Richard Matheson,
title: “That which you believe becomes your world.”

author: Charles M. Schulz
title: “Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.”

author: Margaret Mitchell
title: “With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.”

author: Lemony Snicket,
title: “...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.”

author: Amy Tan,
title: “We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate.”

author: Mitch Albom,
title: “Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.”

author: Rainer Maria Rilke,
title: “Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.”

author: Fred Rogers
title: “When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.”

author: Kiera Cass,
title: “True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless.

author: عباس محمود العقاد
title: “ليس هناك كتابا أقرأه و لا أستفيد منه شيئا جديدا ، فحتى الكتاب التافه أستفيد من قراءته ، أني تعلمت شيئا جديدا هو ما هي التفاهة ؟ و كيف يكتب الكتاب التافهون ؟ و فيم يفكرون ؟”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.”

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
title: “Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.”

author: Nora Roberts,
title: “Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.”

author: Stephen Fry
title: “Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “Can you surf really well, then?"

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”

author: Art Spiegelman,
title: “To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.”

author: Stephanie Lennox,
title: “I’ve been fighting to be who I am all my life. What’s the point of being who I am, if I can’t have the person who was worth all the fighting for?”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: “It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.”

author: Anaïs Nin
title: “I reserve the right to love many different people at once, and to change my prince often.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “Not like this. He wanted it to be real.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “I could still smell her on my fur. It clung to me, a memory of another world.

author: Peter David,
title: “That was when it was all made painfully clear to me. When you are a child, there is joy. There is laughter. And most of all, there is trust. Trust in your fellows. When you are an adult...then comes suspicion, hatred, and fear. If children ran the world, it would be a place of eternal bliss and cheer. Adults run the world; and there is war, and enmity, and destruction unending. Adults who take charge of things muck them up, and then produce a new generation of children and say, "The children are the hope of the future." And they are right. Children are the hope of the future. But adults are the damnation of the present, and children become adults as surely as adults become worm food.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle,
title: “A man always finds it hard to realize that he may have finally lost a woman's love, however badly he may have treated her.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “Voicemail #1: “Hi, Isabel Culpeper. I am lying in my bed, looking at the ceiling. I am mostly naked. I am thinking of … your mother. Call me.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “Love, and you shall be loved.”

author: Susan Sontag,
title: “It hurts to love. It's like giving yourself to be flayed and knowing that at any moment the other person may just walk off with your skin.”

author: Tere Liye,
title: “Andaikata semua kehidupan ini menyakitkan, maka di luar sana pasti masih ada sepotong bagian yang menyenangkan. Kemudian kau akan membenak pasti ada sesuatu yang jauh lebih indah dari menatap rembulan di langit. Kau tidak tahu apa itu, karna ilmumu terbatas. Kau hanya yakin , bila tidak di kehidupan ini suatu saat nanti pasti akan ada yang lebih mempesona dibanding menatap sepotong rembulan yang sedang bersinar indah.”

author: Deborah Moggach,
title: “You may only call me "Mrs. Darcy"... when you are completely, and perfectly, and incandescently happy.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I just don't see why the past has to matter.”

author: Dante Alighieri,
title: “Love, that moves the sun and the other stars”

author: Judith McNaught,
title: “Some people feel love in their hearts, Julie. Some of us feel it all way into our souls. We're the ones who can't forget.”

author: Stephanie Perkins,
title: “I look at you, and I think about you, and ... I don't know. No one has ever confounded me the way you do.”

author: Emily Giffin,
title: “I miss us too. I always have and I probably always will. Sometimes there are no happy endings. No matter what, I'll be losing something, someone. But maybe that's what it all comes down to. Love, not as a surge of passion, but as a choice to commit to something, someone, no matter what obstacles or temptations stand in the way. And maybe making that choice again and again, day in and day out, year after year,says more about love than never having a choice to make at all.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “They kissed for the first time then in the cold spring rain, though neither one of them now knew that it was raining. Tristran's heart pounded in his chest as if it was not big enough to contain all the joy that it held. He opened his eyes as he kissed the star. Her sky-blue eyes stared back into his, and in her eyes he could see no parting from her.”

author: Michelle Hodkin,
title: “Two seconds later, the sound of an alarm filled my ears.

author: Joyce Carol Oates
title: “In love there are two things - bodies and words. ”

author: Beth Revis,
title: “Choice or no, my heart is his.”

author: Jandy Nelson,
title: “They do make love stories for girls with black hearts after all. They go like this.”

author: Candide,
title: “She blushed and so did he. She greeted him in a faltering voice, and he spoke to her without knowing what he was saying.”

author: Jess Rothenberg,
title: “There’s always that one guy who gets a hold on you. Not like your best friend’s brother who gets you in a headlock kind of hold. Or the little kid you’re babysitting who attaches himself to your leg kind of hold.

author: Margery Williams Bianco,
title: “He didn't mind how he looked to other people, because the nursery magic had made him Real, and when you are Real shabbiness doesn't matter.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “Love doesn’t have to be on Valentine’s Day. It doesn’t have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn’t have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn’t have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third day.

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “The two of you, there's something uncanny about the way you two are with each other. I mean everything--the way you look at each other, the way she relaxes when you put your hand on her back, the way you both seem to know what the other is always thinking, it's always struck me as extraordinary. That's another reason I keep putting marriage off. I know I want something like what you two share, and I'm not sure I've found it yet. I'm not sure I ever will. And with love like that, they say anything's possible, right?”

author: Augusten Burroughs,
title: “If you have one parent who loves you, even if they can't buy you clothes, they're so poor and they make all kinds of mistakes and maybe sometimes they even give you awful advice, but never for one moment do you doubt their love for you--if you have this, you have incredibly good fortune.

author: L.M. Montgomery,
title: “Gilbert, I'm afraid I'm scandalously in love with you.”

author: Ann Brashares
title: “He wanted to take his love back from her so badly. The old techniques didn’t work anymore. In fact, they’d never worked. How do you stop loving someone? It was one of the world’s more brutal mysteries. The more you tried, the less it worked.”

author: Ann Brashares,
title: “She knew whose love she doubted. It wasn't her parents' and it wasn't her friends: It was her own. ”

author: Joseph Campbell
title: “Where you stumble and fall, there you will find gold.”

author: Ernesto "Che" Guevara
title: “Silence is argument carried out by other means.”

author: Tupac Shakur
title: “I believe that everything that you do bad comes back to you. So everything that I do that's bad, I'm going to suffer from it. But in my mind, I believe what I'm doing is right. So I feel like I'm going to heaven”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Be the kind of person who dares to face life's challenges and overcome them rather than dodging them.”

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: “I believe in the hands that work, in the brains that think, and in the hearts that love...I believe in sunshine, fresh air, friendship, calm sleep, beautiful thoughts.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Sometimes it's the same moments that take your breath away that breathe purpose and love back into your life.”

author: Mitch Albom
title: “You can feel the whole world and still feel lost in it. So many people are in pain-- no matter how smart or accomplished--they cry, they yearn, they hurt. But instead of looking down on things, they look up, which is where I should have been looking, too. Because when the world quiets to the sound of your own breathing, we all want the same things: comfort, love and a peaceful heart.”

author: Rene Daumal
title: “You cannot stay on the summit forever; you have to come down again. So why bother in the first place? Just this: What is above knows what is below, but what is below does not know what is above. One climbs, one sees. One descends, one sees no longer, but one has seen. There is an art of conducting oneself in the lower regions by the memory of what one saw higher up. When one can no longer see, one can at least still know.”

author: Robert A. Heinlein,
title: “Be wary of strong drink, it can make you shoot at the tax collector...and miss.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
title: “He was talking about the sign that said 'THE COMPLICATED FUTILITY OF IGNORANCE.'

author: Robert Greene,
title: “For the future, the motto is, "No days unalert.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “What fire does not destroy, it hardens”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson,
title: “There are two things that men should never weary of, goodness and humility; we get none too much of them in this rough world among cold, proud people.”

author: R.J. Anderson,
title: “I realized then that even though I was a tiny speck in an infinite cosmos, a blip on the timeline of eternity, I was not without purpose.”

author: David Bowie
title: “Tomorrow belongs to those who can hear it coming”

author: Coco Chanel
title: “There are people who have money and people who are rich.”

author: Tere Liye,
title: “Delisa cinta ummi karena Allah.”

author: Susan Cain,
title: “Don't think of introversion as something that needs to be cured...Spend your free the way you like, not the way you think you're supposed to.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “That's chess!" snapped Ron. "You've got to make some sacrifices!”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Remember that things are not always as they appear to be… Curiosity creates possibilities and opportunities.”

author: Daniel Goleman,
title: “In a very real sense we have two minds, one that thinks and one that feels”

author: Rohinton Mistry,
title: “Distance was a dangerous thing, she knew. Distance changed people.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: “Me with nothing left to lose, plotting my big revenge in the spotlight. Give me violent revenge fantasies as a coping mechanism.”

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: “One must work and dare if one really wants to live.”

author: robert m drake
title: “It was never about the world being too big, it was more like she was too much for the world to handle.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Temptation is the feeling we get when encountered by an opportunity to do what we innately know we shouldn't.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “The boy and his heart had become friends, and neither was capable now of betraying the other.”

author: L.J. Smith,
title: “There is nothing frightening in the dark if you just face it.”

author: A.G. Howard,
title: “Sometimes a flame must level a forest to ash before new growth can begin.”

author: Alexandra Bracken,
title: “I don’t care,” I said, leaning my head back against the seat. “Can we just get lost and see where that lands us?”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other... I know I've spent each life before this one searching for you. Not someone like you but you, for your soul and mine must always come together.”

author: Oswald Chambers
title: “If through a broken heart God can bring His purposes to pass in the world, then thank Him for breaking your heart.”

author: Sophie Kinsella,
title: “If you can't be honest with your friends and colleagues and loved ones, then what is life all about?”

author: Viktor E. Frankl,
title: “What is demanded of man is not, as some existential philosophers teach, to endure the meaninglessness of life, but rather to bear his incapacity to grasp its unconditional meaningfulness in rational terms.”

author: Nick Hornby,
title: “There had been times when he knew, somewhere in him, that he would get used to it, whatever it was, because he had learnt that some hard things became softer after a very little while.”

author: Paul Theroux,
title: “The wish to travel seems to me characteristically human: the desire to move, to satisfy your curiosity or ease your fears, to change the circumstances of your life, to be a stranger, to make a friend, to experience an exotic landscape, to risk the unknown..”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Finding the lesson behind every adversity will be the one important thing that helps get you through it.”

author: Robert Green Ingersoll,
title: “Religion can never reform mankind because religion is slavery. It is far better to be free, to leave the forts and barricades of fear, to stand erect and face the future with a smile. It is far better to give yourself sometimes to negligence, to drift with wave and tide, with the blind force of the world, to think and dream, to forget the chains and limitations of the breathing life, to forget purpose and object, to lounge in the picture gallery of the brain, to feel once more the clasps and kisses of the past, to bring life's morning back, to see again the forms and faces of the dead, to paint fair pictures for the coming years, to forget all Gods, their promises and threats, to feel within your veins life's joyous stream and hear the martial music, the rhythmic beating of your fearless heart. And then to rouse yourself to do all useful things, to reach with thought and deed the ideal in your brain, to give your fancies wing, that they, like chemist bees, may find art's nectar in the weeds of common things, to look with trained and steady eyes for facts, to find the subtle threads that join the distant with the now, to increase knowledge, to take burdens from the weak, to develop the brain, to defend the right, to make a palace for the soul. This is real religion. This is real worship”

author: Andrea Hirata,
title: “Pesimistik tidak lebih daripada sikap takbur mendahului nasib.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “The terrible thing, the almost impossible thing, is to hand over your whole self--all your wishes and precautions--to Christ. But it is far easier than what we are all trying to do instead. For what we are trying to do is to remain what we call "ourselves," to keep personal happiness as our great aim in life, and yet at the same time be "good.”

author: Swedish Proverb
title: “Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.”

author: Jean M. Auel
title: “You learn to write by writing, and by reading and thinking about how writers have created their characters and invented their stories. If you are not a reader, don't even think about being a writer.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “How would your life be different if…You didn’t allow yourself to be defined by your past? Let today be the day…You stop letting your history interfere with your destiny and awaken to the opportunity to release your greatest self.”

author: Banana Yoshimoto,
title: “Again and again I will suffer; again and again I will get back on my feet. I will not be defeated. I won't let my spirit be destroyed.”

author: Richelle E. Goodrich,
title: “Courage to me is doing something daring, no matter how afraid, insecure, intimidated, alone, unworthy, incapable, ridiculed or whatever other paralyzing emotion you might feel. Courage is taking action....no matter what.  So you're afraid? Be afraid.  Be scared silly to the point you're trembling and nauseous, but do it anyway!”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “You have to rise above the squabbling and chaos, and keep believing. You have to always keep your goals in mind.” -Hera, goddess of marriage ”

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
title: “Advice is like snow; the softer it falls, the longer it dwells upon, and the deeper it sinks into the mind.”

author: Theocritus
title: “Sameron adion aso

author: Corrie Ten Boom
title: “Child, you have to learn to see things in the right proportions. Learn to see great things great and small things small.”

author: robert m drake
title: “She was broken from moment to moment, watching her world collide she felt lost inside herself. She fell apart for a passion that flamed beneath her. She waited and died a hundred times, it dripped from her pores. The moment she let go, she soared over the stillness like the star she was born to be.”

author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib A.S
title: “Take Care Of Your Tongue Like The Way You Take Care Of Gold & Silver.”

author: Tyler Knott Gregson
title: “What an utter disgrace it would be to find something truly magic and spend any time at all pretending and trying to convince yourself it is all just an unbelievably orchestrated and beautifully choreographed illusion.”

author: Gore Vidal
title: “The important thing is not the object of love, but the emotion itself.”

author: Pope Francis
title: “The media only writes about the sinners and the scandals, he said, but that's normal, because 'a tree that falls makes more noise than a forest that grows.”

author: Harper Lee,
title: “Atticus, he was real nice."

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: “Never let yourself be persuaded that any one Great Man, any one leader, is necessary to the salvation of America. When America consists of one leader and 158 million followers, it will no longer be America.”

author: A.A. Milne,
title: “When I was One,

author: Les Brown
title: “The greatest revenge is massive success.”

author: Ayn Rand,
title: “And what, incidentally, do you think integrity is? The ability not to pick a watch out of your neighbor's pocket? No, it's not as easy as that. If that were all, I'd say ninety-five percent of humanity were honest, upright men. Only, as you can see, they aren't. Integrity is the ability to stand by an idea.”

author: Billie Joe Armstrong
title: “‎The day you become old is the day you're not looking for new experiences anymore.”

author: Suzy Toronto,
title: “Life is All About How you Handle Plan B

author: Jean de La Fontaine,
title: “A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.”

author: Erin Morgenstern,
title: “The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones.”

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: “Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough”

author: Søren Kierkegaard ,
title: “Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.”

author: Michel de Montaigne
title: “The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness. ”

author: Jack Kerouac
title: “The only truth is music.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Have you tried talking to her?"

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “The future depends on what you do today.”

author: Gayle Forman,
title: “If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.”

author: Katherine Anne Porter
title: “The past is never where you think you left it.”

author: Washington Irving
title: “A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.”

author: Charles Bukowski,
title: “A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but

author: Franz Kafka
title: “I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.”

author: Noam Chomsky
title: “We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.”

author: Anne Frank
title: “Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.,
title: “And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.”

author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld,
title: “Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.”

author: Paula Poundstone
title: “Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.”

author: Jon Krakauer,
title: “make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit within a man than a secure future. The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun. If you want to get more out of life, you must lose your inclination for monotonous security and adopt a helter-skelter style of life that will at first appear to you to be crazy. But once you become accustomed to such a life you will see its full meaning and its incredible beauty.”

author: Douglas Adams,
title: “The major problem—

author: Anaïs Nin,
title: “Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.”

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.”

author: E.E. Cummings
title: “We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.”

author: Laurie Halse Anderson,
title: “In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.”

author: Charles Dickens,
title: “Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.”

author: Laura Ingalls Wilder
title: “I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Um...is that thing

author: Napoleon Hill
title: “If you can't do great things, do small things in a great way.”

author: Jandy Nelson,
title: “That's a misconception, Lennie. The sky is everywhere, it begins at your feet.”

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: “You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.”

author: William Blake
title: “A man can't soar too high, when he flies with his own wings.”

author: Mitch Albom,
title: “If we tend to the things that are important in life, if we are right with those we love, and behave in line with our faith, our lives will not be cursed with the aching throb of unfulfilled business. Our words will always be sincere, our embraces will be tight. We will never wallow in the agony of ‘I could have, I should have’. We can sleep in a storm. And when its time, our goodbyes will be complete.”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “It doesn't matter who you are, or where you come from, or how much money you've got in your pocket. You have your own destiny and your own life ahead of you.”

author: Tyra Banks,
title: “Love me or hate me I promise that it will never make or break me...<3”

author: Jane Evershed
title: “To read is to empower,

author: Oswald Chambers
title: “Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Leaders are limited by their vision rather than by their abilities.”

author: J.D. Salinger,
title: “Keep me up till five because all your stars are out, and for no other reason…Oh dare to do it Buddy! Trust your heart. You’re a deserving craftsman. It would never betray you. Good night. I’m feeling very much over-excited now, and a little dramatic, but I think I’d give almost anything on earth to see you writing a something, an anything, a poem, a tree, that was really and truly after your own heart.”

author: Salim A. Fillah,
title: “Di jalan cinta para pejuang, biarkan cinta berhenti di titik ketaatan.. Meloncati rasa suka dan tidak suka.. Melampaui batas cinta dan benci.. Karena hikmah sejati tak selalu terungkap di awal pagi.. Karena seringkali kebodohan merabunkan kesan sesaat.. Maka taat adalah prioritas yang kadang membuat perasaan-perasaan terkibas.. Tapi yakinlah, di jalan cinta para pejuang, Alloh lebih tahu tentang kita..”

author: Santosh Kalwar
title: “Always be like a water. Float in the times of pain or dance like waves along the wind which touches its surface.”

author: Jim Carrey
title: “Your need for acceptance can make you invisible in this world. Don't let anything stand in the way of the light that shines through this form. Risk being seen in all of your glory.”

author: Santosh Kalwar
title: “You only get one life. Live it to the fullest. All your miseries will be forgiven when you will be dead.”

author: Seno Gumira Ajidarma,
title: “Seberapa indah mimpi, jika tetap mimpi?”

author: Corrie Ten Boom
title: “Faith is like radar that sees through the fog -- the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.”

author: Cornelius Elmore Addison,
title: “What is grander than a country and more valuable than gold? Strength of heart.”

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
title: “errare humanum est, sed perseverare diabolicum: 'to err is human, but to persist (in the mistake) is diabolical.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “The reward of a thing well done is having done it.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “Adversity introduces a man to himself.”

author: Santosh Kalwar,
title: “It is when things are at worst you will get the best.”

author: Sheri L. Dew,
title: “If you're serious about sanctification, you can expect to experience heart-wrenching moments that try your faith, your endurance, and your patience.”

author: Rachel Naomi Remen
title: “The most basic and powerful way to connect to another person is to listen. Just listen. Perhaps the most important thing we ever give each other is our attention…. A loving silence often has far more power to heal and to connect than the most well-intentioned words. ”

author: G.K. Chesterton
title: “We have all forgotten what we really are. All that we call common sense and rationality and practicality and positivism only means that for certain dead levels of our life we forget that we have forgotten. All that we call spirit and art and ecstasy only means that for one awful instant we remember that we forget.”

author: Confucius
title: “He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.”

author: Daisaku Ikeda
title: “The institutions of human society treat us as parts of a machine. They assign us ranks and place considerable pressure upon us to fulfill defined roles. We need something to help us restore our lost and distorted humanity. Each of us has feelings that have been suppressed and have built up inside. There is a voiceless cry resting in the depths of our souls, waiting for expression. Art gives the soul's feelings voice and form.”

author: Myles Munroe,
title: “When purpose is not known, abuse is inevitable”

author: Edgar Lee Masters,
title: “To put meaning in one's life may end in madness,

author: Colleen Houck
title: “You must learn to take a step back and visualize the whole piece. If you focus only on the thread given to you, you lose sight of what it can become. ”

author: Marissa Meyer,
title: “He leaned forward to inspect her closer. "Is that all hair?"

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “Tyler lies back and asks, "If Marilyn Monroe were alive right now, what would she be doing?"

author: J.D. Robb,
title: “Do little pink fairies sing and dance in your world, Peabody?"

author: Morrissey
title: “I can chase you, and I can catch you,

author: lyn key,
title: “Nozy Cat lifted one sleepy eyelid, and his marble blue eye glared at her for interrupting his sacred nap. He wore a yellow collar with little red stars printed on it. His second eyelid also opened, and he gave them his irritated blue-eyed glare.”

author: Eoin Colfer
title: “Really, I'm trying to care, Artemis, really. But I thought it was all supposed to be over when the fat lady sings. Well, she's singing, but it doesn't appear to be over”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “The poor things keep calling in those – those pumbles, I think they're called – you know, the ones who mend pipes and things – "

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Merlin’s beard.”

author: John Locke
title: “We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.”

author: Kristin Cashore,
title: “To Garan's credit, the treatment of Dellian prisoners did change after that. One particularly laconic man, after a session in which Fire learned positively nothing, thanked her for it specifically. "Best dungeons I ever been in," he said, chewing on a toothpick.

author: Brian Andreas
title: “A few said they'd be horses. Most said they'd be some sort of cat. My friend said she'd like to come back as a porcupine. I don't like crowds, she said. ”

author: Bauvard,
title: “Alphabet: a symbolic system used in algebra, with applications that have yet to be discovered by dyslexics and two thirds of college graduates.”

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: “In this country we have no place for hyphenated Americans.”

author: Mark Twain,
title: “In Paris they just simply opened their eyes and stared when we spoke to them in French! We never did succeed in making those idiots understand their own language.”

author: Marjane Satrapi,
title: “I had learned that you should always shout louder than your aggressor.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe,
title: “Mysteries force a man to think, and so injure his health.”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “Fortunately, we did most of our athletic stuff inside, so we didn't have to jog through Tribeca looking like a bunch of boot-camp hippie children.”

author: Patrick Rothfuss,
title: “... for most practical purposes, Tarbean had two parts: Waterside and Hillside. Waterside is where people are poor. That makes them beggars, thieves and whores. Hillside is where people are rich. That makes them solicitors, politicians and courtesans.”

author: Kresley Cole,
title: “Darwin says people like you need to die.” (Carrow)”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “How can you protect yourself by carrying a sword if you don’t know how to use it?’

author: Graham Parke,
title: “I'm looking into my past lives. I'm convinced some of them still owe me money.”

author: David Sedaris
title: “When forced to leave my house for an extended period of time, I take my typewriter with me, and together we endure the wretchedness of passing through the X-ray scanner. The laptops roll merrily down the belt, while I’m instructed to stand aside and open my bag. To me it seems like a normal enough thing to be carrying, but the typewriter’s declining popularity arouses suspicion and I wind up eliciting the sort of reaction one might expect when traveling with a cannon.

author: Loretta Chase,
title: “With the world securely in order, Dain was able to devote the leisurely bath time to editing his mental dictionary. He removed his wife from the general category labeled "Females" and gave her a section of her own. He made a note that she didn't find him revolting, and proposed several explanations: (a) bad eyesight and faulty hearing, (b)a defect in a portion of her otherwise sound intellect, (c) an inherited Trent eccentricity, or (d) an act of God. Since the Almighty had not done him a single act of kindness in at least twenty-five years, Dain thought it was about bloody time, but he thanked his Heavenly Father all the same, and promised to be as good as he was capable of being.”

author: Melina Marchetta,
title: “I didn't know you had a girlfriend, Griggs." Anson Choi feigns surprise. "What's her name?"

author: James Dashner,
title: “Thomas: Is it [my brain] fixed?

author: Patricia Briggs,
title: “You should be home sleeping. What is the use of having a man in the house, if he cannot take care of you for a while?”

author: Morrissey
title: “Can you squeeze me

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.”

author: Joss Whedon
title: “As we all know, blinking lights means science.”

author: P.C. Cast
title: “Who knew hitting my head and passing out would be so much fun?”

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: “All happiness depends on courage and work.”

author: Albert Einstein

author: Edith Wharton

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
