author: Amy Harmon,
title: “I don't think we get answers to every question. We don't get all the whys. But I think when we look back to the end of our lives, if we do the best we can, and we will see that the things we begged God to take from us, the things we cursed him for, the things that made us turn our backs on him, are the things that were the biggest blessings, the biggest opportunities for growth.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Go and get your things,' he said. 'Dreams mean work.”

author: John Cage
title: “I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.”

author: Charlie Chaplin
title: “In the end, everything is a gag.”

author: Laurell K. Hamilton,
title: “I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.”

author: Garth Stein,
title: “To separate oneself from the burden, the angst, the anguish that we all encounter everyday. To say I am alive, I am wonderful, I am. I am. That is something to aspire to.”

author: Yana Toboso
title: “So what? You're another person, so of course you look different. What do you need to be ashamed for?”

author: Kelly Cutrone,
title: “Things will change: you won't feel this way forever. And anyway, sometimes the hardest lessons to learn are the ones your soul needs most.”

author: Amit Ray,
title: “God is whispering in your heart, in the whole existence, just tune your ears.”

author: robert m drake
title: “Society will always be too fragile to accept us for all that makes us beautiful.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “The strength of a man isn't seen in the power of his arms. It's seen in the love with which he EMBRACES you.”

author: robert m drake
title: “Appreciate the moment of a first kiss; it may be the last time you own your heart.”

author: Elon Musk
title: “When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favour.”

author: Lloyd Alexander,
title: “Indeed, the more we find to love, the more we add to the measure of our hearts.”

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: “A successful marriage requires falling in love many times -- always with the same person.”

author: Bruce Lee
title: “The More we value things, the less we value ourselves”

author: Anais Nin
title: “I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.”

author: Emily Brontë,
title: “I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.”

author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
title: “If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.”

author: E.E. Cummings
title: “Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.”

author: Rita Mae Brown,
title: “Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.”

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: “Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.”

author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: “I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.”

author: J.D. Salinger,
title: “I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: “From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.”

author: V. S. Naipaul,
title: “The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.”

author: Tim Burton
title: “One person's craziness is another person's reality.”

author: J.M. Barrie,
title: “When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.”

author: Anne Rice
title: “You do have a story inside you; it lies articulate and waiting to be written — behind your silence and your suffering.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...”

author: Taylor Swift,
title: “I don't think you should wait. I think you should speak now.”

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: “It is foolish to tear one’s hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less by baldness.”

author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi,
title: “You have forgotten the One

author: Josh Groban
title: “No matter who we are, no matter what our circumstances, our feelings and emotions are universal. And music has always been a great way to make people aware of that connection. It can help you open up a part of yourself and express feelings you didn't know you were feeling. It's risky to let that happen. But it's a risk you have to take-because only then will you find you're not alone.”

author: Max Lucado (Grace for the Moment)
title: “God is God. He knows what he is doing. When you can’t trace his hand, trust his heart.”

author: Arthur Golden,
title: “Watch for the thing that will show itself to you. Because that thing, when you find it, will be your future.”

author: Thomas A. Kempis
title: “Love feels no burden, thinks nothing of its trouble, attempts what is above its strength, pleads no excuse for impossibility, for it thinks all things are lawful for itself and all things are possible”

author: Mark A. Cooper,
title: “Everyone kept telling me not to worry someone will do something. No one did so I became someone and did something.”

author: Sujiwo Tejo
title: “Tuhan kan nggak mungkin langsung sedekah ke orang-orang, ya kalianlah sedekah duit kalau punya duit, sedekah ilmu, sedekah senyum.

author: Lilly Singh
title: “Happiness is the only thing worth fighting for in life.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “We don’t truly appreciate what we have until it’s gone… We don’t really appreciate something until we have experienced some events; we don't really appreciate our parents until we ourselves have become parents. Be grateful for what you have now, and nothing should be taken for granted.”

author: Billie Joe Armstrong
title: “To do something that you feel in your heart that's great, you need to make a lot of mistakes. Anything that's successful is a series of mistakes.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.”

author: George Orwell,
title: “The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.”

author: Bob Dylan
title: “Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.”

author: Dante Alighieri
title: “My course is set for an uncharted sea.”

author: Honoré de Balzac,
title: “The more one judges, the less one loves.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,
title: “We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “An Unbreakable Vow?" said Ron, looking stunned. "Nah, he can’t have.... Are you sure?"

author: Yann Martel,
title: “To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “I have faith that God will show you the answer. But you have to understand that sometimes it takes a while to be able to recognize what God wants you to do. That's how it often is. God's voice is usually nothing more than a whisper, and you have to listen very carefully to hear it. But other times, in those rarest of moments, the answer is obvious and rings as loud as a church bell.”

author: Sylvia Plath
title: “Is there no way out of the mind?”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.”

author: Lemony Snicket,
title: “It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: “Courage is found in unlikely places.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.”

author: Lauren Oliver,
title: “I'd rather die my way than live yours.”

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: “The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.”

author: Julio Cortázar
title: “Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.”

author: Stephen King
title: “I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.”

author: Joyce Carol Oates
title: “Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.”

author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
title: “Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.”

author: Anthony Powell
title: “I get a warm feeling among my books.”

author: Jo Walton,
title: “It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.”

author: Rebecca West
title: “I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.”

author: Randy Pausch,
title: “The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together”

author: Lao Tsu,
title: “Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.”

author: Jack Kornfield,
title: “In the end

author: Neil LaBute,
title: “The future is now. It's time to grow up and be strong. Tomorrow may well be too late.”

author: Donna Tartt,
title: “Beauty is terror. Whatever we call beautiful, we quiver before it.”

author: Karen Blixen
title: “I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea.”

author: Dr. Seuss
title: “Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson,
title: “I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.”

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
title: “Nothing great in the world was accomplished without passion.”

author: Agatha Christie,
title: “Very few of us are what we seem.”

author: Edward Abbey
title: “Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.”

author: Heinrich Heine
title: “Where words leave off, music begins.”

author: Santosh Kalwar,
title: “We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.”

author: Steve Martin
title: “Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.”

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.”

author: Taylor Swift,
title: “We should love, not fall in love, because everything that falls, gets broken.”

author: Michelle Hodkin,
title: “You are what happiness means to me. And I would rather have today with you than forever with anyone else.”

author: Amy Carmichael
title: “Give me the Love that leads the way

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
title: “I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.”

author: Marguerite Duras,
title: “You have to be very fond of men. Very, very fond. You have to be very fond of them to love them. Otherwise they're simply unbearable.”

author: Katie McGarry,
title: “We’d read about sirens in English this fall; Greek mythology bullshit about women so beautiful, their voices so enchanting, that men did anything for them. Turned out that mythology crap was real because every time I saw her, I lost my mind.”

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
title: “Your problem is you don't understand what that word means. People think a soul mate is your perfect fit, and that's what everyone wants. But a true soul mate is a mirror, the person who shows you everything that's holding you back, the person who brings you to your attention so you can change your life. A true soul mate is probably the most important person you'll ever meet, because they tear down your walls and smack you awake. But to live with a soul mate forever? Nah. Too painful. Soul mates, they come into your life just to reveal another layer of yourself to you, and then they leave.”

author: Emily Dickinson,
title: “We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.”

author: Ann Brashares,
title: “You know what the secret is? It's so simple. We love one another. We're nice to one another. Do you know how rare that is? - Carmen”

author: Jack Johnson
title: “But you're so busy changing the world

author: Morgan Matson,
title: “Daddy," I whispered, feeling my own breath hitch in my throat. "I love you."

author: Gayle G. Roper,
title: “Find a woman who makes you feel more alive. She won't make life perfect but she'll make it infinitely more interesting. And then love her with all that's in you.”

author: Timothy Keller,
title: “The gospel is this: We are more sinful and flawed in ourselves than we ever dared believe, yet at the very same time we are more loved and accepted in Jesus Christ than we ever dared hope.”

author: Ranata Suzuki
title: “…the sad part is, that I will probably end up loving you without you for much longer than I loved you when I knew you.

author: Hanako Ishii
title: “Tell me the story..

author: Rilke Rainer Maria
title: “Once the realization is accepted that even between the closest human beings infinite distances continue, a wonderful living side by side can grow, if they succeed in loving the distance between them which makes it possible for each to see the other whole against the sky.”

author: Laini Taylor,
title: “Brimstone once told me that to stay true in the face of evil is a feat of strength.”

author: Santosh Kalwar,
title: “Do not become someone else just because you are hurt. Be who you are & smile, it may solve, all problems you have got.”

author: Robert E. Lee
title: “I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.”

author: Will Smith
title: “We spend money that we do not have, on things we do not need, to impress people who do not care.”

author: Lao Tzu
title: “There is

author: Ally Carter,
title: “The whole summer lay ahead of us-time to rest, time to wait. And when the future comes-no matter what comes with it-I'll be smarter. I'll be stronger. I'll be ready.”

author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
title: “it takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeded.”

author: Chad Sugg
title: “Something amazing happens when you're in love and don't give a damn about what day it is anymore.”

author: Sarah Ockler,
title: “I really don't even know you, and yet, in my life, you are forever entangled; to my history, inextricably bound.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “No matter how much you love someone, you still want to have you own way.”

author: Roland Barthes,
title: “You see the first thing we love is a scene. For love at first sight requires the very sign of its suddenness; and of all things, it is the scene which seems to be seen best for the first time: a curtain parts and what had not yet ever been seen is devoured by the eyes: the scene consecrates the object I am going to love. The context is the constellation of elements, harmoniously arranged that encompass the experience of the amorous subject...

author: Michelle Hodkin,
title: “Maybe sometimes we can only see the truth about ourselves if someone shows us where to look.”

author: Kiera Cass,
title: “I loved him.

author: Bell Hooks,
title: “The practice of love offers no place of safety. We risk loss, hurt, pain. We risk being acted upon by forces outside our control.”

author: V.E. Schwab,
title: “Caring was a thing with claws. It sank them in, and didn’t let go. Caring hurt more than a knife to the leg, more than a few broken ribs, more than anything that bled or broke and healed again. Caring didn’t break you clean. It was a bone that didn’t set, a cut that wouldn’t close.”

author: Philippa Gregory,
title: “I can't sleep, I can't eat, I can't do anything but think about him. At night I dream of him, all day I wait to see him, and when I do see him my heart turns over and I think I will faint with desire.”

author: Jason Mraz
title: “Because I trust in the ever-changing climate of the heart. (At least, today I feel that way.) I think it is necessary to have many experiences for the sake of feeling something; for the sake of being challenged, and for the sake of being expressive, to offer something to someone else, to learn what we are capable of.”

author: Samantha Young,
title: “I love you. You’re mine. I’ll kill any bastard who tries to take you from me.”

author: Kazuo Ishiguro,
title: “I keep thinking about this river somewhere, with the water moving really fast. And these two people in the water, trying to hold onto each other, holding on as hard as they can, but in the end it’s just too much. The current’s too strong. They’ve got to let go, drift apart.”

author: Greg Behrendt,
title: “There will never be a good time, financially, to get married, unless you're Shaq or Ray Romano. But somehow people manage. If your man is using money as an excuse not to marry you, it's your relationship that's insecure, not his bank account.”

author: Peter S. Beagle,
title: “Marveling at his own boldness, he said softly, "I would enter your sleep if I could, and guard you there, and slay the thing that hounds you, as I would if it had the courage to face me in fair daylight. But I cannot come in unless you dream of me.”

author: Lang Leav,
title: “What was it like to lose him?" Asked Sorrow.

author: Tara Westover,
title: “The decisions I made after that moment were not the ones she would have made. They were the choices of a changed person, a new self.

author: Robert T. Kiyosaki,
title: “I’d rather welcome change than cling to the past.”

author: Stephen King
title: “If you don’t have the time to do something right, where are you going to find the time to fix it?”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
title: “And the fox said to the little prince: men have forgotten this truth, but you must not forget it. You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.”

author: Alex  Harris
title: “We're called to be faithful, to take those first difficult steps--and to leave the results up to God.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “‎Today is a new day. It's a day you have never seen before and will never see again. Stop telling yourself the 'same crap, different day' lie! How many days has that lie stolen from you? Seize the wonder and uniqueness of today! Recognize that throughout this beautiful day, you have an incredible amount of opportunities to move your life into the direction you want it to go.”

author: Ahmad Fuadi
title: “Man jadda wajada

author: Shannon Hale
title: “What she had long believed was not true, and now the world was wide open to discover what was.

author: Daisaku Ikeda,
title: “A great human revolution in just a single individual will help achieve a change in the destiny of a nation and, further, can even enable a change in the destiny of all humankind.”

author: George Orwell,
title: “If you set yourself to it, you can live the same life, rich or poor. You can keep on with your books and your ideas. You just got to say to yourself, "I'm a free man in here" - he tapped his forehead - "and you're all right.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “It occurred to me by intuition, and music was the driving force behind that intuition. My discovery was the result of musical perception.”

author: Yoko Ono,
title: “A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.”

author: Kelley Armstrong,
title: “I want you to have big dreams, big goals. I want you to strive to achieve them. But I don't want to see you beating yourself up every time you make a mistake.”

author: Virginia Woolf,
title: “Yet there are moments when the walls of the mind grow thin; when nothing is unabsorbed, and I could fancy that we might blow so vast a bubble that the sun might set and rise in it and we might take the blue of midday and the black of midnight and be cast off and escape from here and now.”

author: Paolo Coelho
title: “I don't regret the painful times; I bare my scars as if they were medals.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.”

author: Swami Vivekananda
title: “Strength is Life, Weakness is Death.

author: W.C. Fields
title: “A thing worth having is a thing worth cheating for.”

author: Anne Frank,
title: “In spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart. I simply can't build up my hopes on a foundation consisting of confusion, misery and death.”

author: William Blake
title: “Better to shun the bait than struggle in the snare.”

author: Philip Pullman,
title: “You don't win races by wishing, you win them by running faster than everyone else does.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “I’ve met a man and fallen in love with him. I allowed myself to fall in love for one simple reason: I’m not expecting anything to come of it. I know that, in three months’ time, I’ll be far away and he’ll be just a memory, but I couldn’t stand living without love any longer; I had reached my limit…

author: Lauren Kate,
title: “Love never dies.”

author: John Lennon
title: “Everything is clearer when you're in love.”

author: Zelda Fitzgerald
title: “I love you, even if there isn’t any me, or any love, or even any life. I love you.”

author: George Eliot
title: “Poor fellow! I think he is in love with you.'

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “It's risky, falling in love."

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “If music be the food of love, play on.”

author: Maria V. Snyder,
title: “But you've slipped under my skin, invaded my blood and seized my heart.”

author: George Eliot
title: “Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.”

author: Dan Simmons,
title: “To see and feel one's beloved naked for the first time is one of life's pure, irreducible epiphanies. If there is a true religion in the universe, it must include that truth of contact or be forever hollow. To make love to the one true person who deserves that love is one of the few absolute rewards of being a human being, balancing all of the pain, loss, awkwardness, loneliness, idiocy, compromise, and clumsiness that go with the human condition. To make love to the right person makes up for a lot of mistakes.”

author: Plato
title: “You're my Star, a stargazer too,

author: Charlotte Brontë,
title: “Most true is it that 'beauty is in the eye of the gazer.' My master’s colourless, olive face, square, massive brow, broad and jetty eyebrows, deep eyes, strong features, firm, grim mouth, — all energy, decision, will, — were not beautiful, according to rule; but they were more than beautiful to me; they were full of an interest, an influence that quite mastered me, — that took my feelings from my own power and fettered them in his. I had not intended to love him; the reader knows I had wrought hard to extirpate from my soul the germs of love there detected; and now, at the first renewed view of him, they spontaneously arrived, green and strong! He made me love him without looking at me.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Every time I read to her, it was like I was courting her, because sometimes, just sometimes, she would fall in love with me again, just like she had a long time ago. And that's the most wonderful feeling in the world. How many people are ever given that chance? To have someone you love fall in love with you over and over?”

author: Francesca Lia Block,
title: “I want him to see the flowers in my eyes and hear the songs in my hands.”

author: Fredrik Backman,
title: “He went through life with his hands firmly shoved into his pockets. She danced.”

author: Kimberly Derting,
title: “He loved her.

author: Jamie McGuire,
title: “I thought I was going to sweat five years before I'd feel like this."

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “He can touch your soul. And there is a difference between having your heart break and having your soul shatter.”

author: Adriana Trigiani,
title: “Mom, how do you know if the guy is

author: Lauren Oliver,
title: “I told you," he whispers back. I can feel his breath just tickling the space behind my ear, making my hair prick up on my neck. "I like you."

author: Katja Millay,
title: “You know I meant it. I am human. And male. And not remotely blind. Do you want me to say it again? You are distractingly, even if-that-is-not-a-real-word pretty. You are so pretty that I bullied Clay Whitaker into drawing me a picture of you so I could look at you when you aren't around. You are so pretty that one of these days I'm going to lose a finger in my garage because I can't concentrate with you so close to me. You are so pretty that I wish you weren't so I wouldn't want to hit every guy at school who looks at you, especially my best friend.”

author: Ayn Rand
title: “Have you ever felt the longing for someone you could admire? For something, not to look down at, but up to?”

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “I found him carefully studying me, his lips in a thin line. “Has anyone ever taken care of you?” he asked quietly.

author: Jennifer E. Smith,
title: “Is it possible not to ever know your type-not to even know you have a type-until quite suddenly you do?”

author: Colleen Hoover,
title: “It’s easy to fall in love, Ben. The hard part comes when you want out.”

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: “The love we give away is the only love we keep.”

author: Leonard Cohen,
title: “... i didn't fall in love of course

author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,
title: “To find out if she really loved me, I hooked her up to a lie detector. And just as I suspected, my machine was broken. ”

author: Colleen Houck,
title: “A quiet but indomitable voice behind me said, “I believe this is my dance.” It was him. I could feel his presence. The warmth of him seeped into my back, and I quivered all over like spring leaves in a warm breeze.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “His eyes were on his heart, completely caught up in his work. 'Just something kicking around in my head. Reminds me of you. Fiery and sweet, all at the same time. A flame in the dark, lighting my way.' His voice... his words... I recognized one of his spirit-driven moments. It should've unnerved me, but there was something sensual about the way he spoke, something that made my breath catch.

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I think she just asked if she could touch my mango.”

author: Charles Bukowski
title: “To me, nudity is a joke. I don't think nude people are very attractive at all. I like my women fully clothed. I like to imagine what might be under there. It might not be the standard thing. Imagine, stripping a woman down, and she has a body like a little submarine. With periscope, propellers, torpedoes. That would be the one for me. I'd marry her right off and be faithful to the end.”

author: Nick Hornby,
title: “I read the fuck out of every book I can get my hands on.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “This is your copy of

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Sydney spent a lot of time on my bed these days.

author: Amy Sedaris,
title: “Sometimes losing a pet is more painful than losing a human because in the case of the pet, you were not pretending to love it.”

author: Robert A. Heinlein
title: “Climate is what you expect, weather is what you get.”

author: Daniel Keyes,
title: “Punctuation, is? fun!”

author: Flannery O'Connor,
title: “Total non-retention has kept my education from being a burden to me.”

author: H. L. Mencken,
title: “Truth would quickly cease to be stranger than fiction, once we got as used to it.”

author: Christopher Paolini,
title: “You would be amazed how many magicians have died after being bitten by mad rabbits. It's far more common than you might think.

author: William Goldman,
title: “I’m going to tell you something once and then whether you die is strictly up to you," Westley said, lying pleasantly on the bed. "What I’m going to tell you is this: drop your sword, and if you do, then I will leave with this baggage here"—he glanced at Buttercup—"and you will be tied up but not fatally, and will be free to go about your business. And if you choose to fight, well, then, we will not both leave alive."

author: Chetan Bhagat,
title: “Why should any guy want to be only friends with a girl? It’s like agreeing to be near a chocolate cake and never eat it. It’s like sitting in a racing car but not driving it.”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “Leo had seen Tia Callida in action; she liked knives, snakes and putting babies in roaring fires. Yeah, definitely let's unleash her rage. Great idea.”

author: T.H. White,
title: “The Destiny of Man is to unite, not to divide. If you keep on dividing you end up as a collection of monkeys throwing nuts at each other out of separate trees.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “There is one other reason for dressing well, namely that dogs respect it, and will not attack you in good clothes.”

author: Robert Byrne,
title: “To err is human, to purr is feline.”

author: Dave Barry
title: “As you get older; you've probably noticed that you tend to forget things. You'll be talking with somebody at a party, and you'll know that you know this person, but no matter how hard you try, you can't remember his or her name. This can be very embarassing, especially if he or she turns out to be your spouse.”

author: James Joyce
title: “Writing in English is the most ingenious torture ever devised for sins committed in previous lives. The English reading public explains the reason why.”

author: Janet Evanovich
title: “Men drive off bridges and drink too much because of women like you.”

author: Natsuki Takaya,
title: “Shigure: JUST LISTEN TO ME FOR A SECOND, KYO!

author: Scott Adams
title: “The first time you see something that you have never seen before, you almost always know right away if you should eat it or run away from it.”

author: Maria V. Snyder,
title: “Another relative?" Valek asked.

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “An Assassin, a real Assassin, had to look like one - black clothes, hood, boots, and all. If they could wear any clothes, any disguise, then what could anyone do but spend all day in a small room with a loaded crossbow pointed at the door?”

author: Tonya Hurley,
title: “Life sucks, then you die. Then it sucks again. ”

author: Chuck Klosterman,
title: “There are two ways to look at life. The first view is that nothing stays the same and that nothing is inherently connected, and that the only driving force in anyone's life is entropy. The second is that everything pretty much stays the same (more or less) and that everything is completely connected, even if we don't realize it.”

author: Rachel Caine,
title: “You're kidding," Shane said. "Do you think I want to visit Crazy McTeeth in his lair of insanity?"

author: Chelsea Handler
title: “Men don’t realize that if we’re sleeping with them on the first date, we’re probably not interested in seeing them again either.”

author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips,
title: “Did you eat my Twinkies?"

author: Rachel Caine,
title: “Sure,” she said, and hugged the laptop bag closer. “What could go wrong?”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “It is a serious thing to live in a society of possible gods and goddesses, to remember that the dullest most uninteresting person you can talk to may one day be a creature which,if you saw it now, you would be strongly tempted to worship, or else a horror and a corruption such as you now meet, if at all, only in a nightmare. All day long we are, in some degree helping each other to one or the other of these destinations. It is in the light of these overwhelming possibilities, it is with the awe and the circumspection proper to them, that we should conduct all of our dealings with one another, all friendships, all loves, all play, all politics. There are no ordinary people. You have never talked to a mere mortal. Nations, cultures, arts, civilizations - these are mortal, and their life is to ours as the life of a gnat. But it is immortals whom we joke with, work with, marry, snub, and exploit - immortal horrors or everlasting splendors.”

author: jonathan safran foer
title: “Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on.

author: Steve Jobs
title: “Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.”

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: “Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.”

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “Yes, terrible things happen, but sometimes those terrible things- they save you.”

author: Andrea Hirata,
title: “Hiduplah Untuk Memberi yang Sebanyak-banyaknya, Bukan untuk Menerima yang Sebanyak-banyaknya. (Pak Harfan)”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “The level of success you achieve will be in direct proportion to the depth of your commitment.”

author: Meister Eckhart
title: “Spirituality is not to be learned by flight from the world, or by running away from things, or by turning solitary and going apart from the world. Rather, we must learn an inner solitude wherever or with whomsoever we may be. We must learn to penetrate things and find God there.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “Now you people have names. That's because you don't know who you are. We know who we are, so we don't need names.”

author: Isabelle Eberhardt,
title: “For those who know the value of and exquisite taste of solitary freedom (for one is only free when alone), the act of leaving is the bravest and most beautiful of all.”

author: Helen Keller
title: “Four things to learn in life: To think clearly without hurry or confusion; To love everybody sincerely; To act in everything with the highest motives; To trust God unhesitatingly.”

author: Karl Menninger
title: “Love cures people, both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.”

author: Warren Ellis
title: “Dance like you're stamping on a human face forever, love like you've been in a serious car crash that minced the front of your brain, stab like no one can arrest you, and live like there's no such thing as God.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “I will be generous with my love today. I will sprinkle compliments and uplifting words everywhere I go. I will do this knowing that my words are like seeds and when they fall on fertile soil, a reflection of those seeds will grow into something greater.”

author: Steven Moffat
title: “The universe is big. It's vast and complicated and ridiculous. And sometimes—very rarely—impossible things just happen and we call them miracles.”

author: James Patterson; Maxine Paetro
title: “It's been said that love finds you when you're ready.”

author: Jane Hamilton
title: “It is books that are a key to the wide world; if you can't do anything else, read all that you can.”

author: Jaeda DeWalt
title: “To be deeply loved, means a willingness to cut yourself wide open, exposing your vulnerabilities... hopes, hurts, fears and flaws. Hiding behind the highlight reel of who you are, is the real you and that person is just as worthy of love. There is nothing more terrifying or fulfilling, than complete love, it's worth the risk... reach for it.”

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.”

author: Cassandra Clare
title: “My rapier wit hides my inner pain.”

author: Aung San Suu Kyi
title: “The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.”

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: “The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,

author: Julia Child
title: “A party without cake is just a meeting”

author: Jamie McGuire,
title: “I know we're fucked up, alright? I'm impulsive, and hot tempered, and you get under my skin like no one else. You act like you hate me one minute, and then need me the next. I never get anything right, and I don't deserve you...but I fucking love you, Abby. I love you more than I loved anyone or anything ever. When you're around, I don't need booze, or money, or the fighting, or the one-night stands...”

author: Terry Pratchett
title: “It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.”

author: Stieg Larsson,
title: “What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.”

author: Patrick Rothfuss,
title: “It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.”

author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
title: “How strange is man that when he is afraid of something he runs away from it, but when he is afraid of Allah, he gets closer to Him.”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “I should have learned this, she thought. I wanted to learn fire, and pain, but I should have learned people.”

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,
title: “And so I ask myself: 'Where are your dreams?' And I shake my head and mutter: 'How the years go by!' And I ask myself again: 'What have you done with those years? Where have you buried your best moments? Have you really lived? Look,' I say to myself, 'how cold it is becoming all over the world!' And more years will pass and behind them will creep grim isolation. Tottering senility will come hobbling, leaning on a crutch, and behind these will come unrelieved boredom and despair. The world of fancies will fade, dreams will wilt and die and fall like autumn leaves from the trees. . . .”

author: Barbara Cameron,
title: “Worrying is arrogant because God knows what He's doing.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “If I look at the mass I will never act.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “This new day has greeted us with no rules; unconditional opportunity. Do not dilute the power of this new day with the hardship of yesterday. Greet this day the way it has greeted you; with open arms and endless possibility.”

author: Sarah Dessen
title: “When I pictured myself, it was always like just an outline in a colouring book, with the inside not yet completed.”

author: Victor Hugo
title: “Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet.”

author: Amit Ray
title: “Have love for your inner Self and everything else is done for you.”

author: Nick Hornby
title: “Sometimes you know you've got a chance with a girl because she wants to fight with you. If the world wasn't so messed up, it wouldn't be like that. If the world was normal, a girl being nice to you would be a good sign, but in the real world, it isn't.”

author: Cecily von Ziegesar,
title: “Not that she didn't love almost every boy she'd ever met, and not that every boy in the world didn't totally love her. It was impossible not to. But she wanted someone to love her and shower her with attention the way only a boy who was completely in love with her could. The rare sort of love. True love. The kind of love she'd never had.”

author: Brian Tracy
title: “Love only grows by sharing. You can only have more for yourself by giving it away to others.”

author: Mitch Albom,
title: “I used to think I knew everything. I was a "smart person" who "got things done," and because of that, the higher I climbed, the more I could look down and scoff at what seemed silly or simple, even religion.

author: Robert Browning
title: “how sad and bad and mad it was - but then, how it was sweet”

author: P.C. Cast  Kristin Cast
title: “If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.”

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “so I wait for you like a lonely house

author: Emilie Autumn,
title: “It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.”

author: Jim Butcher
title: “When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. ”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.”

author: Stieg Larsson,
title: “Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.”

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: “There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.”

author: Stephenie Meyer,
title: “Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.”

author: Bernard Baruch
title: “Never follow the crowd.”

author: Thomas Jefferson,
title: “I wish that all nations may recover and retain their independence; that those which are overgrown may not advance beyond safe measures of power, that a salutary balance may be ever maintained among nations, and that our peace, commerce, and friendship, may be sought and cultivated by all. It is our business to manufacture for ourselves whatever we can, to keep our markets open for what we can spare or want; and the less we have to do with the amities or enmities of Europe, the better. Not in our day, but at no distant one, we may shake a rod over the heads of all, which may make the stoutest of them tremble.

author: Bob Marley
title: “Everytime I plant a seed,he say kill it before it grow, he say kill it before they grow.”

author: C.S. Pacat,
title: “How can you trust me, after what your own brother did to you?"

author: Eugene O'Neill
title: “Man is born broken. He lives by mending. The grace of God is glue.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “One of the best ways to influence people is to make those around you feel important.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “O, here

author: Masashi Kishimoto
title: “There's only one thing that can heal the heart... Only one... It's love, Gaara.”

author: Tim Farrington,
title: “We are born to love as we are born to die, and between the heartbeats of those two great mysteries lies all the tangled undergrowth of our tiny lives. There is nowhere to go but through. And so we walk on, lost, and lost again, in the mapless wilderness of love.”

author: Tahereh Mafi,
title: “I love you," I whisper. "I love you exactly as you are.”

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,
title: “Man...heats up like a lightbulb: red hot in the twinkling of an eye and cold again in a flash. The female, on the other hand...heats up like an iron. Slowly, over a low heat, like tasty stew. But then, once she has heated up, there's no stopping her.”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “Love [is] supposed to move mountains, to make the world go round, to be all you need, but it [falls] apart at the deatils. It [can't] save a single person.”

author: Anaïs Nin
title: “When your beauty struck me, it dissolved me. Deep down, I am not different from you. I dreamed you, I wished for your existence. I see in you that part of me which is you. I surrender my sincerity because if I love you it means we share the same fantasies, we share the same madness.”

author: John Green,
title: “Love is keeping the promise anyway.”

author: J. California Cooper
title: “Love entered in my heart one day

author: Nalini Singh,
title: “Emotion without reason lets people walk all over you; reason without emotion is a mask for cruelty.”

author: Laozi,
title: “Love

author: Anne Tyler
title: “It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice.”

author: John Green,
title: “Headline?" he asked.

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “[D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for.

author: W.B. Yeats
title: “The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?”

author: Charles Lamb
title: “I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.”

author: Glen Cook,
title: “Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.”

author: Virginia Woolf,
title: “Just in case you ever foolishly forget; I'm never not thinking of you.”

author: Carrie Ryan,
title: “You stay safe, You love. You survive. You laugh and cry and struggle and sometimes you fail and sometimes you succeed. You Push.”

author: L.J. Smith,
title: “People Die...

author: Anne Bishop,
title: “Is that why you've been pushing me away? Because of how you

author: Mitch Albom,
title: “I realized when you look at your mother, you are looking at the purest love you will ever know.”

author: Gabriel García Márquez,
title: “Intrigued by that enigma, he dug so deeply into her sentiments that in search of interest he found love, because by trying to make her love him he ended up falling in love with her.”

author: Lisa Kleypas,
title: “I love you, he thought, looking at Win. I love every part of you, every thought and word... the entire complex, fascinating bundle of all the things you are. I want you with ten different kinds of need at once. I love all the seasons of you, the way you are now, the thought of how much more beautiful you'll be in the decades to come. I love you for being the answer to every question my heart could ask.

author: Katherine Owen,
title: “There are all kinds of ways for a relationship to be tested, even broken, some, irrevocably; it’s the endings we’re unprepared for.”

author: Margaret Atwood
title: “The Eskimo has fifty-names for snow because it is important to them; there ought to be as many for love.”

author: Colleen Houck
title: “He kissed me wildly, overwhelming me like a giant wave rushing to shore. I was soon lost in the turbulent grasp of his embrace and yet…I knew I was safe. His wild kiss drove me, pushed me, asked me questions I was unwilling to consider. But I was cherished by this dark Poseidon, and though he had the power to crush me utterly, to drown me in the purple depths of his wake, he held me aloft, separate. His passionate kiss changed. It gentled and soothed and entreated. Together we drifted towards a safe harbor. The god of the sea set me down securely on a sandy beach and steadied me as I trembled. Effervescent tingles shot through my limbs delighting me with surges of sparkling sensation like sandy toes tickled by bubbly waves. Finally, the waves moved away and I felt my Poseidon watching me from a distance. We looked at each other knowing we were forever changed by the experience. We both knew that I would always belong to the sea and that I would never be able to part from it and be whole again.”

author: Dorothy Day,
title: “We have all known the long loneliness and we have learned that the only solution is love and that love comes with community.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “Ronan's second secret was Adam Parrish.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “Many, many readers have written asking me wistfully about the nature of Sam and Grace's relationship, and I can assure you, that sort is absolutely real. Mutual, respectful, enduring love is completely attainable as long as you swear you won't settle for less.”

author: William Goldman,
title: “When I was your age, television was called books.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “Tears are words that need to be written.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.”

author: Daniel J. Boorstin
title: “The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.”

author: Evelyn Waugh,
title: “Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.”

author: Lemony Snicket,
title: “Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.”

author: Arundhati Roy,
title: “That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
title: “How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.”

author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,
title: “If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: “Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Acts of Kindness:

author: Boris Pasternak
title: “I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them. ”

author: J. K. Rowling,
title: “What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.”

author: Ransom Riggs,
title: “I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.”

author: Blaise Pascal
title: “The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.”

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,
title: “Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.”

author: Charles Bukowski
title: “Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.”

author: Phyllis Diller
title: “A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.”

author: Michael Crichton
title: “If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. ”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “You can make anything by writing.”

author: Audrey Hepburn
title: “If I’m honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.”

author: Gustave Flaubert
title: “Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “Black holes are where God divided by zero.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe,
title: “Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,

author: Ray Bradbury
title: “You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.”

author: Cornelia Funke,
title: “Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.”

author: Masashi Kishimoto
title: “People live their lives bound by what they accept as correct and true. That’s how they define Reality. But what does it mean to be “correct” or “true”? Merely vague concepts… Their Reality may all be a mirage. Can we consider them to simply be living in their own world, shaped by their beliefs?”

author: Abraham Lincoln,
title: “Fourscore and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent, a new nation, conceived in Liberty, and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal.”

author: Agatha Christie,
title: “To every problem, there is a most simple solution.”

author: Ashley  Smith
title: “Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.”

author: Marcus Aurelius,
title: “Don't go on discussing what a good person should be. Just be one.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “There are not enough days in forever to allow me to fully express the depth of my love for you.”

author: Philip Pullman,
title: “As for what it's against - the story is against those who pervert and misuse religion, or any other kind of doctrine with a holy book and a priesthood and an apparatus of power that wields unchallengeable authority, in order to dominate and suppress human freedoms.”

author: Jim Rohn
title: “Successful people have libraries. The rest have big screen TVs”

author: Connor Franta
title: “I don’t want anyone to hold back who they are. It’s not okay… it’s not a good thing”

author: Antoine St
title: “My life is very monotonous," the fox said. "I hunt chickens: men hunt me. All the chickens are just alike, and all the men are just alike. And, in consequence, I am a little bored. But if you tame me, it will be as if the sun came to shine on my life. I shall know the sound of a step that will be different from all the others. Other steps send me hurrying back underneath the ground. Yours will call me, like music, out of my burrow. And then look: you see the grain fields down yonder? [...] The wheat fields have nothing to say to me. And that is sad. But you have hair that is the color of gold. Think how wonderful that will be when you have tamed me! The grain, which is also golden, will bring me back to the thought of you. And I shall love to listen to the wheat in the wind...”

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
title: “Day after day, day after day,

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Nobody is exempt from the trials of life, but everyone can always find something positive in everything even in the worst of times.”

author: Bernard Baruch
title: “Vote for the man who promises least; he'll be the least disappointing.”

author: Dolly Parton
title: “Storms make trees take deeper roots.”

author: Patricia Briggs,
title: “When life doesn't meet your expectations, it was important to take it with grace.”

author: robert m drake
title: “She was broken, I think it’s because she loved too much and she was always blind to the fact that love too is sometimes broken.”

author: Augustine of Hippo,
title: “Once for all, then, a short precept is given thee: Love, and do what thou wilt: whether thou hold thy peace, through love hold thy peace; whether thou cry out, through love cry out; whether thou correct, through love correct; whether thou spare, through love do thou spare: let the root of love be within, of this root can nothing spring but what is good.”

author: Corrie ten Boom
title: “When I try, I fail.

author: Og Mandino
title: “Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside. Remember that there is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Reach out. Share. Smile. Hug. Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.”

author: Jim Carrey
title: “You can fail at what you don't want, so you might as well take a chance on doing what you love.”

author: Cheryl Lacey Donovan,
title: “Mother is a verb. It's something you do. Not just who you are.”

author: Christopher Brennan
title: “Were knowledge all, what were our need

author: Socrates
title: “The greatest blessing granted to mankind come by way of madness, which is a divine gift.”

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: “Do not fear the thorns in your path, for they draw only corrupt blood.”

author: عمر طاهر,
title: “إن كان في حياتك تمّة شئٌ يستحقُ التأجيل ... فليكن التأجيلُ نفسُه”

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: “O love, O fire! once he drew

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “To me, when someone wrongs you, you both share the burden of that wrongdoing - the pain of it weighs on both of you. Forgiveness, then, means choosing to bear the full weight all by yourself. Caleb's betrayal is something we both carry, and since he did it, all I've wanted is for him to take its weight away from me. I am not sure that I'm capable of shouldering it all myself - not sure that I am strong enough, or good enough.”

author: Peter Kreeft,
title: “The heart is like a woman, and the head is like a man, and although man is the head of woman, woman is the heart of man, and she turns man's head because she turns his heart.”

author: Melina Marchetta,
title: “Don't let anyone take care of you. Can you maybe leave that for me to do? I mean, take care of you? Feel free to take care of me in return... because I think I'll need you to do that.”

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: “A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.”

author: Joshua Harris
title: “‎True love isn't expressed in passionately whispered words an intimate kiss or a embrace; before two people are married, love is expressed in self-control, patience, even words left unsaid.”

author: Charles Dickens
title: “A man is lucky if he is the first love of a woman. A woman is lucky if she is the last love of a man.”

author: Miley Cyrus
title: “I like being the girl nobody can have.”

author: Jess C Scott,
title: “I suppose it’s not a social norm, and not a manly thing to do — to feel, discuss feelings. So that’s what I’m giving the finger to. Social norms and stuff…what good are social norms, really? I think all they do is project a limited and harmful image of people. It thus impedes a broader social acceptance of what someone, or a group of people, might actually be like.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “It is only with true love and compassion that we can begin to mend what is broken in the world. It is these two blessed things that can begin to heal all broken hearts.”

author: Dodie Smith,
title: “Perhaps watching someone you love suffer can teach you even more than suffering yourself can.”

author: Sarah Addison Allen,
title: “Every life needs a little space. It leaves room for good things to enter it.”

author: Koushun Takami,
title: “Loving someone always requires you to not love others.”

author: Criss Jami,
title: “The reality of loving God is loving him like he's a Superhero who actually saved you from stuff rather than a Santa Claus who merely gave you some stuff.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “When you say "I" and "my" too much, you lose the capacity to understand the "we" and "our".”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Maybe it's just hiding somewhere. Or gone on a trip to come home. But falling in love is always a pretty crazy thing. It might appear out of the blue and just grab you. Who knows — maybe even tomorrow.”

author: Stefan Zweig,
title: “The strength of a love is always misjudged if we evaluate it by its immediate cause and not the stress that went before it, the dark and hollow space full of disappointment and loneliness that precedes all the great events in the heart's history.”

author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips,
title: “When male authors write love stories, the heroine tends to end up dead.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “It's more like you meet someone, and you fall in love, and you

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Vladimir did great things—so could she. Besides, they come first, right?"

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “He looked at his friend, perhaps for the last time, and said what he had always known, from the moment they’d met, when he’d understood that the prince was his brother in soul. “I love you.”

author: Tyler Knott Gregson
title: “I believe

author: Dejan Stojanovic
title: “It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it.”

author: Emma Thompson,
title: “Can he love her? Can the soul really be satisfied with such polite affections? To love is to burn - to be on fire, like Juliet or Guinevere or Eloise...”

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “So, it's not gonna be easy. It's gonna be really hard. We're gonna have to work at this every day, but I want to do that because I want you. I want all of you, forever, you and me, every day. Will you do something for me, please? Just picture your life for me? Thirty years from now, forty years from now? What's it look like? If it's with him- go. Go! I lost you once, I think I can do it again, if I thought that's what you really wanted. But don't you take the easy way out.”

author: Alessandra Torre
title: “The true measure of a man is how he treats you when others are not looking.”

author: Denice Envall
title: “I miss you in waves and tonight I’m drowning. You left me fending for my life and it feels like you’re the only one who can bring me back to the shore alive.”

author: Ilona Andrews,
title: “I’d missed him so much, it almost hurt. It started the moment I left the Keep and nagged at me all day. Every day I had to fight with myself to keep from making up bullshit reasons to call the Keep so I could hear his voice. My only saving grace was that Curran wasn’t handling this whole mating thing any better. Yesterday he’d called me at the office claiming that he couldn’t find his socks. We talked for two hours.”

author: Ayn Rand,
title: “Productiveness is your acceptance of morality, your recognition of the fact that you choose to live--that productive work is the process by which man's consciousness controls his existence, a constant process of acquiring knowledge and shaping matter to fit one's purpose, of translating an idea into physical form, of remaking the earth in the image of one's values--that all work is creative work if done by a thinking mind, and no work is creative if done by a blank who repeats in uncritical stupor a routine he has learned from others--that your work is yours to choose, and the choice is as wide as your mind, that nothing more is possible to you and nothing less is human--that to cheat your way into a job bigger than your mind can handle is to become a fear-corroded ape on borrowed motions and borrowed time, and to settle down into a job that requires less than your mind's full capacity is to cut your motor and sentence yourself to another kind of motion: decay--that your work is the process of achieving your values, and to lose your ambition for values is to lose your ambition to live--that your body is a machine, but your mind is its driver, and you must drive as far as your mind will take you, with achievement as the goal of your road--that the man who has no purpose is a machine that coasts downhill at the mercy of any boulder to crash in the first chance ditch, that the man who stifles his mind is a stalled machine slowly going to rust, that the man who lets a leader prescribe his course is a wreck being towed to the scrap heap, and the man who makes another man his goal is a hitchhiker no driver should ever pick up--that your work is the purpose of your life, and you must speed past any killer who assumes the right to stop you, that any value you might find outside your work, any other loyalty or love, can be only travelers you choose to share your journey and must be travelers going on their own power in the same direction.”

author: Rachel Cohn,
title: “We are the ones who take this thing called music and line it up with this thing called time. We are the ticking, we are the pulsing, we are underneath every part of this moment. And by making the moment our own, we are rendering it timeless. There is no audience. There are no instruments. There are only bodies and thoughts and murmurs and looks. It's the concert rush to end all concert rushes, because this is what matters. When the heart races, this is what it's racing towards.”

author: Gwen Hayes,
title: “This isn't a crush, it's obsession.You are never not in my thoughts. Your scent carries across a room and paralyzes me with longing. I don't want to hold your hand. Part of me wants to set you on fire and hold you while the flame consumes us both, to eat your heart so I know that only I possess it entirely.”

author: Gwen Hayes,
title: “Do you think it’s easy for me? No, I don’t remember you. I don’t remember holding you or talking to you or falling in love with you—but I walk around with a giant hole in my heart all the time. I feel your absence every second of the day. It aches and nothing soothes it. Losing you is bad enough, but I don’t even get the comfort of remembering that I had you once.

author: Marilyn Monroe,
title: “You might as well make yourself fly as to make yourself love.”

author: Sarah Dessen
title: “The truth was I knew, after all those flat January days, that I deserved better. I deserved I love yous and kiwi fruits and warriors coming to my door, besotted with love. I deserved pictures of my face in a thousand expressions, and the warmth of a baby's kick beneath my hand. I deserved to grow, and to change, to become all the girls I could be over the course of my life, each one better than the last.”

author: George MacDonald,
title: “Her heart - like every heart, if only its fallen sides were cleared away - was an inexhaustible fountain of love: she loved everything she saw. ”

author: Laini Taylor,
title: “Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut
title: “Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.”

author: Rumi,
title: “Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.”

author: Charles Bukowski,
title: “the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.”

author: Bob Marley
title: “The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.”

author: John Green,
title: “You like someone who can't like you back because unrequited love can be survived in a way that once-requited love cannot. ”

author: مصطفى محمود,
title: “الكراهية تكلف أكثر من الحب.. لأنها إحساس غير طبيعي.. إحساس عكسي مثل حركة الأجسام ضد جاذبية الأرض.. تحتاج إلى قوة إضافية وتستهلك وقوداً أكثر”

author: Ben Okri
title: “Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.”

author: W.C. Fields
title: “It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
title: “I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.”

author: Sarah Dessen
title: “Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson,
title: “I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.”

author: Christopher Hitchens
title: “That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Don't let the expectations and opinions of other people affect your decisions. It's your life, not theirs. Do what matters most to you; do what makes you feel alive and happy. Don't let the expectations and ideas of others limit who you are. If you let others tell you who you are, you are living their reality — not yours. There is more to life than pleasing people. There is much more to life than following others' prescribed path. There is so much more to life than what you experience right now. You need to decide who you are for yourself. Become a whole being. Adventure.”

author: Socrates
title: “There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.”

author: Jeffrey Eugenides,
title: “A love story can never be about full possession. The happy marriage, the requited love, the desire that never dims--these are lucky eventualites but they aren't love stories. Love stories depend on disappointment, on unequal births and feuding families, on matrimonial boredom and at least one cold heart. Love stories, nearly without exception, give love a bad name.

author: Shannon L. Alder
title: “A competitive and insecure woman will tell you that “true love” is never giving up on someone you're in love with. A confident and spiritual woman knows that “moving on” doesn’t mean you never loved someone. She realizes that letting go is what God needs her to do because both your happiness and hers requires taking different journeys for spiritual growth. Letting go is sometimes the hardest thing, but it is the most “real love” you will ever experience.”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “A kiss may ruin a human life”

author: Sylvia Plath
title: “How we need that security. How we need another soul to cling to, another body to keep us warm. To rest and trust; to give your soul in confidence: I need this. I need someone to pour myself into.”

title: “Jessica. For god's sake," he said. "Allow me to do at least one common courtesy for you. In spite ow what 'women's lib' teaches you, chivalry does not imply that women are powerless. On the contrary, chivalry is an admission of women's superiority. An acknowledgment of

author: Rachel Vail,
title: “I didn't care who kissed you first as long as I kissed you last.”

author: J. Sterling,
title: “I recognized you instantly. All of our lives flashed through my mind in a split second. I felt a pull so strongly towards you that I almost couldn't stop it.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “They were kissing. Put like that, and you could be forgiven for presuming that this was a normal kiss, all lips and skin and possibly even a little tongue. You'd miss how he smiled, how his eyes glowed. And then, after the kiss was done, how he stood, like a man who had just discovered the art of standing and had figured out how to do it better than anyone else who would ever come along.”

author: Emma Goldman,
title: “ Free love? As if love is anything but free! Man has bought brains, but all the millions in the world have failed to buy love. Man has subdued bodies, but all the power on earth has been unable to subdue love. Man has conquered whole nations, but all his armies could not conquer love. Man has chained and fettered the spirit, but he has been utterly helpless before love. High on a throne, with all the splendor and pomp his gold can command, man is yet poor and desolate, if love passes him by. And if it stays, the poorest hovel is radiant with warmth, with life and color. Thus love has the magic power to make of a beggar a king. Yes, love is free; it can dwell in no other atmosphere. In freedom it gives itself unreservedly, abundantly, completely. All the laws on the statutes, all the courts in the universe, cannot tear it from the soil, once love has taken root.”

author: V.C. Andrews,
title: “Love doesn't always come when you want it to. Sometimes it just happens, despite your will.”

author: Don Miguel Ruiz,
title: “You don't need to justify your love, you don't need to explain your love, you just need to practice your love. Practice creates the master.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Yet, it had been Dimitri’s gentleness and thoughtfulness mixed with that deadliness that made him so wonderful. The same hands that wielded stakes with such precision would carefully brush the hair out of my face. The eyes that could astutely spot any danger in the area would regard me wonderingly and worshipfully, like I was the most beautiful and amazing woman in the world.”

author: T.D. Jakes,

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Integrity is doing what is right and truthful, and doing as you say you would do.”

author: David Almond
title: “Books. They are lined up on shelves or stacked on a table. There they are wrapped up in their jackets, lines of neat print on nicely bound pages. They look like such orderly, static things. Then you, the reader come along. You open the book jacket, and it can be like opening the gates to an unknown city, or opening the lid of a treasure chest. You read the first word and you're off on a journey of exploration and discovery.”

author: Donald Van de Mark,
title: “Not only is there often a right and wrong, but what goes around does come around, Karma exists, chickens do come home to roost, and as my mother, Phyllis, liked to say, “There is always a day of reckoning.” The good among the great understand that every choice we make adds to the strength or weakness of our spirits—ourselves, or to use an old fashioned word for the same idea, our souls. That is every human’s life work: to construct an identity bit by bit, to walk a path step by step, to live a life that is worthy of something higher, lighter, more fulfilling, and maybe even everlasting.”

author: Viktor E. Frankl,
title: “For the world is in a bad state, but everything will become still worse unless each of us does his best.”

author: Kate Forsyth,
title: “May my heart be kind, my mind fierce, and my spirit brave.”

author: David Rossi
title: “Scars show us where we have been, they do not dictate where we are going.”

author: Don Miguel Ruiz,
title: “Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourslef or to gossip about others. Use your power of your word in the direction of truth and love.”

author: Jordan Belfort,
title: “Act as if! Act as if you're a wealthy man, rich already, and then you'll surely become rich. Act as if you have unmatched confidence and then people will surely have confidence in you. Act as if you have unmatched experience and then people will follow your advice. And act as if you are already a tremendous success, and as sure as I stand here today - you will become successful.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “It is one of the beautiful compensations of life that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.”

author: Benjamin Franklin,
title: “Were I a Roman Catholic, perhaps I should on this occasion vow to build a chapel to some saint, but as I am not, if I were to vow at all, it should be to build a light-house.

author: Janet Fitch,
title: “Don't turn over the rocks if you don't want to see the pale creatures who live under them.”

author: Amelia Earhart
title: “The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.”

author: Laura Whitcomb,
title: “The library smells like old books — a thousand leather doorways into other worlds. I hear silence, like the mind of God. I feel a presence in the empty chair beside me. The librarian watches me suspiciously. But the library is a sacred place, and I sit with the patron saint of readers. Pulsing goddess light moves through me for one moment like a glimpse of eternity instantly forgotten. She is gone. I smell mold, I hear the clock ticking, I see an empty chair. Ask me now and I'll say this is just a place where you can't play music or eat. She's gone. The library sucks.”

author: Stephen King,
title: “He who speaks without an attentive ear is mute.”

author: Byron Katie
title: “All I have is all I need and all I need is all I have in this moment.”

author: Lao Tzu

author: André Gide

author: Christopher Hitchens,
title: “I have met some highly intelligent believers, but history has no record to say that [s]he knew or understood the mind of god. Yet this is precisely the qualification which the godly must claim—so modestly and so humbly—to possess. It is time to withdraw our 'respect' from such fantastic claims, all of them aimed at the exertion of power over other humans in the real and material world.”

author: Florence Nightingale

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

author: Anne Frank

Yes, why do they make still more gigantic planes, still heavier bombs and, at the same time, prefabricated houses for reconstruction?
