title: “You didn’t think I’d let you go alone, did you?”

author: Stieg Larsson,
title: “When she came to her senses again she cut off all contact with him. It had not been easy, but she had steeled herself. The last time she saw him she was standing on a platform in the tunnelbana at Gamla Stan and he was sitting in the train on his way downtown. She had stared at him for a whole minute and decided that she did not have a grain of feeling left, because it would have been the same as bleeding to death. Fuck you.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “You will be the first test subject, Tobias. Beatrice, however...." She smiles. "You are too injured to be of much use to me, so your execution will occur at the conclusion of this meeting."

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Everyone has choices to make; no one has the right to take those choices away from us. Not even out of love..”

author: John Lennon
title: “It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.”

author: William Blake
title: “It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.”

author: Audrey Hepburn
title: “There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.”

author: John Green,
title: “But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, ‘The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves.”

author: Ursula K. Le Guin,
title: “People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Accept yourself, love yourself, and keep moving forward. If you want to fly, you have to give up what weighs you down.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: “Still round the corner there may wait

author: Kazuo Ishiguro
title: “There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,

author: Anna Quindlen
title: “The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.”

author: Gandhi
title: “Your beliefs become your thoughts,

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must."

author: Thomas Merton ,
title: “Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.”

author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,
title: “Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.”

author: Charles Bukowski,
title: “being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives.”

author: Eric Roth,
title: “For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.”

author: Pablo Neruda
title: “You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.”

author: Lewis Carroll ,
title: “Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.”

author: Franz Kafka
title: “Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.”

author: Zelda Fitzgerald,
title: “She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.”

author: George Gordon Byron
title: “And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on.”

author: Confucious
title: “Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do, not that the nature of the thing has changed but that our power to do has increased.”

author: Eleanor Roosevelt,
title: “Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.”

author: Goenawan Mohamad
title: “Kemampuan membaca itu sebuah rahmat. Kegemaran membaca; sebuah kebahagiaan.”

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: “The hardest battle you are ever going to have to fight is the battle to be just you.”

author: Tere Liye,
title: “Andaikata semua kehidupan ini menyakitkan, maka di luar sana pasti masih ada sepotong bagian yang menyenangkan. Kemudian kau akan membenak pasti ada sesuatu yang jauh lebih indah dari menatap rembulan di langit. Kau tidak tahu apa itu, karna ilmumu terbatas. Kau hanya yakin , bila tidak di kehidupan ini suatu saat nanti pasti akan ada yang lebih mempesona dibanding menatap sepotong rembulan yang sedang bersinar indah.”

author: Bill Gates
title: “Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “When things go wrong, you'll find they usually go on getting worse for some time; but when things once start going right they often go on getting better and better.”

author: Brandon Sanderson,
title: “I ask of you your lives,” Elend said, voice echoing, “and your courage. I ask of you your faith, and your honor—your strength, and your compassion. For today, I lead you to die. I will not ask you to welcome this event. I will not insult you by calling it well, or just, or even glorious. But I will say this.

author: Sir Francis Bacon
title: “Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand--and melting like a snowflake...”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. Live your truth and don't EVER stop!”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “Aslan: You doubt your value. Don't run from who you are.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “Try to find pleasure in the speed that you're not used to. Changing the way you do routine things allows a new person to grow inside of you. But when all is said and done, you're the one who must decide how you handle it.”

author: Lana Del Rey
title: “Who belonged to no one, who belonged to everyone.

author: Les Brown
title: “The graveyard is the richest place on earth, because it is here that you will find all the hopes and dreams that were never fulfilled, the books that were never written, the songs that were never sung, the inventions that were never shared, the cures that were never discovered, all because someone was too afraid to take that first step, keep with the problem, or determined to carry out their dream.”

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: “Look not mournfully into the past, it comes not back again. Wisely improve the present, it is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future without fear and with a manly heart.”

author: John Updike,
title: “If you have the guts to be yourself, other people'll pay your price.”

author: Bob Dylan,
title: “Even if you don't have all the things you want, be grateful for the things you don't have that you don't want (Bob Dylan's dad)”

author: Salvador Dali
title: “The difference between false memories and true ones is the

author: Imam Ali
title: “Be like the flower that gives its fragrance to even the hand that crushes it.”

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
title: “Until justice rolls down like water and righteousness like a mighty stream.”

author: Simone Elkeles,
title: “Sometimes you have to steer away from the crowd in order to be a better person. It's not always easy, that's for sure. But it's right. And sometimes doing the right thing feels good, even if it does end up in a trip to the principal's office.”

author: J.D. Stroube,
title: “A complete stranger has the capacity to alter the life of another irrevocably. This domino effect has the capacity to change the course of an entire world. That is what life is; a chain reaction of individuals colliding with others and influencing their lives without realizing it. A decision that seems miniscule to you, may be monumental to the fate of the world.”

author: Dan Brown,
title: “Forgiveness is God's greatest gift”

author: Andrew Matthews
title: “Is it easy? Usually not. But you don't forgive people for their benefit. You do it for your benefit.”

author: Walt Disney
title: “To all that come to this happy place, welcome. Disneyland is your land. Here age relives fond memories of the past, and here youth may savor the challenge and promise of the future. Disneyland is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created America... with hope that it will be a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.”

author: Sarah Caldwell
title: “Learn everything you can, anytime you can, from anyone you can, there will always come a time when you will be grateful you did.”

author: Aidan Chambers,
title: “Love, being in love, isn’t a constant thing. It doesn’t always flow at the same strength. It’s not always like a river in flood. It’s more like the sea. It has tides, it ebbs and flows. The thing is, when love is real, whether it’s ebbing or flowing, it’s always there, it never goes away. And that’s the only proof you can have that it is real, and not just a crush or an infatuation or a passing fancy”

author: Arthur Golden,
title: “Of course, a sign doesn't mean anything unless you know how to interpret it.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “Love doesn’t have to be on Valentine’s Day. It doesn’t have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn’t have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn’t have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third day.

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “The two of you, there's something uncanny about the way you two are with each other. I mean everything--the way you look at each other, the way she relaxes when you put your hand on her back, the way you both seem to know what the other is always thinking, it's always struck me as extraordinary. That's another reason I keep putting marriage off. I know I want something like what you two share, and I'm not sure I've found it yet. I'm not sure I ever will. And with love like that, they say anything's possible, right?”

author: John Lennon
title: “One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.”

author: J. D. Salinger,
title: “Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.”

author: George R.R. Martin
title: “The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake.

author: Mark Twain
title: “Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.”

author: Audrey Hepburn
title: “The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “Creativity is intelligence having fun.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.”

author: E.L. James,
title: “- "Why don't you like to be touched?"

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people might think that's just really bad luck; when you're a half-blood, you understand that some devine force is really trying to mess up your day.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.”

author: T.H. White,
title: “The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn.”

author: Anais Nin
title: “We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!”

author: Cynthia Ozick
title: “We take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.”

author: George Bernard Shaw,
title: “The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star.

author: Walt Whitman
title: “This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood.

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning.”

author: William Golding,
title: “Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.”

author: Jay Asher,
title: “You can't stop the future

author: Alan Watts
title: “Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Politeness is deception in pretty packaging.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on...”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.”

author: Ashly Lorenzana
title: “You know all that sympathy that you feel for an abused child who suffers without a good mom or dad to love and care for them? Well, they don't stay children forever. No one magically becomes an adult the day they turn eighteen. Some people grow up sooner, many grow up later. Some never really do. But just remember that some people in this world are older versions of those same kids we cry for.”

author: Margaret Atwood,
title: “Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future. The ruin you've made.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “Love is so unpredictable. That's what makes it so great.”

author: Chad Sugg
title: “Love the trees until their leaves fall off, then encourage them to try again next year.”

author: Elisabeth Elliot,
title: “This love of which I speak is slow to lose patience - it looks for a way of being constructive.

author: Shannon L. Alder
title: “When you give yourself permission to communicate what matters to you in every situation you will have peace despite rejection or disapproval. Putting a voice to your soul helps you to let go of the negative energy of fear and regret.”

author: Jason Mraz
title: “Frustration and Love can’t exist in the same place at the same time, so get real and start doing what you would rather be doing in life. Love your life. All of it. Even the heavy shit that happened to you when you were 8. All of it was and IS perfect.”

author: Anne Sexton
title: “Do you like me?”

author: Gabriel García Márquez,
title: “No matter what, nobody can take away the dances you've already had.”

author: Jandy Nelson,
title: “Remember how it was when we kissed? Armfuls and armfuls of light thrown right at us. A rope dropping down from the sky. How can the word love and the word life even fit in the mouth?”

author: Louisa May Alcott,
title: “Be worthy love, and love will come.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “My point is that love is the most powerful motivator in the world. It spurs mortals to greatness. Their noblest, bravest acts are done for love.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Like the fact that the person Sirius cared for the most about in the world was you," said Dumbledore quietly.”

author: Jeanette Winterson,
title: “Why is the measure of love loss?”

author: Charlotte Eriksson
title: “I haven’t been very impressed lately.

author: Doug Fetherling
title: “Your absence has not taught me to be alone, it merely has shown that when together we cast a single shadow on the wall.”

author: John Donne,
title: “I am two fools, I know,

author: John Boyne ,
title: “...Despite the mayhem that followed, Bruno found that he was still holding Shmuel's hand in his own and nothing in the world would have persuaded him to let go.”

author: Robert A. Heinlein
title: “May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.”

author: Hilary Duff
title: “Waiting for you is like waiting for rain in this drought. Useless and disappointing." ~ Sam (Hilary Duff), A Cinderella Story”

author: Emily Dickinson
title: “Till I loved I never lived.”

author: Demi Lovato
title: “Who said

author: bell hooks
title: “Often men who have been emotionally neglected and abused as children by dominating mothers bond with assertive women, only to have their childhood feelings of being engulfed surface. While they could not 'smash their mommy' and still receive love, they find that they can engage in intimate violence with partners who respond to their acting out by trying harder to connect with them emotionally, hoping that the love offered in the present will heal the wounds of the past. If only one party in the relationship is working to create love, to create the space of emotional connection, the dominator model remains in place and the relationship just becomes a site for continuous power struggle.”

author: Graham Greene,
title: “I don't care a damn about men who are loyal to the people who pay them, to organizations...I don't think even my country means all that much. There are many countries in our blood, aren't there, but only one person. Would the world be in the mess it is if we were loyal to love and not to countries?”

author: G.G. Renee Hill,
title: “She loved him. But he didn’t know how to love.

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “He smiles at me, and I am suddenly seventeen again - the year I realize that love doesn't follow the rules, the year I understood that nothing is worth having so much as something unattainable”

author: Michel de Montaigne ,
title: “If you press me to say why I loved him, I can say no more than because he was he, and I was I.”

author: Shannon Hale
title: “You are my butterfly and refuse to set you free.”

author: Dora J. Arod,
title: “My love is pizza shaped. Won’t you have a slice? It’s circular, so there’s enough to go around. ”

author: Mark Twain,
title: “If Christ were here there is one thing he would not be—a Christian.”

author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
title: “I never hated a man enough to give him his diamonds back.”

author: Amy Plum,
title: “Well, spit on my empty grave--if it ain't the attack of the Disney princesses!”

author: Ernest Becker,
title: “The road to creativity passes so close to the madhouse and often detours or ends there.”

author: Karen Chance,
title: “He smiled at that, and then his gaze shifted to a spot over my shoulder and it faded. 'These doubts wouldn’t have anything to do with the company you’re keeping of late, would they?'

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Grover wore his fake feet and his pants to pass as human. He wore a green rasta-style cap, because when it rained his curly hair flattened and you could just see the tips of his horns. His bright orange backpack was full of scrap metal and apples to snack on. In his pocket was a set of reed pipes his daddy goat had carved for him, even though he only knew two songs: Mozart's Piano Concerto no. 12 and Hilary Duff's "So Yesterday," both of which sounded pretty bad on reed pipes.”

author: Mark Twain,
title: “Often it does seem such a pity that Noah and his party did not miss the boat.”

author: R.J. Palacio,
title: “I actually like how doctors talk. I like the sound of science. I like how words you don't understand explain things you can't understand.”

author: Marie Lu,
title: “Well enough,” I reply. “Remember, you’re drunk. And happy. You’re supposed to be lusting over your escort. Try smiling a little more.”

author: Lemony Snicket,
title: “Of course, it is boring to read about boring thing, but it is better to read something that makes you yawn with boredom than something that will make you weep uncontrollably, pound your fists against the floor, and leave tearstains all over your pillowcase, sheets, and boomerang collection.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Caliph Vathek and his dark horde

author: Nelson DeMille
title: “The problem with doing nothing is that you never know when you're finished.”

author: E. V. Lucas
title: “I have noticed that the people who are late are often so much jollier than the people who have to wait for them.”

author: Rachel Hawkins,
title: “Um...Mercer? Haven't seen you in nearly a month. I was expecting something like, 'Oh Cross, love of my heart, fire of my loins, how I've longed--”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “And then Jack chopped down what was the world's last beanstalk, adding murder and ecological terrorism to the theft, enticement, and trespass charges already mentioned, and all the giant's children didn't have a daddy anymore. But he got away with it and lived happily ever after, without so much as a guilty twinge about what he had done...which proves that you can be excused for just about anything if you are a hero, because no one asks inconvenient questions.”

author: Laurell K. Hamilton,
title: “Death didn't bother me much. Strong Christian and all that. Method of death did. Being eaten alive. One of my top three ways not to go out.”

author: Garrison Keillor
title: “The French have a new president, the British will soon have a new P.M., and we envy them as we endure the endless wait for this small dim man to go back to Texas and resume his life.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Frank didn’t drop you on purpose,” she said. “He’s not like that. He’s just a little clumsy sometimes.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “The lack of money is the root of all evil.”

author: Jules Renard
title: “Writing is the only profession where no one considers you ridiculous if you earn no money.”

author: David Nicholls,
title: “Call me sentimental, but there's no-one in the world that I'd like to see get dysentery more than you”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “Emergency dance party--go away.”

author: Simone Elkeles,
title: “Okay, seriously, I dont know if this is true or not, but I heard people who use profanity are trying to compensate for their lack of you know... size" -Tuck”

author: Julie Kagawa,
title: “Oh, don't mind me," came an extremely sarcastic voice near the wall. “You two go ahead and make out–I'll just sit here and bleed quietly.”

author: Charlaine Harris
title: “Niall had been able to mask the odor of fairy from Eric in the restaurant, but I saw from the flare of Eric's nostrils that the intoxicating scent clung to me. Eric's eyes closed in ecstasy, and he actually licked his lips. I felt like a T-bone just out of reach of a hungry dog.

author: Rachel Caine,
title: “[Myrnin to Claire about their costumes of Pierrot and Harlequin, respectively]

author: Cory Doctorow
title: “When in trouble or in doubt, run in circles, scream and shout.”

author: Leslie Knope
title: “We need to remember what's important in life: friends, waffles, work. Or waffles, friends, work. Doesn't matter, but work is third.”

author: Alexandra Adornetto,
title: “Molly: So how do you think of Bryce Hamilton crowd so far? Boys hot enough for you?

author: Nicole Christie,
title: “No, I really did. I walked into that room and saw the hottest, sexiest guy I've ever seen - wet and half naked. And I said, "E

author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
title: “The truth was a mirror in the hands of God. It fell, and broke into pieces. Everybody took a piece of it, and they looked at it and thought they had the truth.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “It's easy to forget things you don't need anymore.”

author: Brigham Young
title: “He who takes offense when no offense is intended is a fool, and he who takes offense when offense is intended is a greater fool.”

author: robert m drake
title: “Sometimes the most beautiful people are beautifully broken.”

author: Dan Howell
title: “I'm the living embodiment of 'it could be worse'.”

author: Wendy Mass,
title: “Maybe some things aren't meant to be known. maybe there just meant to be accepted.”

author: John Quincy Adams
title: “Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.”

author: Sharon Stone
title: “Women can fake an orgasm, but men can fake an entire relationship.”

author: Maimonides,
title: “Truth does not become more true by virtue of the fact that the entire world agrees with it, nor less so even if the whole world disagrees with it.”

author: T.H. White,
title: “If people reach perfection they vanish, you know.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “Politeness is okay, but it gets old and boring. You want to attack life with a passion, not a politeness, you want people to think about you and remember you and say "she is so passionate" you don't want people to think about you and remember you and say "she is so polite," because, who cares about polite?”

author: Jillian Michaels
title: “Get comfortable with being uncomfortable!”

author: Ralph Ellison,
title: “I was never more hated than when I tried to be honest. Or when, even as just now I've tried to articulate exactly what I felt to be the truth. No one was satisfied”

author: فؤاد حداد,
title: “كلمة أنا ما تحلاش إلا بدفا الجماعة. زى لمّا تخبط على باب الحبايب ويسألوا "مين؟" تقول "أنا" ويعرفوك من حسك”

author: Fred Rogers,
title: “In the external scheme of things, shining moments are as brief as the twinkling of an eye, yet such twinklings are what eternity is made of -- moments when we human beings can say "I love you," "I'm proud of you," "I forgive you," "I'm grateful for you." That's what eternity is made of: invisible imperishable good stuff.”

author: Joseph Conrad
title: “The question is not how to get cured, but how to live.”

author: Charles Bukowski
title: “The nights you fight best are

author: APJ Abdul Kalam,
title: “For great men, religion is a way of making friends; small people make religion a fighting tool.”

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: “Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the mext moment”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “How could you go about choosing something that would hold the half of your heart you had to bury?”

author: Jhumpa Lahiri,
title: “Try to remember it always," he said once Gogol had reached him, leading him slowly back across the breakwater, to where his mother and Sonia stood waiting. "Remember that you and I made this journey together to a place where there was nowhere left to go.”

author: John Elderedge
title: “The culture of women in the church today is crippled by some very pervasive lies. "To be spiritual is to be busy. To be spiritual is to be disciplined. To be spiritual is to be dutiful." No, to be spiritual is to be in Romance with God. The desire to be romanced lies deep in the heart of every women. It is for such that you were made. Are you ARE romanced, and ever will be.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “Love is like a good cake; you never know when it's coming, but you'd better eat it when it does!”

author: Maria Robinson
title: “Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
title: “There are some things that it is better to begin than to refuse, even though the end may be dark.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “There are powers far beyond us, plans far beyond what we could have ever thought of, visions far more vast than what we can ever see on our own with our own eyes, there are horizons long gone beyond our own horizons. This is courage- to throw away what is our own that is limited and to thrust ourselves into the hands of these higher powers- God and Destiny.To do this is to abide in the realm of the eternal, to walk in the path of the everlasting to follow in the footprints of God and demi-gods. The hardest part for man is the letting go. For some reason, he thinks himself big enough to know and to see what's good for him. But in the letting go........is found freedom. In the letting go........ is found the flight!”

author: Wendelin Van Draanen,
title: “Sometimes a little discomfort in the beginning can save a whole lot of pain down the road.”

author: Alan Turing,
title: “We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.”

author: Carl Sagan,
title: “Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.”

author: Andrew Solomon,
title: “It is important not to suppress your feelings altogether when you are depressed. It is equally important to avoid terrible arguments or expressions of outrage. You should steer clear of emotionally damaging behavior. People forgive, but it is best not to stir things up to the point at which forgiveness is required. When you are depressed, you need the love of other people, and yet depression fosters actions that destroy that love. Depressed people often stick pins into their own life rafts. The conscious mind can intervene. One is not helpless.”

author: Jack Kerouac
title: “And the story of love is a long sad tale ending in graves.”

author: Brennan Manning,
title: “Define yourself radically as one beloved by God. This is the true self. Every other identity is illusion.”

author: Anna Godbersen,
title: “The first stab of love is like a sunset, a blaze of color -- oranges, pearly pinks, vibrant purples...”

author: Alysha Speer
title: “Love is hard to find, hard to keep, and hard to forget.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “My shoulder will never be the same. I expect you to nurse me back to health.”

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “Amor"

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “She didn't need to understand the meaning of life; it was enough to find someone who did, and then fall asleep in his arms and sleep as a child sleeps, knowing that someone stronger than you is protecting you from all evil and all danger”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Great victory requires great risk.

author: Simone Elkeles,
title: “being afraid to take chances is scarier than actually doing things that challenge you.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “These violent delights have violent ends

author: Stendhal,
title: “A good book is an event in my life.”

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: “Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.”

author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,
title: “Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.”

author: Dalai Lama XIV
title: “Love is the absence of judgment.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: “I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “That's why when major badasses greet each other in movies, they don't say anything, they just nod. The nod means, 'I' am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass,' but they don't say anything because they're Wolverine and Magneto and it would mess up their vibe to explain.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.”

author: Gabriel García Márquez,
title: “He is ugly and sad... but he is all love.”

author: Stephen King,
title: “Calling it a simple schoolgirl crush was like saying a Rolls-Royce was a vehicle with four wheels, something like a hay-wagon. She did not giggle wildly and blush when she saw him, nor did she chalk his name on trees or write it on the walls of the Kissing Bridge. She simply lived with his face in her heart all the time, a kind of sweet, hurtful ache. She would have died for him..”

author: Sigmund Freud
title: “Whoever loves becomes humble. Those who love have , so to speak , pawned a part of their narcissism.”

author: Mikhail Bulgakov,
title: “Follow me, reader! Who told you that there is no true, faithful, eternal love in this world! May the liar's vile tongue be cut out! Follow me, my reader, and me alone, and I will show you such a love!”

author: Kahlil Gibran,
title: “Thus with my lips have I denounced you, while my heart, bleeding within me, called you tender names.

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I was trying to make you jealous!" Simon screamed, right back. His hands were fisted at his sides. "You're so stupid, Clary. You're so stupid, can't you see anything?"

author: Clive Barker
title: “Nothing else wounds so deeply and irreparably. Nothing else robs us of hope so much as being unloved by one we love”

author: Charlotte Brontë,
title: “I know what it is to live entirely for and with what I love best on earth. I hold myself supremely blest -- blest beyond what language can express; because I am my husband's life as fully as he is mine.”

author: E. Lockhart,
title: “Better than chocolate, being with you last night. Silly me, I thought that nothing was better than chocolate.”

author: Bernhard Schlink,
title: “I'm not frightened. I'm not frightened of anything. The more I suffer, the more I love. Danger will only increase my love. It will sharpen it, forgive its vice. I will be the only angel you need. You will leave life even more beautiful than you entered it. Heaven will take you back and look at you and say: Only one thing can make a soul complete and that thing is love.”

author: Bell Hooks,
title: “All too often women believe it is a sign of commitment, an expression of love, to endure unkindness or cruelty, to forgive and forget. In actuality, when we love rightly we know that the healthy, loving response to cruelty and abuse is putting ourselves out of harm's way.”

author: Nicole Krauss
title: “If I had a camera,' I said, 'I'd take a picture of you every day. That way I'd remember how you looked every single day of your life.”

author: John Steinbeck,
title: “All great and precious things are lonely.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.”

author: Guy de Maupassant
title: “Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.”

author: Lewis Carroll,
title: “If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.”

author: Sharon Salzberg
title: “You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection”

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.”

author: Nietzsche, Friedrich
title: “Love is a state in which a man sees things most decidedly as they are not.”

author: Arthur Rimbaud,
title: “Love...no such thing.

author: bell hooks,
title: “Love is a combination of care, commitment, knowledge, responsibility, respect and trust.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “It reminds me that no embrace will ever feel the same again, because no one will ever be like her again, because she's gone. She's gone, and crying feels so useless, so stupid, but it's all I can do.”

author: Jasmine Warga,
title: “Sometimes I wonder if my heart is like a black hole--it's so dense that there's no room for light, but that doesn't mean it can't still suck me in.”

author: Criss Jami,
title: “Popular culture is a place where pity is called compassion, flattery is called love, propaganda is called knowledge, tension is called peace, gossip is called news, and auto-tune is called singing.”

author: Ashly Lorenzana
title: “The end of a relationship is not always a failure. Sometimes all the love in the world is not enough to save something. In these cases, it is not a matter of fault from either person. Some things cannot be, it's as simple as that.”

author: Gabrielle Zevin,
title: “You forget all of it anyway. First, you forget everything you learned-the dates of the Hay-Herran Treaty and Pythagorean Theorem. You especially forget everything you didn't really learn, but just memorized the night before. You forget the names of all but one or two of your teachers, and eventually you'll forget those, too. You forget your junior class schedule and where you used to sit and your best friend's home phone number and the lyrics to that song you must have played a million times. For me, it was something by Simon & Garfunkel. Who knows what it will be for you? And eventually, but slowly, oh so slowly, you forget your humiliations-even the ones that seemed indelible just fade away. You forget who was cool and who was not, who was pretty, smart, athletic, and not. Who went to a good college. Who threw the best parties Who could get you pot. You forget all of them. Even the ones you said you loved, and even the ones you actually did. They're the last to go. And then once you've forgotten enough, you love someone else.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.”

author: مصطفى محمود,
title: “و كلما أمسكت بحالة من حالاتي و قلت هذا هو أنا .. ما تلبث هذه الحالة أن تفلت من أصابعي و تحل محلها حالة أخرى .. هي أنا .. أيضاً..”

author: أحلام مستغانمي,
title: “أحسد الأطفال الرضّع، لأنهم يملكون وحدهم حق الصراخ والقدرة عليه، قبل أن تروض الحياة حبالهم الصوتية، وتعلِّمهم الصمت”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “It wouldn't be my move," Jace agreed. "First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order.”

author: A.J. Cronin
title: “Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, but only saps today of its strength.”

author: Sylvia Plath,
title: “And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter— they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “To be, or not to be: that is the question:

author: Fernando Pessoa,
title: “Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.”

author: John Steinbeck,
title: “I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.”

author: Winston S. Churchill
title: “Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.”

author: J.K. Rowling ,
title: “Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.”

author: Isabel Allende
title: “The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.”

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: “People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.”

author: Lao Tzu
title: “A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.”

author: Salvador Dali
title: “Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.”

author: Shmuley Boteach
title: “There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.”

author: Laurie Halse Anderson,
title: “When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.”

author: Roald Dahl
title: “So please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookshelf on the wall.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.”

author: Mother Theresa
title: “Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.”

author: e.e. cummings,
title: “For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),

author: Jane Austen
title: “Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.”

author: Douglas Adams,
title: “Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?”

author: J. K. Rowling,
title: “There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon,
title: “Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.”

author: John Steinbeck,
title: “There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.”

author: Lao Tzu
title: “Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.”

author: Franz Kafka
title: “Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.”

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.”

author: Joseph Heller,
title: “He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt.”

author: Aldous Huxley,
title: “But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.”

author: Laurie Halse Anderson,
title: “You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.”

author: Margaret Lee Runbeck
title: “Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.”

author: Toni Morrison,
title: “You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “I am so, so alive.”

author: Toni Morrison,
title: “If you surrendered to the air, you could ride it.”

author: John C Maxwell
title: “Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.”

author: Lisa Genova,
title: “She liked being reminded of butterflies. She remembered being six or seven and crying over the fates of the butterflies in her yard after learning that they lived for only a few days. Her mother had comforted her and told her not to be sad for the butterflies, that just because their lives were short didn't mean they were tragic. Watching them flying in the warm sun among the daisies in their garden, her mother had said to her, see, they have a beautiful life. Alice liked remembering that.”

author: Peter Jackson
title: “I know. It’s all wrong. By rights we shouldn’t even be here. But we are. It's like in the great stories, Mr. Frodo. The ones that really mattered. Full of darkness and danger they were. And sometimes you didn't want to know the end. Because how could the end be happy? How could the world go back to the way it was when so much bad had happened? But in the end, it’s only a passing thing, this shadow. Even darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines it will shine out the clearer. Those were the stories that stayed with you. That meant something, even if you were too small to understand why. But I think, Mr. Frodo, I do understand. I know now. Folk in those stories had lots of chances of turning back, only they didn’t. They kept going, because they were holding on to something.”

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
title: “You can only be afraid of what you think you know.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Life is only precious because it ends, kid. Take it from a god. You mortals don't know how lucky you are”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “How would your life be different if…You approached all relationships with authenticity and honesty? Let today be the day…You dedicate yourself to building relationships on the solid foundation of truth and authenticity.”

author: Steve Maraboli ,
title: “If you believe you can, you might. If you know you can, you will.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “The mistake ninety-nine percent of humanity made, as far as Fats could see, was being ashamed of what they were; lying about it, trying to be somebody else.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “The most powerful relationship you will ever have is the relationship with yourself.”

author: فؤاد حداد,
title: “و أنا فى الحقيقة ماليش فى الوصف كتير..أنا باحب و باكره”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “Achievement has no color”

author: Anne Lamott,
title: “Help" is a prayer that is always answered. It doesn't matter how you pray--with your head bowed in silence, or crying out in grief, or dancing. Churches are good for prayer, but so are garages and cars and mountains and showers and dance floors. Years ago I wrote an essay that began, "Some people think that God is in the details, but I have come to believe that God is in the bathroom.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “One of the best ways to influence people is to make them feel important. Most people enjoy those rare moments when others make them feel important. It is one of the deepest human desires.”

author: Morgan Matson,
title: “The best discoveries always happened to the people who weren't looking for it. Columbus and America. Pinzon, who stumbled on Brazil while looking for the West Indies. Stanley happening on Victoria Falls. And you. Amy Curry, when I was least expecting her.

author: Sanaya Roman,
title: “Truly powerful people have great humility. They do not try to impress, they do not try to be influential. They simply are. People are magnetically drawn to them. They are most often very silent and focused, aware of their core selves. ... They never persuade, nor do they use manipulation or aggressiveness to get their way. They listen. If there is anything they can offer to assist you, they offer it; if not, they are silent.”

author: King James Gadsden
title: “Life keeps throwing me lemons because I make the best lemonade...”

author: Amit Ray,
title: “Meditation is a way for nourishing and blossoming the divinity within you.”

author: Philip Pullman,
title: “If you want something you can have it, but only if you want everything that goes with it, including all the hard work and the despair, and only if you're willing to risk failure. ”

author: Mhairi McFarlane,
title: “Do nothing, and nothing happens. Life is about decisions. You either make them or they're made for you, but you can't avoid them.”

author: Anne Lamott,
title: “The road to enlightenment is long and difficult, and you should try not to forget snacks and magazines.”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “Ignore all hatred and criticism. Live for what you create, and die protecting it.”

author: Henry James,
title: “Live all you can: it's a mistake not to. It doesn't matter what you do in particular, so long as you have had your life. If you haven't had that, what have you had?”

author: Anthony Robbins
title: “In essence, if we want to direct our lives, we must take control of our consistent actions. It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.”

author: Christian Baloga
title: “You say freak, I say unique.”

author: Anne Frank
title: “If we bear all this suffering and if there are still Jews left, when it is over, then Jews, instead of being doomed, will be held up as an example.”

author: Demi Lovato
title: “Skies are crying,

author: Carrie Ryan,
title: “I realize that life is risks. It’s acknowledging the past but looking forward. It’s taking a chance that we will

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Life is short. Focus on what really matters most; you should change your priorities over time.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome.

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.”

author: S.E. Hinton,
title: “Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.”

author: Margaret Mead
title: “Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.”

author: Julian F. Fleron
title: “The creative adult is the child who has survived.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.”

author: Dylan Thomas,
title: “Do not go gentle into that good night.

author: Nick Hornby,
title: “People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.”

author: غسان كنفاني
title: “!لك شيء في هذا العالم.. فقم”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Your friend's poetry is terrible," he said.

author: Rita Mae Brown
title: “I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself.”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
title: “The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.”

author: Lucy Maud Montgomery,
title: “It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: “There is no exquisite beauty… without some strangeness in the proportion.”

author: John Lennon
title: “A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,
title: “Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.”

author: Barbara W. Tuchman
title: “Books are the carriers of civilization...They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.”

author: George Carlin
title: “May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.”

author: John Muir
title: “The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.”

author: Margaret Mead
title: “I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?”

author: Bette Midler
title: “The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.”

author: Charles Bukowski
title: “my mother, poor fish,

author: Joseph Fort Newton
title: “Men build too many walls and not enough bridges.”

author: Amanda Grace,
title: “I wanted to be his life preserver, the thing that would keep him afloat. Instead, he became my anchor. And I’m tired of drowning.”

author: Melissa Jensen,
title: “sometimes no matter how many eyelashes or dandelion seeds you blow, no matter how much of your heart you tear out and slap on your sleeve, it just ain't gonna happen.”

author: Tammara Webber,
title: “The truth was, he now belonged only to my past, and it was time I begin to accept it, as much as it hurt to do so.”

author: Maeve Binchy,
title: “I'll understand if you don't want me. But I will be heartbroken. You are all I ever dreamed of and hoped for. You are much, much more. Please know that I didn't think I was mean-minded. But I realize I am. I don't want you to put your arms around me and say it's all right, that you forgive me. I want you to be sure that you do, and my love for you will last as long as I live. I can see no lightness, no humour, no joke to make. I just hope that we will be able to go back to when we had laughter, and the world was coloured, not black and white and grey. I am so sorry for hurting you. I could inflict all kinds of pain on myself, but it would not take back any I gave to you. - David Power”

author: Leslye Walton,
title: “Just because love don't look the way you think it should, don't mean you don't have it.”

author: Junot Díaz,
title: “She was the kind of girlfriend God gives you young, so you'll know loss the rest of your life.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater,
title: “I just looked at her, feeling utterly empty. I didn’t know what I was supposed to say to her.

author: Ally Condie,
title: “Everyone has something of beauty about them. But loving lets you look, and look, and look again. You notice the back of a hand, the turn of a head, the way of a walk. When you first love, you look blind and you see it all as the glorious, beloved whole, or a beautiful sum of beautiful parts. But when you see the one you love as pieces, as why's, you can love those parts too, and it's a love at once more complicated and more complete.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “I would lay down everything I possess, even my soul, for you. If that isn't love, it's the best I have.”

author: Ann Brashares,
title: “Love demands everything, they say, but my love demands only this: that no matter what happens or how long it takes, you`ll keep faith in me, you`ll remember who we are, and you`ll never feel despair.”

author: Mark Twain,
title: “When you fish for love, bait with your heart, not your brain.”

author: Jeanette Winterson
title: “What should I do about the wild and the tame? The wild heart that wants to be free, and the tame heart that wants to come home. I want to be held. I don't want you to come too close. I want you to scoop me up and bring me home at nights. I don't want to tell you where I am. I want to keep a place among the rocks where no one can find me. I want to be with you.”

author: James Baldwin
title: “Love takes off the masks we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive—to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love—then make that day count!”

author: Colleen hoover,
title: “This thing about you that you think is your flaw - it's the reason I'm falling in love with you.”

author: Criss Jami,
title: “If love is blind, then maybe a blind person that loves has a greater understanding of it.”

author: Alicia Keys
title: “Love me like you'll never see me again.”

author: Graeme Simsion,
title: “But why, why, why can't people just say what they mean?”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “He was too perfect, despite being one of the most imperfect people I knew.”

author: Charlotte Eriksson,
title: “... so this is for us.

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “I want you to know

author: James Frey,
title: “There is emotion in the hug, and there is respect and a form of love. Emotion that comes from honesty, respect that comes from challenge, and the form of love that exists between people whose minds have touched, whose hearts have touched, whose souls have touched. Our minds touched. Our hearts touched. Our souls touched.

author: Pico Iyer
title: “We travel, initially, to lose ourselves; and we travel, next to find ourselves. We travel to open our hearts and eyes and learn more about the world than our newspapers will accommodate. We travel to bring what little we can, in our ignorance and knowledge, to those parts of the globe whose riches are differently dispersed. And we travel, in essence, to become young fools again- to slow time down and get taken in, and fall in love once more.”

author: Rumi
title: “Is it really so that the one I love is everywhere?”

author: Lisa Kleypas,
title: “I love you, he thought, looking at Win. I love every part of you, every thought and word... the entire complex, fascinating bundle of all the things you are. I want you with ten different kinds of need at once. I love all the seasons of you, the way you are now, the thought of how much more beautiful you'll be in the decades to come. I love you for being the answer to every question my heart could ask.”

author: Heather Dixon,
title: “He's around the twist,' said Azalea. 'Breaking all the windows? He's mad.'

author: bell hooks
title: “Living simply makes loving simple.”

author: Vladimir Nabokov,
title: “Life is short. From here to that old car you know so well there is a stretch of twenty, twenty-five paces. It is a very short walk. Make those twenty-five steps. Now. Right now. Come just as you are. And we shall live happily ever after. ”

author: Gabriel García Márquez,
title: “With her Florentino Ariza learned what he had already experienced many times without realizing it: that one can be in love with several people at the same time, feel the same sorrow with each, and not betray any of them. Alone in the midst of the crowd on the pier, he said to himself in a flash of anger: 'My heart has more rooms than a whorehouse.”

author: Osho
title: “The capacity to be alone is the capacity to love. It may look paradoxical to you, but it's not. It is an existential truth: only those people who are capable of being alone are capable of love, of sharing, of going into the deepest core of another person--without possessing the other, without becoming dependent on the other, without reducing the other to a thing, and without becoming addicted to the other. They allow the other absolute freedom, because they know that if the other leaves, they will be as happy as they are now. Their happiness cannot be taken by the other, because it is not given by the other.”

author: Jessica Howell
title: “Sometimes good things fall apart, so better things can fall together.”

author: Nina LaCour,
title: “You might be looking for reasons but there are no reasons.”

author: Claudia Gray,
title: “I meant it when I said I didn’t believe in love at first sight. It takes time to really, truly fall for someone. Yet I believe in a moment. A moment when you glimpse the truth within someone, and they glimpse the truth within you. In that moment, you don’t belong to yourself any longer, not completely. Part of you belongs to him; part of him belongs to you. After that, you can’t take it back, no matter how much you want to, no matter how hard you try.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “When you were in love, you were capable of learning everything and of knowing things you had never dared even to think, because love was the key to understanding all of the mysteries.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,
title: “We are asleep until we fall in Love!”

author: Mark Helprin,
title: “If it weren't for music, I would think that love is mortal.”

author: Joseph Roux
title: “What is love? two souls and one flesh; friendship? two bodies and one soul.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “If you're not comfortable enough with yourself or with your own truth when entering a relationship, then you're not ready for that relationship.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Love is the most powerful force in the world. That love can do anything.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “Ever since time began, people have recognized their true Love by the light in their eyes.”

author: Jackie Collins,
title: “Falling in love is like getting hit by a truck and yet not being mortally wounded. just sick to your stomach, high one minute, low the next. Starving hungry but unable to eat. hot, cold, forever horny, full of hope and enthusiasm, with momentary depressions that wipe you out.

author: Arthur Golden, Memoirs Of A Geisha,
title: “Can't you see? Every step I have taken, since I was that child on the bridge, has been to bring myself closer to you. ”

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,
title: “Love, whether newly born or aroused from a deathlike slumber, must always create sunshine, filling the heart so full of radiance, that it overflows upon the outward world.”

author: Jenny Han,
title: “If love is like a possession, maybe my letter are like my exorcisms”

author: Andrew Solomon,
title: “Depression is the flaw in love. To be creatures who love, we must be creatures who can despair at what we lose, and depression is the mechanism of that despair.”

author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,
title: “People do the damndest things when they’re in love.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,
title: “He was afraid of defiling the love which filled his soul.”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
title: “For millions of years flowers have been producing thorns. For millions of years sheep have been eating them all the same. And it's not serious, trying to understand why flowers go to such trouble to produce thorns that are good for nothing? It's not important, the war between the sheep and the flowers? It's no more serious and more important than the numbers that fat red gentleman is adding up? Suppose I happen to know a unique flower, one that exists nowhere in the world except on my planet, one that a little sheep can wipe out in a single bite one morning, just like that, without even realizing what he'd doing - that isn't important? If someone loves a flower of which just one example exists among all the millions and millions of stars, that's enough to make him happy when he looks at the stars. He tells himself 'My flower's up there somewhere...' But if the sheep eats the flower, then for him it's as if, suddenly, all the stars went out. And that isn't important?”

author: Kristin Cashore,
title: “Brigan was saying her name, and he was sending her a feeling. It was courage and strength, and something else too, as if he were standing with her, as if he'd taken her within himself, letting her rest her entire body for a moment on his backbone, her mind in his mind, her heart in the fire of his.

author: Michelle Hodkin,
title: “I want YOU to be the one wanting me first. Pushing me first. Kissing me first. Don't be careful with me," he said. "Because I won't be careful with you.”

author: Jimi Hendrix
title: “Don't be reckless with other people's hearts. Don't put up with people who are reckless with yours.”

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: “I believe that every single event in life happens in an opportunity to choose love over fear.”

author: B. F. Skinner
title: “We shouldn't teach great books; we should teach a love of reading. Knowing the contents of a few works of literature is a trivial achievement. Being inclined to go on reading is a great achievement.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “I was the lion who forced you to join with Aravis. I was the cat who comforted you among the houses of the dead. I was the lion who drove the jackals from you while you slept. I was the lion who gave the horses the new strength of fear for the last mill so that you should reach King Lune in time. And I was the lion you do not remember who pushed the boat in which you lay, a child near death, so that it came to shore where a man sat, wakeful at midnight, to receive you.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Then she did something so unexpected Nico would later think he dreamed it. She walked up to Nico, who was standing to one side in the shadows, as usual. She grabbed his hand and pulled him gently into the firelight. ‘We had one home,’ she said. ‘Now we have two.’ She gave Nico a big hug and the crowd roared with approval. For once, Nico didn’t feel like pulling away. He buried his face in Reyna’s shoulder and blinked the tears out of his eyes.”

author: Richard Paul Evans,
title: “I am not a believer in love at first sight. For love, in its truest form, is not the thing

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “Where is Aelin.

author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,
title: “Making love to me is amazing. Wait, I meant: making love, to me, is amazing. The absence of two little commas nearly transformed me into a sex god. ”

author: Thomas Huxley,
title: “Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every preconceived notion, follow humbly wherever and to whatever abysses nature leads, or you shall learn nothing. I have only begun to learn content and peace of mind since I have resolved at all risks to do this.”

author: ram dass
title: “The most exquisite paradox… as soon as you give it all up, you can have it all. As long as you want power, you can't have it. The minute you don't want power, you'll have more than you ever dreamed possible.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Your complaints, your drama, your victim mentality, your whining, your blaming, and all of your excuses have NEVER gotten you even a single step closer to your goals or dreams. Let go of your nonsense. Let go of the delusion that you DESERVE better and go EARN it! Today is a new day!”

author: Roger Zelazny,
title: “Nobody steals books but your friends.”

author: Fred Rogers,
title: “We need to help people to discover the true meaning of love. Love is generally confused with dependence. Those of us who have grown in true love know that we can love only in proportion to our capacity for independence.”

author: Buddha
title: “With our thoughts we make the world.”

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: “Be so strong that nothing can disturb your peace of mind. Talk health, happiness, and prosperity to every person you meet. Make all your friends feel there is something special in them. Look at the sunny side of everything. Think only the best, be as enthusiastic about the success of others as you are about your own.

author: William Faulkner
title: “A writer must teach himself that the basest of all things is to be afraid. ”

author: Megan Whalen Turner,
title: “If I am the pawn of the gods, it is because they know me so well, not because they make my mind up for me.”

author: Frank Herbert,
title: “Whether a thought is spoken or not it is a real thing and it has power," Tuek said. "You might find the line between life and death among the Fremen to be too sharp and quick.”

author: Dolly Parton
title: “If you don’t like the road you’re walking, start paving another one.”

author: Zig Ziglar
title: “Make today worth remembering.”

author: Anonymous,
title: “And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.”

author: William James,
title: “Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.”

author: Sheryl Sandberg,
title: “We cannot change what we are not aware of, and once we are aware, we cannot help but change.”

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: “A photographer is like a cod, which produces a million eggs in order that one may reach maturity.”

author: John O'Donohue,
title: “Beannacht / Blessing

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Make the most of what you have and keep your standards high. Never settle for anything less than you deserve or are capable of achieving.”

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself...

author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
title: “Life consists of two days, one for you one against you. So when it's for you don't be proud or reckless, and when it's against you be patient, for both days are test for you.”

author: عصام يوسف,
title: “انت عمرك ما كنت مسئول عن مرضك... بس النهارده انت مسئول عن شفاك.”

author: Shel Silverstein
title: “If you are a dreamer come in”

author: Seneca
title: “Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.”

author: Tom Hiddleston
title: “Love your life. Because your life is what you have to give.”

author: Gerard Way
title: “You need just the right amount of 'Fuck the world' and the right amount of belief in something...and you need the right amount of love.”

author: Karl Lagerfeld
title: “Don't look to the approval of others for your mental stability”

author: Yehuda Bauer
title: “Thou shalt not be a victim, thou shalt not be a perpetrator, but, above all, thou shalt not be a bystander.”

author: Trina Paulus,
title: “How does one become a butterfly? They have to want to learn to fly so much that you are willing to give up being a caterpillar.”

author: Gordon B. Hinckley
title: “It is not so much the major events as the small day-to-day decisions that map the course of our living. . . Our lives are, in reality, the sum total of our seemingly unimportant decisions and of our capacity to live by those decisions.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Keep your promises and be consistent. Be the kind of person others can trust.”

author: Alexandra Adornetto,
title: “A man in love can do extraordinary things, I don’t care if you’re an angel, you’re my angel, and I won’t let you go.”

author: Margaret Atwood
title: “A truth should exist,

author: Jojo Moyes,
title: “...I told him a story of two people. Two people who shouldn't have met, and who didn't like each other much when they did, but who found they were the only two people in the world who could possibly have understood each other.”

author: Rumi Jalalud-Din
title: “Remember. The way you make love is the way God will be with you.”

author: Jennifer Elisabeth,
title: “Don’t worry if people think you’re crazy. You are crazy. You have that kind of intoxicating insanity that lets other people dream outside of the lines and become who they’re destined to be.”

author: Rumi
title: “I am your moon and your moonlight too

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Must I go bound while you go free

author: Leigh Bardugo,
title: “I have loved you all my life, Mal," I whispered through my tears. "There is no end to our story.”

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “Aside from the obvious, Francesca, what do you want in return for supplying information?” Bones asked, getting back to the subject. “You to take me,” she replied at once. “Not gonna happen!” I spat, squeezing him possessively. Three sets of widened eyes fixed on me. That’s when I realized that what I had a firm grip on was no longer his hand.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?"

author: Dr. Seuss
title: “If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.”

author: Gilda Radner
title: “I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end.”

author: Edward Albee
title: “You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?”
