title: “Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again."

author: Thomas Merton,
title: “The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them”

author: James Baldwin
title: “You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Our story has three parts: a beginning, a middle, and an end. And although this is the way all stories unfold, I still can't believe that ours didn't go on forever.”

author: Ayn Rand,
title: “If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.”

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: “I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.”

author: Émile Zola
title: “If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.”

author: Robert Jordan
title: “Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create.”

author: Cormac McCarthy,
title: “You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.”

author: Michael  Jackson
title: “If you enter this world knowing you are loved and you leave this world knowing the same, then everything that happens in between can be dealt with.”

author: John Keats
title: “A thing of beauty is a joy for ever:

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “Wrong will be right, when Aslan comes in sight,

author: Ansel Adams
title: “Sometimes I arrive just when God's ready to have somone click the shutter.”

author: Anne Tyler,
title: “I'm beginning to think that maybe it's not just how much you love someone. Maybe what matters is who you are when you're with them.”

author: James Gordon
title: “It's not that some people have willpower and some don't... It's that some people are ready to change and others are not.”

author: Nelson Mandela,
title: “A Nation should not be judged by how it treats its highest citizens, but it's lowest ones”

author: Sakyong Mipham Rinpoche
title: “ Many of us are slaves to our minds. Our own mind is our worst enemy. We try to focus, and our mind wanders off. We try to keep stress at bay, but anxiety keeps us awake at night. We try to be good to the people we love, but then we forget them and put ourselves first. And when we want to change our life, we dive into spiritual practice and expect quick results, only to lose focus after the honeymoon has worn off. We return to our state of bewilderment. We're left feeling helpless and discouraged. It seems we all agree that training the body through exercise, diet, and relaxation is a good idea, but why don't we think about training our minds?”

author: Criss Jami,
title: “The motive behind criticism often determines its validity. Those who care criticize where necessary. Those who envy criticize the moment they think that they have found a weak spot.”

author: Paula White
title: “Champions have the courage to keep turning the pages because they know a better chapter lies ahead.”

author: Barney Stinson
title: “When I get sad, I stop being sad and be awesome instead.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Before a dream is realized, the Soul of the World tests everything that was learned along the way. It does this not because it is evil, but so that we can, in addition to realizing our dreams, master the lessons we’ve learned as we’ve moved toward that dream. That’s the point at which most people give up. It’s the point at which, as we say in the language of the desert, one 'dies of thirst just when the palm trees have appeared on the horizon.”

author: Robert Greene,
title: “LAW 38

author: Lao Tzu
title: “Your own positive future begins in this moment. All you have is right now. Every goal is possible from here.”

author: John F. Kennedy
title: “Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.

author: Patrick Rothfuss
title: “No man is brave that has never walked a hundred miles. If you want to know the truth of who you are, walk until not a person knows your name. Travel is the great leveler, the great teacher, bitter as medicine, crueler than mirror-glass. A long stretch of road will teach you more about yourself than a hundred years of quiet.”

author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: “Always tell what you feel. Do what you think...”

author: Maya Angelou,
title: “Each of us has the right and the responsibility to assess the roads which lie ahead, and those over which we have traveled, and if the future road looms ominous or unpromising, and the roads back uninviting, then we need to gather our resolve and, carrying only the necessary baggage, step off that road into another direction. If the new choice is also unpalatable, without embarrassment, we must be ready to change that as well.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “If people are going to be allowed to say "we love you" and "I love you", they'd better have the backbone to prove it. Love isn't just a word.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Smile at strangers and you just might change a life.”

author: Joseph Smith
title: “Happiness is the object and design of our existence; and will be the end thereof, if we pursue the path that leads to it; and this path is virtue, uprightness, faithfulness, holiness, and keeping all the commandments of God.”

author: Chris Colfer,
title: “You don’t get to pick where you’re from, but you always have control of where you’re going.”

author: Ronald Reagan
title: “I know in my heart that man is good, that what is right will always eventually triumph, and there is purpose and worth to each and every life.”

author: Michael J. Fox
title: “My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.”

author: Jon Krakauer,
title: “The sea's only gifts are harsh blows, and occasionally the chance to feel strong. Now I don't know much about the sea, but I do know that that's the way it is here. And I also know how important it is in life not necessarily to be strong but to feel strong. To measure yourself at least once. To find yourself at least once in the most ancient of human conditions. Facing the blind death stone alone, with nothing to help you but your hands and your own head.”

author: Nick Vujicic
title: “Life isn't about having, it's about being. You could surround yourself with all that money can buy, and you'd still be as miserable as a human can be. I know people with perfect bodies who don't have half the happiness I've found. On my journeys I've seen more joy in the slums of Mumbai and the orphanages of Africa than in wealthy gated communities and on sprawling estates worth millions. Why is that? You'll find contentment when your talents and passion are completely engaged, in full force. Recognise instant self-gratification for what it is. Resist the temptation to grab for material objects like the perfect house, the coolest clothes or the hottest car. The if I just had X, I would be happy syndrome is a mass delusion. When you look for happiness in mere objects, they are never enough. Look around. Look within.”

author: Tom Hiddleston
title: “Never stop. Never stop fighting. Never stop dreaming.”

author: Kerry E. Wagner
title: “you don't have to worry about burning bridges, if you're building your own”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “You could do a lot worse.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “You make the world a better place by making daily improvements to become the best version of yourself.”

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: “If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.”

author: Washington Irving
title: “There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.”

author: Kristin Cashore,
title: “I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said.

author: Albert Camus,
title: “You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.”

author: A.A. Milne
title: “Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.”

author: Mae West
title: “Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.”

author: Julian Barnes,
title: “Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.”

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,
title: “One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.”

author: Jon Krakauer,
title: “Happiness [is] only real when shared”

author: Emily Dickinson
title: “That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.”

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,
title: “The darker the night, the brighter the stars,

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “And I thought about how many people have loved those songs. And how many people got through a lot of bad times because of those songs. And how many people enjoyed good times with those songs. And how much those songs really mean. I think it would be great to have written one of those songs. I bet if I wrote one of them, I would be very proud. I hope the people who wrote those songs are happy. I hope they feel it's enough. I really do because they've made me happy. And I'm only one person.”

author: Ray Bradbury
title: “We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.”

author: Voltaire
title: “‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.”

author: Robert Frost
title: “Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.”

author: Soren Kierkegaard
title: “The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.”

author: Mo Willems,
title: “If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “Dogs never bite me. Just humans.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “We both have war inside us. Sometimes it keeps us alive. Sometimes it threatens to destroy us.”

author: Pablo Neruda
title: “I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.

author: J. M. Barrie,
title: “The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.”

author: John A. Shedd
title: “A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.”

author: Franz Kafka
title: “Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “It was the nicest thing she could imagine. It made her want to have his babies and give him both of her kidneys.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I thought perhaps that when you told me you did not love me that my own feelings would fall away and atrophy, but they have not. They have grown every day. I love you now more desperately, this moment, than I have ever loved you before, and in an hour I will love you more than that”

author: Harry Styles
title: “I don't think you can define love.”

author: Alexandra Adornetto,
title: “I thought you were gone forever, I thought you’d walked away from everything, because I failed, because I destroyed the only thing that ever mattered to me. I waited for you to come, but you didn’t.”

author: John O'Donohue,
title: “Your beloved and your friends were once strangers. Somehow at a particular time, they came from the distance toward your life. Their arrival seemed so accidental and contingent. Now your life is unimaginable without them. Similarly, your identity and vision are composed of a certain constellation of ideas and feelings that surfaced from the depths of the distance within you. To lose these now would be to lose yourself.”

author: Emily Dickinson
title: “Heart, we will forget him,

author: Renee Ahdieh,
title: “You honestly expect me to breathe in a world without air?”

author: Dante Alighieri,
title: “L'amor che move il sole e l'altre stelle.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “I'm backing down now. I really do love you. That's why I'm doing this.”

author: Henry Miller
title: “What's a fuck when what I want is love?”

author: Italo Calvino,
title: “If one wanted to depict the whole thing graphically, every episode, with its climax, would require a three-dimensional, or, rather, no model: every experience is unrepeatable. What makes lovemaking and reading resemble each other most is that within both of them times and spaces open, different from measurable time and space.”

author: Charlotte Featherstone,
title: “It hurts to breathe. It hurts to live. I hate her, yet I do not think I can exist without her.”

author: Ann Brashares
title: “Let me love you, but don't love me back. Do love me and let me hate you for a while. Let me feel like I have some control, because I know I never do. ”

author: Colleen Houck
title: “What are you doing?”

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
title: “A kiss on the beach when there is a full moon is the closest thing to heaven.”

author: Nayyirah Waheed
title: “when you meet that person. a person. one of your soulmates. let the connection. relationship. be what it is. it may be five mins. five hours. five days. five months. five years. a lifetime. five lifetimes. let it manifest itself the way it is meant to. it has an organic destiny. this way if it stays or if it leaves, you will be softer. from having been loved this authentically. souls come into. return. open. and sweep through your life for a myriad of reasons. let them be who. and what they are meant.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “We are not people who touch each other carelessly; every point of contact between us feels important, a rush of energy and relief.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Deep in her heart, she wasn't sure she deserved to be happy, nor did she believe that she was worthy of someone who seemed...normal.”

author: Leona Lewis
title: “Thought I couldn't live without you

author: Dee Henderson,
title: “I love you, in my mind where my thoughts reside, in my heart where my emotions live, and in my soul where my dreams are born. I love you.”

author: Emily Brontë,
title: “Nelly, I am Heathcliff - he's always, always in my mind - not as a pleasure, any more then I am always a pleasure to myself - but, as my own being.”

author: Jeanette Winterson,
title: “Many waters cannot quench love, neither can floods drown it. What then kills love? Only this: Neglect. Not to see you when you stand before me. Not to think of you in the little things. Not to make the road wide for you, the table spread for you. To choose you out of habit not desire, to pass the flower seller without a thought. To leave the dishes unwashed, the bed unmade, to ignore you in the mornings, make use of you at night. To crave another while pecking your cheek. To say your name without hearing it, to assume it is mine to call.”

author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: “Don't let yourself die without knowing the wonder of fucking with love.”

author: Dante Alighieri,
title: “Amor, ch'al cor gentile ratto s'apprende

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “What if love wasn't the act of finding what you were missing but the give-and-take that made you both match?”

author: أحلام مستغانمي,
title: “الحب هو ذكاء المسافة، ألّا تقترب كثيرًا فتلغي اللهفة، ولا تبتعد طويلًا فتُنسى.”

author: Douglas Pagels
title: “Love is a wonderful gift. It's a present so precious words can barely begin to describe it. Love is a feeling, the deepest and sweetest of all. It's incredibly strong and amazingly gentle at the very same time. It is a blessing that should be counted every day. It is nourishment for the soul. It is devotion, constantly letting each person know how supportive it's certainty can be. Love is a heart filled with affection for the most important person in your life. Love is looking at the special someone who makes your world go around and absolutely loving what you see. Love gives meaning to one's world and magic to a million hopes and dreams. It makes the morning shine more brightly and each season seem like it's the nicest one anyone ever had. Love is an invaluable bond that enriches every good thing in life. It gives each hug a tenderness, each heart a happiness, each spirit a steady lift. Love is an invisible connection that is exquisitely felt by those who know the joy, feel the warmth, share the sweetness, and celebrate the gift! ”

author: David Levithan,
title: “The key to a successful relationship isn’t just in the words, it’s in the choice of punctuation. When you’re in love with someone, a well-placed question mark can be the difference between bliss and disaster, and a deeply respected period or a cleverly inserted ellipsis can prevent all kinds of exclamations.”

author: Joshua Harris,
title: “The right thing at the wrong tme is the wrong thing.”

author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,
title: “If you have the woman you love, what more do you need? Well, besides an alibi for the time of her husband’s murder. ”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “In matters of grave importance, style, not sincerity, is the vital thing.”

author: Lauren Conrad
title: “Boys are like purses. You're always gonna have that one boy that you're always comfortable with and you know you'll always kind of like. That's your purse that you wear everywhere. Then you have that gorgeous bag that you want everyone to see you with but the gorgeous bag is usually an asshole or costs a lot of money. Then you have those other purses that you really like but you really don't want to be seen with”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “I don't know why people are afraid of lust. Then I can imagine that they are very afraid of me, for I have a great lust for everything. A lust for life, a lust for how the summer-heated street feels beneath my feet, a lust for the touch of another's skin on my skin...a lust for everything. I even lust after cake. Yes, I am very lusty and very scary.”

author: Orson Scott Card,
title: “You're a monster.

author: Samantha Young,
title: “Asshole.” “Just for that, I expect you to wrap that dirty mouth of yours around my cock tonight.” He narrowed his eyes on me.

author: W.C. Fields
title: “Everybody's got to believe in something. I believe I'll have another beer.”

author: Caitlin Moran,
title: “But, of course, you might be asking yourself, 'Am I a feminist? I might not be. I don't know! I still don't know what it is! I'm too knackered and confused to work it out. That curtain pole really still isn't up! I don't have time to work out if I am a women's libber! There seems to be a lot to it. WHAT DOES IT MEAN?'

author: Lewis Carroll,
title: “Now, here, you see, it takes all the running you can do, to keep in the same place. If you want to get somewhere else, you must run at least twice as fast as that!”

author: Clint Eastwood
title: “Tomorrow is promised to no one.”

author: Tom Stoppard,
title: “We're actors — we're the opposite of people!”

author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,
title: “Be kind to dragons, for thou art crunchy when toasted and taste good with ketchup. (Sebastian)”

author: Diana Wynne Jones,
title: “My shining dishonesty will be the salvation of me.”

author: Dale Carnegie
title: “It isn't what you have, or who you are, or where you are, or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
title: “Sometimes I think it is a great mistake to have matter that can think and feel. It complains so. By the same token, though, I suppose that boulders and mountains and moons could be accused of being a little too phlegmatic.”

author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,
title: “Me and Katy look adorkable in extraterrestrial

author: Suzanne Collins
title: “You can swim, too." he says. "Where did you learn that in District Twelve?"

author: Dorothy Parker,
title: “Men

author: Blaise Pascal
title: “I made this [letter] very long, because I did not have the leisure to make it shorter.”

author: Ellen DeGeneres
title: “Stuffed deer heads on walls are bad enough, but it’s worse when you see them wearing dark glasses, having streamers around their necks and a hat on their antlers. Because then you know they were enjoying themselves at a party when they were shot.”

author: W. Somerset Maugham,
title: “It is one of the defects of my character that I cannot altogether dislike anyone who makes me laugh.”

author: Jim Butcher,
title: “Da. This is going very well already."

author: Carl Sagan
title: “It's a lazy Saturday afternoon, there's a couple lying naked in bed reading Encyclopediea Brittannica to each other, and arguing about whether the Andromeda Galaxy is more 'numinous' than the Ressurection. Do they know how to have a good time, or don't they?”

author: Steven Wright
title: “If a person with multiple personalities threatens suicide, is that considered a hostage situation?”

author: Chuck Klosterman,
title: “I once loved a girl who almost loved me, but not as much as she loved John Cusack.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “He was painfully shy, which, as is often the manner of the painfully shy, he overcompensated for by being too loud at the wrong times.”

author: Kelly Creagh,
title: “So." [Isobel] cleared her throat. "What are we doing?"

author: Lewis Black,
title: “Who knew that the devil had a factory where he made millions of fossils, which his minions distributed throughout the earth, in order to confuse my tiny brain?”

author: Ann Brashares,
title: “I was supposed to write a romantic comedy, but my characters broke up.”

author: Dora J. Arod,
title: “I had a dream about you. You were an escalator, and I was a flight of stairs. You thought I was a Luddite, and I thought I was as ostrich, because I hadn’t figured out how to put the fly in flight. One day you broke down, and then you saw that you and I weren’t so different after all.”

author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,
title: “I had a dream about you. We installed Dr. Robert Jarvik’s artificial heart in a mannequin and brought it to life, only to later kill it because a creature that’s all fake heart and no brain is what’s commonly called a “politician,” and must be destroyed. ”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
title: “It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.”

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: “Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,

author: Joss Whedon
title: “Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.”

author: Henry van Dyke,
title: “Time is

author: Tennessee Williams,
title: “If I got rid of my demons, I’d lose my angels.”

author: Elizabeth Peters
title: “No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.”

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “No. I can survive well enough on my own— if given the proper reading material.”

author: Fitzgerald F. Scott,
title: “I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.”

author: Ally Condie,
title: “Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.”

author: Jeffrey Eugenides,
title: “Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.”

author: W. P. Kinsella
title: “Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get”

author: Shawn Slovo,
title: “Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident.”

author: Stephen Hawking
title: “We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.”

author: Maurice Sendak
title: “A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful.”

author: A.A. Milne
title: “I knew when I met you an adventure was going to happen.”

author: Anais Nin
title: “Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.”

author: Stephenie Meyer,
title: “Look after my heart - I've left it with you.”

author: Rumi
title: “When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.”

author: Franz Kafka
title: “A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.”

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: “All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.”

author: Walter Cronkite
title: “Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.”

author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley
title: “The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “Even death has a heart.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do.”

author: Anne Frank
title: “I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.”

author: Rodney Dangerfield
title: “I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “I am selfish. I am brave.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Every great love starts with a great story...”

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “Tonight I can write the saddest lines

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “We are all different. Don’t judge, understand instead.”

author: Pablo Neruda
title: “As if you were on fire from within.

author: George Carlin
title: “Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Clary,

author: William Arthur Ward
title: “The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.”

author: J.M. Barrie,
title: “I'm not young enough to know everything.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Why were you lurking under our window?"

author: Simon and Garfunkel
title: “I've got nothing to do today but smile.”

author: Plato
title: “We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.”

author: A.A. Milne
title: “How do you spell 'love'?" - Piglet

author: W. Somerset Maugham
title: “There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.”

author: Milan Kundera
title: “You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “They’re not hideous,” said Tessa.

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Want to keep Christ in Christmas? Feed the hungry, clothe the naked, forgive the guilty, welcome the unwanted, care for the ill, love your enemies, and do unto others as you would have done unto you.”

author: haruki murakami,
title: “Most things are forgotten over time. Even the war itself, the life-and-death struggle people went through is now like something from the distant past. We’re so caught up in our everyday lives that events of the past are no longer in orbit around our minds. There are just too many things we have to think about everyday, too many new things we have to learn. But still, no matter how much time passes, no matter what takes place in the interim, there are some things we can never assign to oblivion, memories we can never rub away. They remain with us forever, like a touchstone.”

author: Bill Ayers
title: “Your kids require you most of all to love them for who they are, not to spend your whole time trying to correct them.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “I do love nothing in the world so well as you- is not that strange?”

author: Hermann Hesse,
title: “When you like someone, you like them in spite of their faults. When you love someone, you love them with their faults.”

author: Ralph Ellison,
title: “When I discover who I am, I’ll be free.”

author: Stephen King
title: “If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.”

author: Margaret Thatcher
title: “In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.”

author: Charlotte Bronte,
title: “Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.”

author: Christopher Morley,
title: “There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.”

author: Corrie ten Boom
title: “Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.”

author: Tina Fey,
title: “Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.”

author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
title: “We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.”

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.”

author: Bram Stoker,
title: “There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.”

author: Arthur C. Clarke
title: “I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.”

author: John Cheever
title: “I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.”

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: “If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Herondales." Zachariah's voice was a breath, half laughter, half pain. "I had almost forgotten. No other family does so much for love, or feels so much guilt for it. Don't carry the weight of the world on you, Jace. It's too heavy for even a Herondale to bear.”

author: Jason Mraz
title: “It’s strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what’s real and what’s imaginary.”

author: Julie Anne Peters,
title: “Cut the ending. Revise the script. The man of her dreams is a girl.”

author: Jenny Han,
title: “Would you rather live one perfect day over and over or live your life with no perfect days but just decent ones?”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “People wait around too long for love. I'm happy with all of my lusts!”

author: Sophie Kinsella,
title: “It's like I'm thirteen again and he's my crush. All I'm aware of in this entire roomful of people is him. Where he is, what he's doing, who he's talking to.”

author: Colleen Hoover,
title: “You can’t leave yet. I’m not finished falling in love with you.”

author: William Faulkner
title: “You don’t love because: you love despite; not for the virtues, but despite the faults.”

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “I don't want to be somebody's crush. If somebody likes me, I want them to like the real me, not what they think I am.”

author: E. E. Cummings
title: “love is thicker than forget

author: E.E. Cummings
title: “twice I have lived forever in a smile”

author: Rupi Kaur,
title: “he placed his hands

author: Chelsea Fine,
title: “Love.

author: Margaret Atwood,
title: “How could I be sleeping with this particular man.... Surely only true love could justify my lack of taste.”

author: Michelle Hodkin,
title: “You can't hurt me the way you think you can. But even if you could? I would rather die with the taste of you on my tongue than live and never touch you again. I'm in love with you, Mara. I love you. No matter what you do.”

author: Megan McCafferty,
title: “It's so much easier to convince yourself you're madly in love with someone when you know nothing about him.”

author: Patrick Rothfuss,
title: “There are so many men, all endlessly attempting to sweep me off my feet. And there is one of you, trying just the opposite. Making sure my feet are firm beneath me, lest I fall.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “I want someone whose heart is big enough to hold me.”

author: Monique Duval
title: “He offered her the world. She said she had her own.”

author: Colleen Houck,
title: “A girl can still admire, can’t she? Even those who can’t afford to go in the store can still window-shop. Right? Knowing he wasn’t for me didn’t mean I couldn’t covet the merchandise.”

author: Julie Kagawa,
title: “I have come from the End of the World. From the River of Dreams, through the gauntlet and the Briar and the Deep Wyld, in order to stand before you today. I have but one request—to take my place at your side. To resume my duty as your knight, and to protect you and your kingdom for as long as I draw breath.”

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “I have named you queen.

author: Kazuo Ishiguro,
title: “You say you’re

author: John Green,
title: “I'm sorry. I know you loved her. It was hard not to.”

author: Michael jordan
title: “I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “Words save our lives, sometimes.”

author: Stephen King
title: “Fault always lies in the same place: with him weak enough to lay blame.”

author: G.K. Chesterton,
title: “A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.”

author: Robert Greene,
title: “LAW 25

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “When I was a little girl, everything in the world fell into either of these two categories: wrong or right. Black or white. Now that I am an adult, I have put childish things aside and now I know that some things fall into wrong and some things fall into right. Some things are categorized as black and some things are categorized as white. But most things in the world aren't either! Most things in the world aren't black, aren't white, aren't wrong, aren't right, but most of everything is just different. And now I know that there's nothing wrong with different, and that we can let things be different, we don't have to try and make them black or white, we can just let them be grey. And when I was a child, I thought that God was the God who only saw black and white. Now that I am no longer a child, I can see, that God is the God who can see the black and the white and the grey, too, and He dances on the grey! Grey is okay.”

author: Trevor Noah,
title: “I don’t regret anything I’ve ever done in life, any choice that I’ve made. But I’m consumed with regret for the things I didn’t do, the choices I didn’t make, the things I didn’t say. We spend so much time being afraid of failure, afraid of rejection. But regret is the thing we should fear most. Failure is an answer. Rejection is an answer. Regret is an eternal question you will never have the answer to. “What if…” “If only…” “I wonder what would have…” You will never, never know, and it will haunt you for the rest of your days.”

author: Charles Dickens,
title: “Before I go," he said, and paused -- "I may kiss her?"

author: Kelly Cutrone,
title: “I advise you to stop sharing your dreams with people who try to hold you back, even if they're your parents. Because, if you're the kind of person who senses there's something out there for you beyond whatever it is you're expected to do - if you want to be EXTRA-ordinary- you will not get there by hanging around a bunch of people who tell you you're not extraordinary. Instead, you will probably

author: William Arthur Ward
title: “The adventure of life is to learn. The purpose of life is to grow. The nature of life is to change. The challenge of life is to overcome. The essence of life is to care. The opportunity of like is to serve. The secret of life is to dare. The spice of life is to befriend. The beauty of life is to give.”

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: “Millions saw the apple fall, Newton was the only one who asked why?”

author: Napoleon Hill
title: “Do not wait: the time will never be 'just right'. Start where you stand, and work whatever tools you may have at your command and better tools will be found as you go along.”

author: Flannery O'Connor
title: “Accepting oneself does not preclude an attempt to become better.”

author: Zig Ziglar
title: “When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.”

author: Dolly Parton
title: “I'm not going to limit myself just because people won't accept the fact that I can do something else.”

author: Chris Colfer,
title: “You've got to show the world who you are before it tells you. Otherwise you become victim to someone you're not.”

author: A.W. Tozer
title: “Sometimes I go to God and say, "God, if Thou dost never answer another prayer while I live on this earth, I will still worship Thee as long as I live and in the ages to come for what Thou hast done already. God’s already put me so far in debt that if I were to live one million millenniums I couldn’t pay Him for what He’s done for me.”

author: Henry David Thoreau,
title: “There are a thousand hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.”

author: Nayyirah Waheed
title: “If someone does not want me it is not the end of the world. But if I do not want me, the world is nothing but endings.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “The best love in the world, is the love of a man. The love of a man who came from your womb, the love of your son! I don't have a daughter, but maybe the love of a daughter is the best, too. I am first and foremost me, but right after that, I am a mother. The best thing that I can ever be, is me. But the best gift that I will ever have, is being a mother.”

author: Joseph Campbell,
title: “We're so engaged in doing things to achieve purposes of outer value that we forget the inner value, the rapture that is associated with being alive, is what it is all about.”

author: Christopher McCandless
title: “Two years he walks the earth. No phone, no pool, no pets, no cigarettes. Ultimate freedom. An extremist. An aesthetic voyager whose home is the road. Escaped from Atlanta. Thou shalt not return, 'cause "the West is the best." And now after two rambling years comes the final and greatest adventure. The climactic battle to kill the false being within and victoriously conclude the spiritual pilgrimage. Ten days and nights of freight trains and hitchhiking bring him to the Great White North. No longer to be poisoned by civilization he flees, and walks alone upon the land to become lost in the wild.

author: Flora Jessop,
title: “To those who abuse: the sin is yours, the crime is yours, and the shame is yours. To those who protect the perpetrators: blaming the victims only masks the evil within, making you as guilty as those who abuse. Stand up for the innocent or go down with the rest.”

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: “Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude”

author: Michelle Hodkin,
title: “It doesn’t matter what we are. It matters what we do.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “There are two things we should always be 1. raw and 2. ready. When you are raw, you are always ready and when you are ready you usually realize that you are raw. Waiting for perfection is not an answer, one cannot say "I will be ready when I am perfect" because then you will never be ready, rather one must say "I am raw and I am ready just like this right now, how and who I am.”

author: Richelle E. Goodrich,
title: “Don't ever give up.

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Instead of worrying about what could go wrong, change your thoughts to what could go right. When you change the negative thought into a positive one, it eliminates the negative one.”

author: Jack Kerouac,
title: “I was halfway across America, at the dividing line between the East of my youth and the West of my future.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Real change is difficult at the beginning. Without the familiar to rely upon, you may not in as much command as you had once been. When things are not going your way, you will start doubting yourself. Stay positive, keep the faith, and keep moving forward – your breakthrough may be just around the corner.”

author: Robert M. Pirsig,
title: “The truth knocks on the door and you say, "Go away, I'm looking for the truth," and so it goes away. Puzzling.”

author: Thomas Merton
title: “To be grateful is to recognize the Love of God in everything He has given us - and He has given us everything. Every breath we draw is a gift of His love, every moment of existence is a grace, for it brings with it immense graces from Him.

author: Santosh Kalwar,
title: “All the problem of women, starts with men. All the problem of men, ends with women.”

author: Dr. Seuss
title: “With your head full of brains and your shoes full of feet, you're too smart to go down any not-so-good street.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “This is the key to life: To expect everything to be given to you from above, yet to be genuinely surprised and forever grateful, when they are. Expecting all good things to be yours, while not knowing how to take anything for granted. If there may be a key in life, this is the key.”

author: Alan Moore,
title: “The past can't hurt you anymore. Not unless you let it. They made you into a victim, Evey. They made you into a statistic. But, that's not the real you. That's not who you are inside.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “Let us live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.”

author: Cecelia Ahern,
title: “She had been given a wonderful gift: life. Sometimes it was cruelly taken away too soon, but it's what you did with it that counted, not how long it lasted.”

author: J.K. Rowling
title: “What's most important in a friendship? Tolerance and loyalty.”

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: “It is not worth the while to let our imperfections disturb us always.”

author: St. Francis Of Assisi
title: “The deeds you do may be the only sermon some persons will hear today”

author: Tennessee Williams,
title: “Yes, I have tricks in my pocket, I have things up my sleeve. But I am the opposite of a stage magician. He gives you illusion that has the appearance of truth. I give you truth in the pleasant disguise of illusion.”

author: Antonio Machado,
title: “Wanderer, your footsteps are the road, and nothing more; wanderer, there is no road, the road is made by walking. By walking one makes the road, and upon glancing behind one sees the path that never will be trod again. Wanderer, there is no road-- Only wakes upon the sea.

author: Loren Eiseley
title: “Once upon a time, there was a wise man who used to go to the ocean to do his writing. He had a habit of walking on the beach before he began his work.

author: Peter S. Beagle,
title: “I am no king, and I am no lord,

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “There is great change to be experienced once you learn the power of letting go. Stop allowing anyone or anything to control, limit, repress, or discourage you from being your true self! Today is YOURS to shape - own it - break free from people and things that poison or dilute your spirit.”

author: David Hume,
title: “No man ever threw away life while it was worth keeping.”

author: Dan Howell
title: “My only regrets are the moments when i doubted myself and took the safe route. Life is too short to waste time being unhappy.”

author: anaïs nin
title: “life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity, & stumble from defeat to defeat.”

author: Aeschylus
title: “Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “Destiny is real. And she's not mild-mannered. She will come around and hit you in the face and knock you over and before you know what hit you, you're naked- stripped of everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you didn't know- and there you are! A bloody nose, bruises all over you, and naked. And it's the most beautiful thing.”

author: Wally Lamb,
title: “I am not a smart man, particularly, but one day, at long last, I stumbled from the dark woods of my own, and my family's, and my country's past, holding in my hands these truths: that love grows from the rich loam of forgiveness; that mongrels make good dogs; that the evidence of God exists in the roundness of things. This much, at least, I've figured out. I know this much is true.”

author: Amit Ray,
title: “Yoga is not a religion. It is a science, science of well-being, science of youthfulness, science of integrating body, mind and soul.”

author: Viktor E. Frankl,
title: “By declaring that man is responsible and must actualize the potential meaning of his life, I wish to stress that the true meaning of life is to be discovered in the world rather than within man or his own psyche, as though it were a closed system. I have termed this constitutive characteristic "the self-transcendence of human existence." It denotes the fact that being human always points, and is directed, to something or someone, other than oneself--be it a meaning to fulfill or another human being to encounter. The more one forgets himself--by giving himself to a cause to serve or another person to love--the more human he is and the more he actualizes himself. What is called self-actualization is not an attainable aim at all, for the simple reason that the more one would strive for it, the more he would miss it. In other words, self-actualization is possible only as a side-effect of self-transcendence.”

author: Henrik Ibsen
title: “A thousand words leave not the same deep impression as does a single deed.”

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: “There is no failure except in no longer trying.”

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,
title: “The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained in sudden flight but, they while their companions slept, they were toiling upwards in the night.”

author: A.G. Howard,
title: “Tearing down the rest of the world won't make you happy. Look inside yourself. Because finding who you were meant to be? What you were put into this world to do? That's what fills the emptiness. It's the only things that can.”

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: “Write while the heat is in you. The writer who postpones the recording of his thoughts uses an iron which has cooled to burn a hole with. He cannot inflame the minds of his audience.”

author: Lucy Maud Montgomery,
title: “Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.”

author: Lemony Snicket,
title: “Just because something is traditional is no reason to do it, of course. Piracy, for example, is a tradition that has been carried on for hundreds of years, but that doesn't mean we should all attack ships and steal their gold.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Ask us no questions and we’ll tell you no lies.”

author: Marissa Meyer,
title: “Knees suddenly weak, she reached for his forearms to stabilize herself. “You came for me.”

author: Groucho Marx
title: “Next time I see you, remind me not to talk to you.”

author: Jim Butcher,
title: “The man once wrote:

author: Bill Watterson,
title: “From now on, I'm not doing anything I don't want to do! The world owes me happiness, fulfillment and success.... I'm just here to cash in.”

author: Charlaine Harris,
title: “Hey, our hair's the same color," I said, eying us side by side in the mirror.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other people's.”

author: Diana Gabaldon,
title: “When I asked my da how ye knew which was the right woman, he told me when the time came, I'd have no doubt. And I didn't. When I woke in the dark under that tree on the road to Leoch, with you sitting on my chest, cursing me for bleeding to death, I said to myself 'Jamie Fraser, for all ye canna see what she looks like, and for all she weights as much as a good draft horse, this is the woman.”

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: “I'm not the smartest fellow in the world, but I can sure pick smart colleagues.”

author: George Carlin
title: “It's never just a game when you're winning.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “It is perfectly monstrous,' he said, at last, 'the way people go about nowadays saying things against one behind one's back that are absolutely and entirely true.”

author: Marissa Meyer,
title: “She sighed, annoyed at her restlessness. “So,” she said, disrupting Wolf in another backward glance.

author: Mark Twain
title: “When I was younger, I could remember anything, whether it had happened or not; but my faculties are decaying now and soon I shall be so I cannot remember any but the things that never happened. It is sad to go to pieces like this but we all have to do it.”

author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,
title: “A few seconds after he stepped out into the hallway and closed the door behind him, there was a fleshly smack and then Andrew yelling, “Ouch. What in the hell was that for?” “Your timing sucks on an epic level,” Daemon shot back.”

author: Kristin Cashore,
title: “Find something useful to do with your morning,' she thought to him as she neared her chambers. 'Do something heroic in front of an audience. Knock a child into a river while no one's looking and then rescue him.”

author: Francis Bacon
title: “Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.”

author: A. Whitney Brown
title: “I'm not a vegetarian because I love animals, I'm a vegetarian because I hate plants.”

author: Michael Thomas Ford
title: “I didn't realize there was a ranking." I said. "Sadie frowned. "What do you mean?" "A ranking," I said. "You know, what's crazier than what." "Oh, sure there is," Sadie said. She sat back in her chair. "First you have your generic depressives. They're a dime a dozen and usually pretty boring. Then you've got the bulimics and the anorexics. They're slightly more interesting, although usually they're just girls with nothing better to do. Then you start getting into the good stuff: the arsonists, the schizophrenics, the manic-depressives. You can never quite tell what those will do. And then you've got the junkies. They're completely tragic, because chances are they're just going to go right back on the stuff when they're out of here." "So junkies are at the top of the crazy chain," I said. Sadie shook her head. "Uh-uh," she said. "Suicides are." I looked at her. "Why?" "Anyone can be crazy," she answered. "That's usually just because there's something screwed up in your wiring, you know? But suicide is a whole different thing. I mean, how much do you have to hate yourself to want to just wipe yourself out?”

author: Shelly Laurenston,
title: “Sissy Mae Smith...stumbled into the room loaded down with even more bags. "You pack like a woman," she snarled when she finally dropped the luggage to the floor. "How can one man have so much conditioner?"

author: Daniel Handler
title: “A library is like an island in the middle of a vast sea of ignorance, particularly if the library is very tall and the surrounding area has been flooded.”

author: Dorothy Parker
title: “I'd rather have a bottle in front of me than a frontal lobotomy.”

author: Criss Jami,
title: “Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.”

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “Bones has always been smart," I muttered. "His intelligence was just camouflaged under a mountain of p**sy."

author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,
title: “Because this absolutely insane - the craziest thing I'd ever done. Worse than giving a one-star review, scarier than asking for an interview with an author I'd give my firstborn to eat lunch with, more stupid than kissing Daemon.”

author: Ryan Mecum,
title: “Blood is really warm,

author: Henry Ford
title: “Any customer can have a car painted any colour that he wants so long as it is black.”

author: Colleen Houck,
title: “He looks like a runway model. How in the world am I going to be able to reject that? The world is so unfair. Seriously, it's like turning Brad Pitt down for a date. The girl who could actually do it should win an award for idiot of the century.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Unless you stop him. Perhaps next we meet."

author: Dora J. Arod,
title: “My love is meatloaf flavored. I just wish my meatloaf was also meatloaf flavored.”

author: Jeffrey McDaniel
title: “Even when I'm dead, I'll swim through the Earth,

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “I thought we were a real love relationship. I did. I was very invested in love, but it was just this long long sex thing that could end at any moment because after all, it's just about getting off. Almost all the time, you tell yourself you're loving somebody when you're just using them. This only looks like love.”

author: Shannon L. Alder
title: “When you loved someone and had to let them go, there will always be that small part of yourself that whispers, "What was it that you wanted and why didn't you fight for it?”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “You are the only one who has understood even a whisper of me, and I will tell you that I am the only person who has understood even a whisper of you.”

author: Jodi Picoult,
title: “People always say that, when you love someone, nothing in the world matters. But that's not true, is it? You know, and I know, that when you love someone, everything in the world matters a little bit more.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “I just...I just miss him. And I hate being so alone.”

author: Anne Lamott,
title: “Hope is not about proving anything. It's about choosing to believe this one thing, that love is bigger than any grim, bleak shit anyone can throw at us.”

author: Leigh Bardugo,
title: “They had an ordinary life, full of ordinary things-if love can ever be called that.”

author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
title: “A weed is but an unloved flower.”

author: Jamie Weise
title: “When you miss someone....it’s weird…your body doesn’t function normally..as it should. Because I miss you, and my heart…it’s not steady…my soul it sings numb. Fingers are cold…like you…your soul.”

author: Rosamund Hodge,
title: “Where you go, I shall go; where you die, I shall die, and there will I be buried.”

author: Gregory David Roberts,
title: “She loved the guy. She did it for him. She would’ve done anything for him. Some people are like that. Some loves are like that. Most loves are like that, from what I can see. Your heart starts to feel like an overcrowded lifeboat. You throw your pride out to keep it afloat, and your self-respect and your independence. After a while you start throwing people out—your friends, everyone you used to know. And it’s still not enough. The lifeboat is still sinking, and you know it’s going to take you down with it. I’ve seen that happen to a lot of people here. I think that’s why I’m sick of love.”

author: Ally Condie,
title: “Cassia.

author: Laini Taylor,
title: “It was brave," countered Issa. "It was rare. It was love, and it was beautiful.”

author: Rabindranath Tagore
title: “Love's gift cannot be given, it waits to be accepted.”

author: Vincent van Gogh,
title: “The heart of man is very much like the sea, it has its storms, it has its tides and in its depths it has its pearls too”

author: Jane Austen,
title: “Had I been in love, I could not have been more wretchedly blind. But vanity, not love, has been my folly.”

author: Leonard Cohen,
title: “And I'll dance with you in Vienna,

author: Jane Austen,
title: “I come here with no expectations, only to profess, now that I am at liberty to do so, that my heart is and always will be...yours.”

author: Mik Everett
title: “If a writer falls in love with you, you can never die.”

author: Hayao Miyazaki
title: “I’ve become skeptical of the unwritten rule that just because a boy and girl appear in the same feature, a romance must ensue. Rather, I want to portray a slightly different relationship, one where the two mutually inspire each other to live - if I’m able to, then perhaps I’ll be closer to portraying a true expression of love.”

author: Frida Kahlo
title: “You deserve a lover who wants you disheveled, with everything and all the reasons that wake you up in a haste and the demons that won’t let you sleep.

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “I crossed a thousand leagues to come to you, and lost the best part of me along the way. Don't tell me to leave.”

author: che guevara
title: “Every day People straighten up the hair, why not the heart?”

author: Scott Turow
title: “Nobody ever gets what they want when it comes to love.”

author: Kirsten Miller,
title: “All the most powerful emotions come from chaos -fear,anger,love- especially love. Love is chaos itself. Think about it! Love makes no sense. It shakes you up and spins you around. And then, eventually , it falls apart.”

author: Alfred Tennyson,
title: “Half the night I waste in sighs,

author: Albert Camus,
title: “And he knew, also, what the old man was thinking as his tears flowed, and he, Rieux, thought it too: that a loveless world is a dead world, and always there comes an hour when one is weary of prisons, of one's work, and of devotion to duty, and all one craves for is a loved face, the warmth and wonder of a loving heart.”

author: Niccolò Machiavelli,
title: “Men are driven by two principal impulses, either by love or by fear.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Jace looked as if she had slapped him. "Why are you determined not to believe us?"

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
title: “War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.”

author: Rumi
title: “You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?”

author: Oriah Mountain Dreamer
title: “It doesn't interest me what you do for a living. I want to know what you ache for, and if you dare to dream of meeting your heart's longing.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.”

author: Pablo Neruda
title: “Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “You speak an infinite deal of nothing.”

author: J.D. Salinger,
title: “I'm quite illiterate, but I read a lot. ”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?”

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
title: “If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something.”

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
title: “You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “It’s only after you’ve stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.”

author: Raymond Chandler,
title: “To say goodbye is to die a little.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “He does something to me, that boy. Every time. It’s his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.”

author: Mary Shelley,
title: “Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.”

author: Christopher Paolini
title: “Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?”

author: Terry Pratchett,
title: “Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.”

author: Marcus Aurelius,
title: “Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.”

author: Stewart O'Nan,
title: “You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Grover was sniffing the wind, looking nervous. He fished out his acorns and threw them into the sand, then played his pipes. They rearranged themselves in a pattern that made no sense to me, but Grover looked concerned.

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.”

author: Rumi,
title: “Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.”

author: Malcolm X,
title: “You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.”

author: Norton Juster,
title: “So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible.”

author: Rumi
title: “Forget safety.

author: Chinua Achebe
title: “If you don't like someone's story, write your own.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.”

author: Frank McCourt,
title: “You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.”

author: Joel Osteen,
title: “You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It wont happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, ‘I don’t care how hard this is, I don’t care how disappointed I am, I’m not going to let this get the best of me. I’m moving on with my life.”

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,
title: “A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.”

author: Bill  Nye
title: “Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.”

author: J. R. R. Tolkien,
title: “Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky,

author: Maya Angelou
title: “Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.”

author: Christopher Paolini,
title: “Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.”

author: Virginia Woolf
title: “Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?”

author: Rob Reiner
title: “Everybody talks about wanting to change things and help and fix, but ultimately all you can do is fix yourself. And that's a lot. Because if you can fix yourself, it has a ripple effect.”

author: J.R. Ward,
title: “Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.”

author: Ivan Turgenev
title: “If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.”

author: Dr. Seuss
title: “How did it get so late so soon?”

author: Colette
title: “You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.”

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: “There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.”

author: John Green,
title: “It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.'

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
title: “What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well...”

author: Gayle Forman,
title: “I realize now that dying is easy. Living is hard.”

author: Natalie Babbitt,
title: “Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.”

author: Anais Nin
title: “I am an excitable person who only understands life lyrically, musically, in whom feelings are much stronger as reason. I am so thirsty for the marvelous that only the marvelous has power over me. Anything I can not transform into something marvelous, I let go. Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.”

author: Johnny Cash
title: “All your life, you will be faced with a choice. You can choose love or hate…I choose love.”

author: Lois Lowry,
title: “Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none”

author: Coco Chanel
title: “It’s probably not just by chance that I’m alone. It would be very hard for a man to live with me, unless he’s terribly strong. And if he’s stronger than I, I’m the one who can’t live with him. … I’m neither smart nor stupid, but I don’t think I’m a run-of-the-mill person. I’ve been in business without being a businesswoman, I’ve loved without being a woman made only for love. The two men I’ve loved, I think, will remember me, on earth or in heaven, because men always remember a woman who caused them concern and uneasiness. I’ve done my best, in regard to people and to life, without precepts, but with a taste for justice.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “I wanted to tell the book thief many things, about beauty and brutality. But what could I tell her about those things that she didn't already know? I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race-that rarely do I ever simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant.”

author: Chico Xavier
title: “‎Though nobody can go back and make a new beginning... Anyone can start over and make a new ending.”

author: Sylvia Plath
title: “Mad Girl's Love Song

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “So you're always honest," I said.

author: Margaret Atwood
title: “I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary.”

author: John Steinbeck,
title: “Maybe ever’body in the whole damn world is scared of each other.”

author: L.M. Montgomery,
title: “I'd like to add some beauty to life," said Anne dreamily. "I don't exactly want to make people KNOW more... though I know that IS the noblest ambition... but I'd love to make them have a pleasanter time because of me... to have some little joy or happy thought that would never have existed if I hadn't been born.”

author: China Miéville,
title: “Scars are not injuries, Tanner Sack. A scar is a healing. After injury, a scar is what makes you whole.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “The further you go, the more you have to be proud of. At the same time, in order to come a long way, you have to be behind to begin with. IN the end, though maybe it's not how you reach a place that matters. Just that you get there at all.”

author: Don Miguel Ruiz,
title: “If you live in a past dream, you don't enjoy what is happening right now because you will always wish it to be different than it is. There is no time to miss anyone or anything because you are alive. Not enjoying what is happening right now is living in the past and being only half alive. This leads to self pity, suffering and tears.”

author: Charles Spurgeon
title: “When your will is God's will, you will have your will.”

author: John C. Maxwell
title: “The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “When forever becomes a place...when forever ceases to be just a word… when it ceases to be just a measurement of time…but instead becomes a place where soul mates can dance to the song in their hearts... that is a reflection of true love.”

author: Criss Jami,
title: “The harder you fall, the heavier your heart; the heavier your heart, the stronger you climb; the stronger you climb, the higher your pedestal.”

author: Joseph Campbell
title: “Myth is much more important and true than history. History is just journalism and you know how reliable that is.”

author: Thomas à Kempis,
title: “Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.”

author: John Welch
title: “هذه رسالة لكاتب مكسيسي اسمه "جوني ولش" كتبها على لسان دمية لماركيز سنة 1999 وقت أن كان ماركيز يصارع السرطان

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “I came to the conclusion long ago that all religions were true and that also that all had some error in them, and while I hold by my own religion, I should hold other religions as dear as Hinduism. So we can only pray, if we were Hindus, not that a Christian should become a Hindu; but our innermost prayer should be that a Hindu should become a better Hindu, a Muslim a better Muslim, and a Christian a better Christian.”

author: Thomas S. Monson
title: “Never let a problem to be solved, become more important than a person to be loved.”

author: Isabel Allende,
title: “You can't find someone who doesn't want to be found.”

author: Sanober Khan,
title: “The splendid thing

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “If you care about something enough, you'll find a way to make it happen.”

author: Ann Brashares,
title: “Maybe you think you’ll be entitled to more happiness later by forgoing all of it now, but it doesn’t work that way. Happiness takes as much practice as unhappiness does. It’s by living that you live more. By waiting you wait more. Every waiting day makes your life a little less. Every lonely day makes you a little smaller. Every day you put off your life makes you less capable of living it.”

author: Stephen King,
title: “To write is human, to edit is divine.”

author: Shel Silverstein
title: “No Difference

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Let go of something old that no longer serves you to make room for something new.”

author: Wiz Khalifa
title: “I don’t chase after anyone, If you wanna walk out of my life, then I’ll hold the fucking door open for you.”

author: Tina Fey,
title: “Don't waste your energy trying to change opinions ... Do your thing, and don't care if they like it.”

author: Nick Vujicic
title: “It's a lie to think you're not good enough. It's a lie to think you're not worth anything.”

author: Dr. Seuss
title: “Everything stinks till it’s finished.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “There is no more profitable investment than investing in yourself. It is the best investment you can make; you can never go wrong with it. It is the true way to improve yourself to be the best version of you and lets you be able to best serve those around you.”

author: Gerard Way
title: “I’ve gotta get out of the basement. I’ve gotta see the world. I’ve gotta make a difference”

author: محمد حسن علوان,
title: “لا تحزن الا عن شيئين: فوات هدفك, أو اثناؤك عنه ”

author: Philip Pullman
title: “There's a hunger for stories in all of us, adults too. We need stories so much that we're even willing to read bad books to get them, if the good books won't supply them.”

author: Anthony Robbins
title: “Every problem is a gift - without problems we would not grow.”

author: T.S. Eliot
title: “The purpose of literature is to turn blood into ink.”

author: Scott Adams
title: “I love you like a fat kid loves cake!”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.”

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: “The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.”

author: George Bernard Shaw,
title: “You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.”

author: T.H. White,
title: “The bravest people are the ones who don’t mind looking like cowards.”

author: Marcus Aurelius,
title: “You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.”

author: Rumi
title: “If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?”

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: “People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.”

author: Pablo Neruda,
title: “I want

author: George Orwell
title: “Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.”

author: Audrey Niffenegger,
title: “Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?”

author: Mark Twain
title: “When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.”

author: Betty Smith,
title: “The world was hers for the reading.”

author: Nicholson Baker,
title: “I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read.”

author: Hafiz
title: “And still, after all this time,

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.”

author: Barbara Kingsolver,
title: “The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “I can resist anything except temptation.”

author: Ralph Ellison,
title: “What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?”

author: Harper Lee,
title: “Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts.”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.”

author: Virginia Woolf,
title: “One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.”

author: Ian Fleming
title: “Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.”

author: Clare Boothe Luce
title: “Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable.”

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: “The first draft of anything is shit.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.”

author: R.J. Palacio,
title: “The best way to measure how much you've grown isn't by inches or the number of laps you can now run around the track, or even your grade point average-- though those things are important, to be sure. It's what you've done with your time, how you've chosen to spend your days, and whom you've touched this year. That, to me, is the greatest measure of success.”

author: Karen Moning,
title: “It's just that in the Deep South, women learn at a young age that when the world is falling apart around you, it's time to take down the drapes and make a new dress.”

author: Martin Luther King Jr.,
title: “Free at last, Free at last, Thank God almighty we are free at last.”
