You cannot follow them; there are no footprints left behind.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “A man can be happy with any woman as long as he does not love her.”

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “The Court of Dreams.

author: Kristin Cashore,
title: “I know you don't want this, Katsa. But I can't help myself. The moment you came barreling into my life I was lost. I'm afraid to tell you what I wish for, for fear you'll... oh, I don't know, throw me into the fire. Or more likely, refuse me. Or worst of all, despise me," he said, his voice breaking and his eyes dropping from her face. His face dropping into his hands. "I love you," he said. "You're more dear to my heart than I ever knew anyone could be. And I've made you cry; and there I'll stop.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Most of us must learn to love people and use things rather than loving things and using people.”

author: T.H. White,
title: “She hardly ever thought of him. He had worn a place for himself in some corner of her heart, as a sea shell, always boring against the rock, might do. The making of the place had been her pain. But now the shell was safely in the rock. It was lodged, and ground no longer.”

author: Marcel Proust,
title: “Love is a striking example of how little reality means to us.”

author: Charlie Chaplin in a letter to his daughter Geraldine
title: “Your naked body should only belong to those who fall in love with your naked soul.”

author: Marian Keyes,
title: “Failed relationships can be described as so much wasted make-up.”

author: Melissa de la Cruz,
title: “You cannot be with someone just because you don’t want to hurt him. You have your own happiness to think about.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk,
title: “Six hundred and forty fish later, the only thing I know is everything you love will die. The first time you meet someone special, you can count on them one day being dead and in the ground.”

author: Madonna
title: “To be brave is to love someone unconditionally, without expecting anything in return. To just give. That takes courage, because we don't want to fall on our faces or leave ourselves open to hurt.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “She was right about something else too," Dimitri said after a long pause. My back was to him, but there was a strange quality to his voice that made me turn around.

author: Helen Fielding,
title: “Can officially confirm that the way to a man's heart these days is not through beauty, food, sex, or alluringness of character, but merely the ability to seem not very interested in him.”

author: J.A. Redmerski,
title: “I don’t think you ever really fall

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “These pictures are my heart. And if my heart was a canvas, every square inch of it would be painted over with you.”

author: Patricia Briggs,
title: “I don't like it when I outweigh my men.”

author: Julie Kagawa,
title: “His breath hitched, and he regarded me hungrily. “You’re playing with fire, you know that?”

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
title: “If somebody says 'I love you' to me, I feel as though I had a pistol pointed at my head. What can anybody reply under such conditions but that which the pistol holder requires? 'I love you, too'.”

author: Yukio Mishima
title: “True beauty is something that attacks, overpowers, robs, and finally destroys.”

author: Victor Hugo,
title: “Life's great happiness is to be convinced we are loved.”

author: Meister Eckhart,
title: “The eye through which I see God is the same eye through which God sees me; my eye and God's eye are one eye, one seeing, one knowing, one love.”

author: Steve Harvey
title: “Nothing on this planet can compare with a woman’s love—it is kind and compassionate, patient and nurturing, generous and sweet and unconditional. Pure. If you are her man, she will walk on water and through a mountain for you, too, no matter how you’ve acted out, no matter what crazy thing you’ve done, no matter the time or demand. If you are her man, she will talk to you until there just aren’t any more words left to say, encourage you when you’re at rock bottom and think there just isn’t any way out, hold you in her arms when you’re sick, and laugh with you when you’re up. And if you’re her man and that woman loves you—I mean really loves you?—she will shine you up when you’re dusty, encourage you when you’re down, defend you even when she’s not so sure you were right, and hang on your every word, even when you’re not saying anything worth listening to. And no matter what you do, no matter how many times her friends say you’re no good, no matter how many times you slam the door on the relationship, she will give you her very best and then some, and keep right on trying to win over your heart, even when you act like everything she’s done to convince you she’s The One just isn’t good enough.

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “I'll find you. There is no place in this world you can hide from me. I'm watching.

author: Mikhail Lermontov,
title: “Love, like fire, goes out without fuel.”

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “It is the possibility that keeps me going, and though you may call me a dreamer or a fool or any other thing, I believe that anything is possible.”

author: Colleen Houck,
title: “The fact is…I’m in love with you, and I have been for some time.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “He sighed and then focused his eyes right on me. It was like drowning, drowning in seas of green. There was nothing in the world except for those eyes.

author: D. Simone
title: “May Light always surround you;

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.”

author: Bill Ayers
title: “You need to find a way to live your life, that it doesn't make a mockery of your values.”

author: Alberto Manguel,
title: “Maybe this is why we read, and why in moments of darkness we return to books: to find words for what we already know.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. When you change for the better, the people around you will be inspired to change also....but only after doing their best to make you stop. Live your truth and don't EVER stop.”

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
title: “Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.”

author: Henry David Thoreau,
title: “All men want, not something to do with, but something to do, or rather something to be.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “You will never follow your own inner voice until you clear up the doubts in your mind.”

author: Wilfred Arlan Peterson
title: “As a single footstep will not make a path on the earth, so a single thought will not make a pathway in the mind. To make a deep physical path, we walk again and again. To make a deep mental path, we must think over and over the kind of thoughts we wish to dominate our lives.”

author: Jocelyn Soriano,
title: “Yes, I understand why things had to happen this way. I understand his reason for causing me pain. But mere understanding does not chase away the hurt. It does not call upon the sun when dark clouds have loomed over me. Let the rain come then if it must come! And let it wash away the dust that hurt my eyes!”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “We can't choose our fate, but we can choose others. Be careful in knowing that.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
title: “Ónen i-estel edain, ú-chebin estel anim.

author: Amit Ray,
title: “Looking at beauty in the world, is the first step of purifying the mind.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Stop doing what is easy or popular. Start doing what is right.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “We are afraid of losing what we have, whether it's our life or our possessions and property. But this fear evaporates when we understand that our life stories and the history of the world were written by the same hand.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “It doesn't matter how many people you meet in your life; you just need the real ones who accept you for who you are and help you become who you should be.”

author: Epicurus
title: “Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Always believe in yourself and always stretch yourself beyond your limits. Your life is worth a lot more than you think because you are capable of accomplishing more than you know. You have more potential than you think, but you will never know your full potential unless you keep challenging yourself and pushing beyond your own self imposed limits.”

author: William James
title: “The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude.”

author: Dan Brown,
title: “The only difference between you and God is that you have forgotten you are divine.”

author: Thomas Bernhard,
title: “Instead of committing suicide, people go to work.”

author: Shel Silverstein,
title: “If you have to dry the dishes

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “But beauty is about finding the right fit, the most natural fit, To be perfect, you have to feel perfect about yourself --- avoid trying to be something you're not. For a goddess, that's especially hard. We can change so easily.

author: Jim Henson
title: “Life's like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.”

author: Abraham Verghese,
title: “The key to your happiness is to own your slippers, own who you are, own how you look, own your family, own the talents you have, and own the ones you don't. If you keep saying your slippers aren't yours, then you'll die searching, you'll die bitter, always feeling you were promised more. Not only our actions, but also our omissions, become our destiny.”

author: Jim Henson,
title: “If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn't anything you can't do if you want to.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “I am a flawed person. A brook with many stones, a clear blue sky with many blackbirds. I have many shortcomings. A rainbow that’s not long enough, a starry night with clouds. But I can only be thankful to the God who loves me just this way, and I can only be grateful to the people in my life who accept the clear blue sky with many blackbirds and who are patient with the rainbow that isn’t long enough. And because of this, I am taught love, because of this I love my God, and I love these people.”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Associate Yourself with People Who Think Positively:

author: Herman Hesse,
title: “You are willing to die, you coward, but not to live.”

author: Dalai Lama XIV,
title: “This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Time weighs down on you like an old, ambiguous dream. You keep on moving, trying to sleep through it. But even if you go to the ends of the earth, you won't be able to escape it. Still, you have to go there- to the edge of the world. There's something you can't do unless you get there.”

author: M.L. Stedman,
title: “Scars are just another kind of memory.”

author: Rumi,
title: “Do you know what you are?

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying. ”

author: Thich Nhat Hanh,
title: “Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.”

author: Romain Rolland
title: “If a man is to shed the light of the sun upon other men, he must first of all have it within himself.”

author: Joseph Campbell
title: “Your sacred space is where you can find yourself over and over again.”

author: Jenny Han,
title: “We stood there, looking at each other, saying nothing. But it was the kind of nothing that meant everything. In his eyes, there was no trace of what had happened between us earlier and I could feel something inside me break.

author: Hiromu Arakawa,
title: “Nothing's perfect, the world's not perfect. But it's there for us, trying the best it can; that's what makes it so damn beautiful.”

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “I love you more than there are stars in the sky and fish in the sea.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Attitude is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Optimism is a choice. Kindness is a choice. Giving is a choice. Respect is a choice. Whatever choice you make makes you. Choose wisely.”

author: Frank Zappa
title: “Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible.”

author: Khaled Hosseini,
title: “I suspect the truth is that we are waiting, all of us, against insurmountable odds, for something extraordinary to happen to us.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Declarations of love amuse me. Especially when unrequited.”

author: Maya Angelou,
title: “Each person deserves a day away in which no problems are confronted, no solutions searched for.”

author: J.D. Salinger,
title: “I think that one of these days," he said, "you're going to have to find out where you want to go. And then you've got to start going there. But immediately. You can't afford to lose a minute. Not you.”

author: Hermann Hesse ,
title: “Every man is more than just himself; he also represents the unique, the very special and always significant and remarkable point at which the world's phenomena intersect, only once in this way, and never again. That is why every man's story is important, eternal, sacred; that is why every man, as long as he lives and fulfills the will of nature, is wondrous, and worthy of consideration. In each individual the spirit has become flesh, in each man the creation suffers, within each one a redeemer is nailed to the cross.”

author: Gayle Forman,
title: “And that's when I understand that I have been stained. Whether I'm still in love with him, whether he was ever in love with me, and no matter who he's in love with now, Willem changed my life. He showed me how to get lost, and then I showed myself how to get found.”

author: Vince Lombardi
title: “Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.”

author: David Mitchell,
title: “Belief, like fear or love, is a force to be understood as we understand the theory of relativity and principals of uncertainty. Phenomena that determine the course of our lives. Yesterday, my life was headed in one direction. Today, it is headed in another. Yesterday, I believe I would never have done what I did today. These forces that often remake time and space, that can shape and alter who we

author: Confucius
title: “It is not the failure of others to appreciate your abilities that should trouble you, but rather your failure to appreciate theirs.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “To care about your outward appearance is important, but what’s more important is to have a beautiful soul.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Surround Yourself with Positive People Who Believe in Your Dreams

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Life is short. Focus on what really matters most. You have to change your priorities over time.”

author: Charlie Chaplin

author: Rabindranath Tagore

author: Lucille Ball

author: Turcois Ominek
title: “Your time is way too valuable to be wasting on people that can't accept who you are.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Great leaders can see the greatness in others when they can’t see it themselves and lead them to their highest potential they don’t even know.”

author: A.A. Milne,

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

author: Albert Einstein

author: Nicholas Sparks,

author: Cassandra Clare,

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Do you think I'm pretty?

title: “It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done.”

author: Max Lucado
title: “A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.”

author: Walt Disney
title: “It's kind of fun to do the impossible.”

author: Maya Angelou,
title: “You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.”

author: John Waters
title: “If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!”

author: Charles Bukowski,

author: Cassandra Clare,

author: Lao Tzu

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: “God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars.”

author: Lauren Oliver,
title: “I love you. Remember. They cannot take it”

author: Pablo Picasso
title: “Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.”

author: Patrick Rothfuss,

author: Bob Dylan

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Successful people have no fear of failure. But unsuccessful people do. Successful people have the resilience to face up to failure—learn the lessons and adapt from it.”

author: Dee,
title: “Pegang tanganku, tapi jangan terlalu erat, karena aku ingin seiring dan bukan digiring.(Spasi)”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “One of the best ways to influence people is to make them feel important.”

author: P.G. Wodehouse

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed.”

author: Langston Hughes,
title: “Life is for the living.

author: Shel Silverstein,
title: “There are no happy endings.

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “You know," Gabriel said, "there was a time I thought we could be friends, Will."

author: Oscar Wilde (attributed to)
title: “Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.”

author: Laurell K. Hamilton,

author: Charlotte Brontë,

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery,

author: Mother Teresa

title: “The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain!”

author: Winston S. Churchill,

author: Muhammad Ali

author: Viktor E. Frankl,
title: “It did not really matter what we expected from life, but rather what life expected from us. We needed to stop asking about the meaning of life, and instead to think of ourselves as those who were being questioned by life—daily and hourly. Our answer must consist, not in talk and meditation, but in right action and in right conduct. Life ultimately means taking the responsibility to find the right answer to its problems and to fulfill the tasks which it constantly sets for each individual.”

author: Tahereh Mafi
title: “Hate looks like everybody else until it smiles”

author: Bruce Lee
title: “Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “If you once forfeit the confidence of your fellow citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem. It is true that you may fool all of the people some of the time; you can even fool some of the people all of the time; but you can't fool all of the people all of the time. -Speech at Clinton, Illinois, September 8, 1854.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “I want to thank you, Lord, for life and all that's in it.

author: Steve Jobs
title: “Stay hungry. Stay foolish.”

author: Thomas Edison
title: “When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this - you haven't.”

author: Betty Friedan,
title: “Each suburban wife struggles with it alone. As she made the beds, shopped for groceries, matched slipcover material, ate peanut butter sandwiches with her children, chauffeured Cub Scouts and Brownies, lay beside her husband at night- she was afraid to ask even of herself the silent question-- 'Is this all?”

author: T.S. Eliot
title: “If you haven’t the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Beliefs are choices. First you choose your beliefs. Then your beliefs affect your choices.”

author: Stephen Fry
title: “Stop feeling sorry for yourself and you will be happy.”

author: Ray Bradbury

author: Jodi Picoult,

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: “Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.”

author: Aristotle
title: “To write well, express yourself like the common people, but think like a wise man.”

author: Ellen DeGeneres,
title: “Beauty is about being comfortable in your own skin. It's about knowing and accepting who you are.”

author: Dan Millman,
title: “There is no need to search; achievement leads to nowhere. It makes no difference at all, so just be happy now! Love is the only reality of the world, because it is all One, you see. And the only laws are paradox, humor and change. There is no problem, never was, and never will be. Release your struggle, let go of your mind, throw away your concerns, and relax into the world. No need to resist life, just do your best. Open your eyes and see that you are far more than you imagine. You are the world, you are the universe; you are yourself and everyone else, too! It's all the marvelous Play of God. Wake up, regain your humor. Don't worry, just be happy. You are already free!”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.”

author: Betty  Smith,
title: “She had become accustomed to being lonely. She was used to walking alone and to being considered 'different.' She did not suffer too much.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “When you take control of your attitude, you take control of your life.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Enthusiasm can help you find the new doors, but it takes passion to open them. If you have a strong purpose in life, you don't have to be pushed. Your passion will drive you there.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “What other people think and say about you is none of your business. The most destructive thing you would ever do is to believe someone else's opinion of you. You have to stop letting other people's opinions control you.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “The comfort zone is a psychological state in which one feels familiar, safe, at ease, and secure. You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away.”

author: Khalil Gibran,
title: “Let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls. Fill each other's cup but drink not from one cup. Give one another of your bread but eat not from the same loaf. Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone, Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music. Give your hearts, but not into each other's keeping. For only the hand of Life can contain your hearts. And stand together, yet not too near together: For the pillars of the temple stand apart, And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each other's shadow.”

author: Charles Bukowski,
title: “That's the problem with drinking, I thought, as I poured myself a drink. If something bad happens you drink in an attempt to forget; if something good happens you drink in order to celebrate; and if nothing happens you drink to make something happen.”

author: John Green,
title: “If you don't imagine, nothing ever happens at all.”

author: A. A. Milne,
title: “It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words like "What about lunch?”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.”

author: Anais Nin,
title: “Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “It's all right to love someone who doesn't love you back, as long as they're worth you loving them. As long as they deserve it.”

author: Stephanie Klein,
title: “Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “You smell good, too,” said Patch

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Investigation?" Isabelle laughed. "Now we're detectives? Maybe we should all have code names."

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “Music is a total constant. That's why we have such a strong visceral connection to it, you know? Because a song can take you back instantly to a moment, or a place, or even a person. No matter what else has changed in your or the world, that one song says the same, just like that moment.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “I am haunted by humans.”

author: Oscar Wilde,
title: “With freedom, flowers, books, and the moon, who could not be perfectly happy?”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Only a true best friend can protect you from your immortal enemies.”

author: Rabindranath Tagore,
title: “Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.”

author: Hunter S. Thompson,
title: “Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!”

author: David Foster Wallace
title: “The so-called ‘psychotically depressed’ person who tries to kill herself doesn’t do so out of quote ‘hopelessness’ or any abstract conviction that life’s assets and debits do not square. And surely not because death seems suddenly appealing. The person in whom Its invisible agony reaches a certain unendurable level will kill herself the same way a trapped person will eventually jump from the window of a burning high-rise. Make no mistake about people who leap from burning windows. Their terror of falling from a great height is still just as great as it would be for you or me standing speculatively at the same window just checking out the view; i.e. the fear of falling remains a constant. The variable here is the other terror, the fire’s flames: when the flames get close enough, falling to death becomes the slightly less terrible of two terrors. It’s not desiring the fall; it’s terror of the flames. And yet nobody down on the sidewalk, looking up and yelling ‘Don’t!’ and ‘Hang on!’, can understand the jump. Not really. You’d have to have personally been trapped and felt flames to really understand a terror way beyond falling.”

author: John Green,
title: “What you must understand about me is that I’m a deeply unhappy person.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be.”

author: A.A. Milne

author: Gillian Anderson

You know, one day you look at the person and you see something more than you did the night before. Like a switch has been flicked somewhere. And the person who was just a friend is... suddenly the only person you can ever imagine yourself with.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,

author: Chuck Palahniuk,

author: Alice Walker

author: Anne Lamott

Whether you're going to spend it trying to look good and creating the illusion that you have power over circumstances, or whether you are going to taste it, enjoy it and find out the truth about who you are.”

author: Sir Winston Churchill

What a tragedy if that moment finds them unprepared or unqualified for that which could have been their finest hour.”

author: Wendy Wasserstein
title: “Don't live down to expectations. Go out there and do something remarkable.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “7 Effective Ways to Make Others Feel Important

author: Charles Darwin,
title: “Thus, from the war of nature, from famine and death, the most exalted object which we are capable of conceiving, namely, the production of the higher animals, directly follows. There is grandeur in this view of life, with its several powers, having been originally breathed into a few forms or into one; and that, whilst this planet has gone cycling on according to the fixed law of gravity, from so simple a beginning endless forms most beautiful and most wonderful have been, and are being, evolved.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “Nothing will work unless you do.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,
title: “Be yourself; no base imitator of another, but your best self. There is something which you can do better than another. Listen to the inward voice and bravely obey that. Do the things at which you are great, not what you were never made for.”

author: Walt Whitman
title: “Pointing to another world will never stop vice among us; shedding light over this world can alone help us.”

author: charles de lint
title: “I don't want to live in the kind of world where we don't look out for each other. Not just the people that are close to us, but anybody who needs a helping hand. I cant change the way anybody else thinks, or what they choose to do, but I can do my bit.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “We are all equal in the fact that we are all different. We are all the same in the fact that we will never be the same. We are united by the reality that all colours and all cultures are distinct & individual. We are harmonious in the reality that we are all held to this earth by the same gravity. We don't share blood, but we share the air that keeps us alive. I will not blind myself and say that my black brother is not different from me. I will not blind myself and say that my brown sister is not different from me. But my black brother is he as much as I am me. But my brown sister is she as much as I am me.”

author: Laurell K. Hamilton,
title: “Love is too precious to be ashamed of.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Do not let the roles you play in life make you forget who you are.”

author: Paul McCartney
title: “When I find myself in times of trouble, mother Mary comes to me,

author: Tupac Shakur
title: “Reality is wrong. Dreams are for the real.”

author: David Mitchell,
title: “...there ain't no journey what don't change you some.”

author: Wayne Dyer
title: “When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.”

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
title: “God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Things die. But they don't always stay dead. Believe me, I know.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “You were born to stand out, stop trying to fit in.”

author: Abraham Joshua Heschel
title: “Self-respect is the root of discipline: The sense of dignity grows

author: Tyler Perry
title: “It doesn't matter if a million people tell you what you can't do, or if ten million tell you no. If you get one yes from God that's all you need.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Everyone enjoys being acknowledged and appreciated. Sometimes even the simplest act of gratitude can change someone's entire day. Take the time to recognize and value the people around you and appreciate those who make a difference in your lives.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Change may not always bring growth, but there is no growth without change.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,

author: Charles Dickens,
title: “There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “A brave man acknowledges the strength of others.”

author: Timothy Leary
title: “Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.”

author: Lois Lowry,
title: “The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “God has no religion.”

author: Martin Luther King Jr.,
title: “Let no man pull you so low as to hate him.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “I am coming to terms with the fact that loving someone requires a leap of faith, and that a soft landing is never guaranteed.”

author: Leo Tolstoy,
title: “If you look for perfection, you'll never be content.”

author: E. E. Cummings
title: “Unbeing dead isn't being alive.”

author: John Green,
title: “It always shocked me when I realized that I wasn’t the only person in the world who thought and felt such strange and awful things.”

author: Joseph Campbell
title: “Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer.”

author: Albert Einstein
title: “The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “If you like her, if she makes you happy, and if you feel like you know her---then don't let her go.”

author: Herman Melville
title: “It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.”

author: Lewis Carroll,
title: “Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop.”

author: Marcel Proust
title: “Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.”

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
title: “I’m here. I love you. I don’t care if you need to stay up crying all night long, I will stay with you. If you need the medication again, go ahead and take it—I will love you through that, as well. If you don’t need the medication, I will love you, too. There’s nothing you can ever do to lose my love. I will protect you until you die, and after your death I will still protect you. I am stronger than Depression and I am braver than Loneliness and nothing will ever exhaust me.”

author: John Green,
title: “Some people have lives; some people have music.”

author: J.K. rowling,
title: “Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “I’d said it before and meant it: Alive or undead, the love of my life was a badass.”

author: Sarah Dessen,
title: “Some things don't last forever, but some things do. Like a good song, or a good book, or a good memory you can take out and unfold in your darkest times, pressing down on the corners and peering in close, hoping you still recognize the person you see there.”

author: James A. Baldwin
title: “Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.”

author: Anna Quindlen,
title: “Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home.”

author: Nicholas Sparks,
title: “Mom says it's because she has PMS.

author: Benjamin Spock
title: “Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.”

author: Lao Tzu,
title: “Simplicity, patience, compassion.

author: Umberto Eco
title: “We live for books.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment. ”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better.”

author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca
title: “When love is not madness it is not love.”

author: John Green,
title: “I may die young, but at least I'll die smart.”

author: J.M. Barrie,
title: “Never say goodbye because goodbye means going away and going away means forgetting.”

author: George R.R. Martin,
title: “Fear cuts deeper than swords.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “He must have known I'd want to leave you."

author: Alexander Pope
title: “Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Why do people have to be this lonely? What's the point of it all? Millions of people in this world, all of them yearning, looking to others to satisfy them, yet isolating themselves. Why? Was the earth put here just to nourish human loneliness?”

author: Flannery O'Connor
title: “The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.”

author: Lewis Carroll,
title: “Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.”

author: Tupac Shakur
title: “You can spend minutes, hours, days, weeks, or even months over-analyzing a situation; trying to put the pieces together, justifying what could've, would've happened... or you can just leave the pieces on the floor and move the fuck on.”

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “I don’t know if you’ve ever felt like that. That you wanted to sleep for a thousand years. Or just not exist. Or just not be aware that you do exist. Or something like that. I think wanting that is very morbid, but I want it when I get like this. That’s why I’m trying not to think. I just want it all to stop spinning.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.”

author: Patrick Ness,
title: “You do not write your life with words...You write it with actions. What you think is not important. It is only important what you

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Ever had a flying burrito hit you? Well, it's a deadly projectile, right up there with cannonballs and grenades.”

author: Harper Lee,
title: “People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “Finnick?" I say, "Maybe some pants?"

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “You guessed? You must have been pretty sure, considering you could have killed me."

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Why are they all staring?" demanded Albus as he and Rose craned around to look at the other students.

author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
title: “What you seek is seeking you.”

author: Virginia Woolf,
title: “Books are the mirrors of the soul.”

author: Cathy Guiswite
title: “When life gives you lemons, squirt someone in the eye.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Be careful of love. It'll twist your brain around and leave you thinking up is down and right is wrong.”

author: Einstein
title: “Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Can I help you with something?"

author: Margaret Atwood
title: “War is what happens when language fails.”

author: Shel Silverstein
title: “How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.”

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: “Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.”

author: Markus Zusak,
title: “It kills me sometimes, how people die.”

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again.”

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
title: “Ruin is a gift. Ruin is the road to transformation.”

author: Wilferd Peterson
title: “Walk with the dreamers, the believers, the courageous, the cheerful, the planners, the doers, the successful people with their heads in the clouds and their feet on the ground. Let their spirit ignite a fire within you to leave this world better than when you found it...”

author: Anne Frank,
title: “Although I'm only fourteen, I know quite well what I want, I know who is right and who is wrong. I have my opinions, my own ideas and principles, and although it may sound pretty mad from an adolescent, I feel more of a person than a child, I feel quite indepedent of anyone.”

author: Charles Bukowski,
title: “It was like the beginning of life and laughter. It was the real meaning of the sun”

author: Harry S. Truman
title: “It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.”

author: Socrates
title: “Know thyself.”

author: Muhammad Ali,
title: “If my mind can conceive it, and my heart can believe it - then I can achieve it.”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: “I have no right to say or do anything that diminishes a man in his own eyes. What matters is not what I think of him but what he thinks of himself. Hurting a man in his dignity is a crime.”

author: Ariana Dancu
title: “She made broken look beautiful

author: Kurt Cobain
title: “They laugh at me because I'm different; I laugh at them because they're all the same.”

author: Colin Powell
title: “The less you associate with some people, the more your life will improve.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: “Life begins on the other side of despair.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “You learn something valuable from all of the significant events and people, but you never touch your true potential until you challenge yourself to go beyond imposed limitations.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Don’t wait for things to happen. Make them happen.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Good things happen in your life when you surround yourself with positive people.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Don't wait for the right moment to start, start and make each moment right.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Good people see the good and bring out the best in other people.”

author: Beatrix Potter
title: “Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good, behave yourself and never mind the rest.”

author: Jonathan Antin
title: “The minute I stopped trying to find the right girl, and started trying to become the right guy...the girl came.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “When things do not go your way, remember that every challenge — every adversity — contains within it the seeds of opportunity and growth.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “What you stay focused on will grow.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “It’s important that what thoughts you are feeding into your mind because your thoughts create your belief and experiences. You have positive thoughts and you have negative ones too. Nurture your mind with positive thoughts: kindness, empathy, compassion, peace, love, joy, humility, generosity, etc. The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Enjoy every step you take. If you're curious, there is always something new to be discovered in the backdrop of your daily life.”

author: Iain Thomas,
title: “Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let the pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness. Take pride that even though the rest of the world may disagree, you still believe it to be a beautiful place”

author: John Boyle O'Reilly,
title: “Be silent and safe — silence never betrays you;

author: Marcus Aurelius,
title: “The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.”

author: J.A. Redmerski,
title: “I hate to say it, but shit really does happen. You just have to get over it. Beat the hell out of it by doing things that make you happy.”

author: Alice Sebold,
title: “These were the lovely bones that had grown around my absence: the connections-sometimes tenuous, sometimes made at great cost, but often magnificent-that happened after I was gone. And I began to see things in a way that let me hold the world without me in it. The events that my death wrought were merely the bones of a body that would become whole at some unpredictable time in the future. The price of what I came to see as this miraculous body had been my life.”

author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi,
title: “An eye is meant to see things.

author: Tom Hiddleston
title: “Never, ever, let anyone tell you what you can and can't do. Prove the cynics wrong. Pity them for they have no imagination. The sky's the limit. Your sky. Your limit. Now. Let's dance.”

author: Douglas Adams,
title: “If I ever meet myself,' said Zaphod, 'I'll hit myself so hard I won't know what's hit me.”

author: David Mamet,
title: “We must have a pie. Stress cannot exist in the presence of a pie.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “The mind is a complex and many-layered thing, Potter... or at least, most minds are...”

author: Pablo Neruda
title: “Take bread away from me, if you wish,

author: Frank Zappa
title: “Interviewer: 'So Frank, you have long hair. Does that make you a woman?'

author: Ilona Andrews,
title: “I can't give you the white picket fence, and if I did, you'd set it on fire.”

author: John Green,
title: “Well, while you were in the bathroom, I sat down at this picnic table here in Bumblefug, Kentucky, and noticed that someone had carved that GOD HATES FAG, which, aside from being a grammatical nightmare, is absolutely ridiculous. So I'm changing it to 'God Hates Baguettes.' It's tough to disagree with that. Everybody hates baguettes.”

author: Lora Brody
title: “Don't wreck a sublime chocolate experience by feeling guilty.

author: Jeaniene Frost,
title: “I have been stabbed, shot, burned, bitten, beaten unconscious too many times to count, and even staked. None of those held a candle to the pain I felt at seeing his mouth on hers.”

author: Robin McKinley,
title: “I don't put up with being messed around, and I don't suffer fools gladly. The short version of that is that I'm a bitch. Trust me, I can provide character references.”

author: Terry Pratchett
title: “Many people could say things in a cutting way, Nanny knew. But Granny Weatherwax could

author: George Carlin,
title: “THINGS YOU NEVER HEAR: 'Please stop sucking my dick or I'll call the police.”

author: Carl Sagan
title: “The nuclear arms race is like two sworn enemies standing waist deep in gasoline, one with three matches, the other with five.”

author: Steve Martin
title: “Writer's block is a fancy term made up by whiners so they can have an excuse to drink alcohol.”

author: Françoise Sagan
title: “Money may not buy happiness, but I'd rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.”

author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,
title: “Oh, dear God and baby Jesus in the manger, my eyes!” Dee shrieked. “My eyes!”

author: Steve Martin
title: “Boy, those French! They have a different word for everything.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “First best is falling in love. Second best is being in love. Least best is falling out of love. But any of it is better than never having been in love.”

author: Emmet Fox
title: “If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.”

author: Sara Evans
title: “Even on my weakest days

author: Jennifer Niven,
title: “I do my best thinking at night when everyone else is sleeping. No interruptions. No noise. I like the feeling of being awake when no one else is.”

author: Edith Wharton,
title: “Each time you happen to me all over again.”

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,
title: “To love is to suffer and there can be no love otherwise.”

author: Karen Marie Moning,
title: “Dying is overrated. Human sentimentality has twisted it into the ultimate act of love. Biggest load of bullshit in the world. Dying for someone isn't the hard thing. The man that dies escapes. Plain and simple. Game over. End of pain...Try living for someone. Through it all-good, bad, thick, thin, joy, suffering. That's the hard thing.”

author: William Goldman,
title: “Now what happens?" asked the man in black.

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “His eyes are as green as a fresh pickled toad,

author: Andy Weir,
title: “As with most of life's problems, this one can be solved by a box of pure radiation.”

author: Tina Fey,
title: “I was a little excited but mostly blorft. "Blorft" is an adjective I just made up that means 'Completely overwhelmed but proceeding as if everything is fine and reacting to the stress with the torpor of a possum.' I have been blorft every day for the past seven years.”

author: Molly Ivins,
title: “Margaret Atwood, the Canadian novelist, once asked a group of women at a university why they felt threatened by men. The women said they were afraid of being beaten, raped, or killed by men. She then asked a group of men why they felt threatened by women. They said they were afraid women would laugh at them.”

author: Lisa Scottoline ,
title: “How do you tell the psychiatrists from the patients in the hospital?

author: James Patterson,
title: “Meaning what? We're going to pretend nothing's going on? That's stupid. The only way to deal with any of this is to get it out in the open."

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I can't believe he didn't have the dignity and presence of mind just to get drunk and pass out in some gutter," said Jace. "I must say, I'm disappointed in the little fellow.”

author: J.R. Ward,
title: “There aren't any syringes." Red Sox came over and held a sterile pack out. When she tried to take it from him, he kept a grip on the thing. "I know you'll use this wisely."

author: W. H. Auden,
title: “He was my North, my South, my East and West,

author: Lauren Conrad
title: “Love is not a maybe thing, you know when you love someone.”

author: Steve Hall
title: “The truest form of love is how you behave toward someone, not how you feel about them.”

author: Adolf Hitler
title: “And I can fight only for something that I love, love only what I respect, and respect only what I at least know.”

author: Scott Dikkers,
title: “Statistically speaking, there is a 65 percent chance that the love of your life is having an affair. Be very suspicious.”

author: Gayle Forman,
title: “There are so many things that demand to be said. Where did you go? Do you ever think about me? You've ruined me. Are you okay? But of course, I can't say any of that.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “I love you more than I hate everything else.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “I love you" I say.

author: Kurt Vonnegut ,
title: “Love is where you find it. I think it is foolish to go around looking for it, and I think it can be poisonous. I wish that people who are conventionally supposed to love each other would say to each other, when they fight, 'Please — a little less love, and a little more common decency'.”

author: Jack Kerouac,
title: “Down on the lake rosy reflections of celestial vapor appeared, and I said, "God, I love you" and looked to the sky and really meant it. "I have fallen in love with you, God. Take care of us all, one way or the other." To the children and the innocent it's all the same.”

author: Stephanie Laurens,
title: “Just because I'm not forever by your side doesn't mean that's not precisely where I want to be.”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
title: “When someone blushes, doesn't that mean 'yes'?”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “And, whoa!" He turned to Mr.D. "Your the wine dude? No way!"

author: Thomas Bernhard,
title: “Instead of committing suicide, people go to work.”

author: Dave Barry
title: “It is a well-documented fact that guys will not ask for directions. This is a biological thing. This is why it takes several million sperm cells... to locate a female egg, despite the fact that the egg is, relative to them, the size of Wisconsin.”

author: Stephanie Perkins,
title: “The only French word I know is oui, which means “yes,” and only recently did I learn it’s spelled o-​u-​i and not w-​e-​e.”

author: Allyson Braithwaite Condie,
title: “Isn't it funny how the memories you cherish before a breakup can become your worst enemies afterwards? The thoughts you loved to think about, the memories you wanted to hold up to the light and view from every angle--it suddenly seems a lot safer to lock them in a box, far from the light of day and throw away the key. It's not an act of bitterness. It's an act if self-preservation. It's not always a bad idea to stay behind the window and look out at life instead, is it?”

author: William Butler Yeats,
title: “Had I the heavens' embroidered cloths,

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,
title: “I love her, and that's the beginning and end of everything.”

author: Marguerite Yourcenar,
title: “Of all our games, love's play is the only one which threatens to unsettle the soul...”

author: marissa meyer,
title: “It's all right," said Wolf. "You loved her. I would feel the same if someone wanted to erase Scarlet's identity and give it to Levana's army.

author: E.A. Bucchianeri,
title: “Falling in love is very real, but I used to shake my head when people talked about soul mates, poor deluded individuals grasping at some supernatural ideal not intended for mortals but sounded pretty in a poetry book. Then, we met, and everything changed, the cynic has become the converted, the sceptic, an ardent zealot.”

author: Raymond Carver,
title: “I loved you so much once. I did. More than anything in the whole wide world. Imagine that. What a laugh that is now. Can you believe it? We were so intimate once upon a time I can't believe it now. The memory of being that intimate with somebody. We were so intimate I could puke. I can't imagine ever being that intimate with somebody else. I haven't been.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
title: “Being with her I feel a pain, like a frozen knife stuck in my chest. An awful pain, but the funny thing is I'm thankful for it. It's like that frozen pain and my very existence are one.

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
title: “Any happiness, no matter how brief, seemed better than the long, simmering torture of waking up day after day, knowing I could never have him.”

author: Lauren Oliver,
title: “And you can't love, not fully, unless you are loved in return.”

author: Diana Gabaldon ,
title: “Blood of my Blood," he whispered, "and bone of my bone. You carry me within ye, Claire, and ye canna leave me now, no matter what happens, You are mine, always, if ye will it or no, if ye want me or nay. Mine, and I wilna let ye go.”

author: E. Lockhart,
title: “He was contemplation and enthusiasm. Ambition and strong coffee. I could have looked at him forever.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “The first time he'd held her hand, it felt so good that it crowded out all the bad things. It felt better than anything had ever hurt.”

author: David Levithan
title: “It doesn't have to be on Valentine's Day. It doesn't have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn't have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn't have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third date.

author: Khaled Hosseini,
title: “I will follow you to the ends of the world.”

author: Lorrie Moore,
title: “This is what happened in love. One of you cried a lot and then both of you grew sarcastic.”

author: Jane Austen,
title: “I do not think I ever opened a book in my life which had not something to say upon woman's inconstancy. Songs and proverbs, all talk of woman's fickleness. But perhaps you will say, these were all written by men."

author: Margaret Atwood,
title: “Falling in love, we said; I fell for him. We were falling women. We believed in it, this downward motion: so lovely, like flying, and yet at the same time so dire, so extreme, so unlikely. God is love, they once said, but we reversed that, and love, like heaven, was always just around the corner. The more difficult it was to love the particular man beside us, the more we believed in Love, abstract and total. We were waiting, always, for the incarnation. That word, made flesh.

author: Marvin J. Ashton
title: “Be the one who nurtures and builds. Be the one who has an understanding and a forgiving heart one who looks for the best in people. Leave people better than you found them.”

author: Andrea Gibson
title: “Autumn is the hardest season. The leaves are all falling, and they're falling like

author: W. Somerset Maugham,
title: “He did not care if she was heartless, vicious and vulgar, stupid and grasping, he loved her. He would rather have misery with one than happiness with the other.”

author: William Faulkner
title: “The saddest thing about love, Joe, is that not only the love cannot last forever, but even the heartbreak is soon forgotten.”

author: Rainbow Rowell,
title: “What you are is a fucking tragedy, Simon Snow. You literally couldn't be a bigger mess."

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: “If you love something so much let it go. If it comes back it was meant to be; if it doesn't it never was”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “There was beauty in the idea of freedom, but it was an illusion. Every human heart was chained by love.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “It scares me how hard it is to remember life before you. I can't even make the comparisons anymore, because my memories of that time have all the depth of a photograph. It seems foolish to play games of better and worse. It's simply a matter of is and is no longer.”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “And yet,to say the truth, reason and love keep little company together nowadays.”

author: Ernest Hemingway,
title: “Oh Jake," Brett said, "We could have had such a damned good time together."

author: Warsan Shire
title: “With you, intimacy colours my voice.

author: Tabitha Suzuma,
title: “At the end of the day it's about how much you can bear, how much you can endure. Being together, we harm nobody; being apart, we extinguish ourselves.”

author: Katie McGarry,
title: “I love you enough to never make you choose.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “When you love someone, you don't have a choice. Love takes your choices away.

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “Of course he loves me. I’m his sister.”

author: David Levithan,
title: “It's one thing to fall in love. It's another to feel someone else fall in love with you, and to feel a responsibility toward that love.”

author: Stephenie Meyer,
title: “Eight full lives,” I whispered against his jaw, my voice breaking. “Eight full lives and I never found anyone I would stay on a planet for, anyone I would follow when they left. I never found a partner. Why now? Why you? You're not of my species. How can you be my partner?”

author: Sherman Alexie,
title: “He loved her, of course, but better than that, he chose her, day after day. Choice: that was the thing.”

author: David Nicholls,
title: “You can live your whole life not realizing that what you're looking for is right in front of you.”

author: Richelle Mead,
title: “Wait. You think I'm going to die? That's why you slept with me?”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “But I have to confess, I'm glad you two had at least a few months of happiness together."

author: George R.R. Martin
title: “We all need to be mocked from time to time, lest we take ourselves too seriously.”

author: Ronald Reagan
title: “If we ever forget that we're one nation under God, then we will be one nation gone under.”

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
title: “Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.”

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: “Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.”

author: Anaïs Nin,
title: “I disregard the proportions, the measures, the tempo of the ordinary world. I refuse to live in the ordinary world as ordinary women. To enter ordinary relationships. I want ecstasy. I am a neurotic — in the sense that I live in my world. I will not adjust myself to the world. I am adjusted to myself.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “It doesn’t matter how many times you get knocked down. All that matters is you get up one more time than you were knocked down.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “For everything in this journey of life we are on, there is a right wing and a left wing: for the wing of love there is anger; for the wing of destiny there is fear; for the wing of pain there is healing; for the wing of hurt there is forgiveness; for the wing of pride there is humility; for the wing of giving there is taking; for the wing of tears there is joy; for the wing of rejection there is acceptance; for the wing of judgment there is grace; for the wing of honor there is shame; for the wing of letting go there is the wing of keeping. We can only fly with two wings and two wings can only stay in the air if there is a balance. Two beautiful wings is perfection. There is a generation of people who idealize perfection as the existence of only one of these wings every time. But I see that a bird with one wing is imperfect. An angel with one wing is imperfect. A butterfly with one wing is dead. So this generation of people strive to always cut off the other wing in the hopes of embodying their ideal of perfection, and in doing so, have created a crippled race.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Failure is a bend in the road, not the end of the road. Learn from failure and keep moving forward.”

author: Anne Lamott,
title: “E.L. Doctorow said once said that 'Writing a novel is like driving a car at night. You can see only as far as your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.' You don't have to see where you're going, you don't have to see your destination or everything you will pass along the way. You just have to see two or three feet ahead of you. This is right up there with the best advice on writing, or life, I have ever heard.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “I offer you peace. I offer you love. I offer you friendship. I see your beauty. I hear your need. I feel your feelings.”

author: Mother Teresa,
title: “I would rather make mistakes in kindness and compassion than work miracles in unkindness and hardness.”

author: William S. Burroughs
title: “Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape. ”

author: Napoleon Hill,
title: “When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound, rebuild those plans, and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
title: “You come of the Lord Adam and the Lady Eve," said Aslan. "And that is both honour enough to erect the head of the poorest beggar, and shame enough to bow the shoulders of the greatest emperor on earth. Be content.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Until you step into the unknown, you don’t know what you’re made of.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.”

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: “I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.”

author: Maya Angelou
title: “All great achievements require time.”

author: Colleen McCullough,
title: “There is a legend about a bird which sings just once in its life, more sweetly than any other creature on the face of the earth. From the moment it leaves the nest it searches for a thorn tree, and does not rest until it has found one. Then, singing among the savage branches, it impales itself upon the longest, sharpest spine. And, dying, it rises above its own agony to outcarol the lark and the nightingale. One superlative song, existence the price. But the whole world stills to listen, and God in His heaven smiles. For the best is only bought at the cost of great pain… Or so says the legend.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “Before, I wanted to say: "I found love!" But now, I want to say: "I found a person. And he belongs to me and I belong to him.”

author: Thomas A. Edison
title: “If we all did the things we are really capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.”

author: Emma Goldman
title: “People have only as much liberty as they have the intelligence to want and the courage to take.”

author: Sheryl Sandberg,
title: “What would you do if you weren't afraid?”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “I don't fit into any stereotypes. And I like myself that way.”

author: Steve Jobs
title: “You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.”

author: Yann Martel,
title: “These people fail to realize that it is on the inside that God must be defended, not on the outside. They should direct their anger at themselves. For evil in the open is but evil from within that has been let out. The main battlefield for good is not the open ground of the public arena but the small clearing of each heart.”

author: Gail Carson Levine,
title: “Step follows step,

author: Wendelin Van Draanen,
title: “...Next time you're faced with a choice, do the right thing. It hurts everyone less in the long run.”

author: Rabindranath Tagore
title: “Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
title: “Stop doing what is easy. Start doing what is right.”

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “It's strange because sometimes, I read a book, and I think I am the people in the book.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
title: “It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.”

author: Jane Austen,
title: “I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.”

author: Jane Austen,
title: “Angry people are not always wise.”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: “Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.”

author: Anton Chekhov
title: “Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.”

author: Helen Keller
title: “The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “Don't talk to me."

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “I can feel Peeta press his forehead into my temple and he asks, 'So now that you've got me, what are you going to do with me?' I turn into him. 'Put you somewhere you can't get hurt.”

author: Suzanne Collins,
title: “Fire is catching! And if we burn, you burn with us!”

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
title: “Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt.”

author: J.K. Rowling,
title: “You know, Minister, I disagree with Dumbledore on many counts...but you cannot deny he's got style...”

author: J.K. Rowling
title: “We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already.”

author: Neil Gaiman,
title: “What I say is, a town isn’t a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it’s got a bookstore, it knows it’s not foolin’ a soul.”

author: Muhammad Ali
title: “Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I've got a stele we can use. Who wants to do me?"

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
title: “But I know, somehow, that only when it is dark enough can you see the stars.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Love conquers all," Aphrodite promised. "Look at Helen and Paris. Did they let anything come between them?"

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: “Who said nights were for sleep?”

author: William Shakespeare,
title: “When he shall die,

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “One of the Silent Brothers is here to see you. Hodge sent me to wake you up. Actually he offered to wake you himself, but since it's 5 a.m., I figured you'd be less cranky if you had something nice to look at."

author: Bob Marley
title: “None but ourselves can free our minds.”

author: Taylor Swift
title: “People haven't always been there for me but music always has.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: “I was never really insane except upon occasions when my heart was touched.”

author: Mark Twain
title: “I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
title: “If pain must come, may it come quickly. Because I have a life to live, and I need to live it in the best way possible. If he has to make a choice, may he make it now. Then I will either wait for him or forget him.”

author: Dan Brown,
title: “Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.”

author: Anne Tyler
title: “I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place.”

author: Rick Riordan,
title: “Wow," Thalia muttered. "Apollo is hot."

author: Rudyard Kipling
title: “Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.”

author: Charles Dickens,
title: “I wish you to know that you have been the last dream of my soul.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
title: “I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.”

author: Zayn Malik
title: “Life is funny. Things change, people change, but you will always be you, so stay true to yourself and never sacrifice who you are for anyone.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
title: “I've never minded it," he went on. "Being lost, that is. I had always thought one could not truly be lost if one knew one's own heart. But I fear I may be lost without knowing yours.”

author: Kiera Cass,
title: “I want everything with you, America. I want the holidays and the birthdays, the busy season and lazy weekends. I want peanut butter fingertips on my desk. I want inside jokes and fights and everything. I want a life with you.”

author: John Green,
title: “We never really talked much or even looked at each other, but it didn't matter because we were looking at the same sky together, which is maybe even more intimate than eye contact anyway. I mean, anybody can look at you. It's quite rare to find someone who sees the same world you see.”

author: Tom Robbins,
title: “When two people meet and fall in love, there's a sudden rush of magic. Magic is just naturally present then. We tend to feed on that gratuitous magic without striving to make any more. One day we wake up and find that the magic is gone. We hustle to get it back, but by then it's usually too late, we've used it up. What we have to do is work like hell at making additional magic right from the start. It's hard work, but if we can remember to do it, we greatly improve our chances of making love stay.”

author: Anaïs Nin,
title: “Everything with me is either worship and passion or pity and understanding. I hate rarely, though when I hate, I hate murderously. For example now, I hate the bank and everything connected with it. I also hate Dutch paintings, penis-sucking, parties, and cold rainy weather. But I am much more preoccupied with loving.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up. I've seen it. It's fascinating." He releases me but doesn't pull away, his hand grazing my jaw, my neck. "Sometimes I just...want to see it again. Want to see you awake.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “Amor Fati – “Love Your Fate”, which is in fact your life.”

author: Susan Polis Schutz
title: “This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.”

author: Khalil Gibran,
title: “Love one another, but make not a bond of love:

author: Philip Pullman,
title: “I'll be looking for you, Will, every moment, every single moment. And when we do find each other again, we'll cling together so tight that nothing and no one'll ever tear us apart. Every atom of me and every atom of you... We'll live in birds and flowers and dragonflies and pine trees and in clouds and in those little specks of light you see floating in sunbeams... And when they use our atoms to make new lives, they wont' just be able to take one, they'll have to take two, one of you and one of me, we'll be joined so tight...”

author: Henri J.M. Nouwen
title: “Forgiveness is the name of love practiced among people who love poorly. The hard truth is that all people love poorly. We need to forgive and be forgiven every day, every hour increasingly. That is the great work of love among the fellowship of the weak that is the human family.”

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: “I didn't want to kiss you goodbye — that was the trouble — I wanted to kiss you good night — and there's a lot of difference.”

author: Colleen Houck
title: “You don’t take away my choices. You are my choice.”

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning,
title: “How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.

author: Laini Taylor,
title: “She craved a presence beside her, solid. Fingertips light at the nape of her neck and a voice meeting hers in the dark. Someone who would wait with an umbrella to walk her home in the rain, and smile like sunshine when he saw her coming. Who would dance with her on her balcony, keep his promises and know her secrets, and make a tiny world wherever he was, with just her and his arms and his whisper and her trust.”

author: Demi Lovato
title: “I can't set my hopes too high,

author: Leigh Bardugo,
title: “I don't care if you danced naked on the roof of the Little Palace with him. I love you, Alina, even the part of you that loved him.”

author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,
title: “How could I have ever been ashamed of loving Dante Quintana?”

author: Greg Behrendt ,
title: “You picked a lemon, throw it away lemonade is overrated. Freaks should remain at the circus, not in your apartment. You already have one asshole. You don’t need another. Make a space in your life for the glorious things you deserve. Have faith.”

author: Tennessee Williams
title: “Nobody sees anybody truly but all through the flaws of their own egos. That is the way we all see ...each other in life. Vanity, fear, desire, competition-- all such distortions within our own egos-- condition our vision of those in relation to us. Add to those distortions to our own egos the corresponding distortions in the egos of others, and you see how cloudy the glass must become through which we look at each other. That's how it is in all living relationships except when there is that rare case of two people who love intensely enough to burn through all those layers of opacity and see each other's naked hearts.”

author: Candace Bushnell,
title: “Maybe mistakes are what make our fate... without them what would shape our lives? Maybe if we had never veered off course we wouldn't fall in love, have babies, or be who we are. After all, things change, so do cities, people come into your life and they go. But it's comforting to know that the ones you love are always in your heart... and if you're very lucky, a plane ride away”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “If you love deeply, you're going to get hurt badly. But it's still worth it.”

author: Gerard Way
title: “Would you destroy Something perfect in order to make it beautiful?”

author: Elizabeth Chandler,
title: “When you love someone, its never over. You move on, because you have to but you take them with you in your heart”

author: Susan Polis Schutz
title: “Love is being honest with yourself at all times

author: John Green,
title: “Augustus," I said. "Really. You don't have to do this."

author: Jonathan Safran Foer,
title: “In bed that night I invented a special drain that would be underneath every pillow in New York, and would connect to the reservoir. Whenever people cried themselves to sleep, the tears would all go to the same place, and in the morning the weatherman could report if the water level of the Reservoir of Tears had gone up or down, and you could know if New York is in heavy boots.”

author: Lewis Carroll,
title: “She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it).”

author: Louisa May Alcott,
title: “She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain.”

author: Andrew  Boyd,
title: “We’re all seeking that special person who is right for us. But if you’ve been through enough relationships, you begin to suspect there’s no right person, just different flavors of wrong. Why is this? Because you yourself are wrong in some way, and you seek out partners who are wrong in some complementary way. But it takes a lot of living to grow fully into your own wrongness. And it isn’t until you finally run up against your deepest demons, your unsolvable problems—the ones that make you truly who you are—that we’re ready to find a lifelong mate. Only then do you finally know what you’re looking for. You’re looking for the wrong person. But not just any wrong person: it's got to be the right wrong person—someone you lovingly gaze upon and think, “This is the problem I want to have.”

author: BILL WATTERSON
title: “It's not denial. I'm just selective about the reality I accept.”

author: Stephen King,
title: “The road to hell is paved with adverbs.”

author: Stephen Chbosky,
title: “It's just that I don't want to be somebody's crush. If somebody likes me, I want them to like the real me, not what they think I am. And I don't want them to carry it around inside. I want them to show me, so I can feel it too.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Sometimes crying or laughing are the only options left, and laughing feels better right now.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up”

author: Anonymous,
title: “And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.”

author: Stephen King
title: “Fiction is the truth inside the lie.”

author: Olin Miller
title: “You probably wouldn’t worry about what people think of you if you could know how seldom they do.”

author: Winston S. Churchill
title: “My tastes are simple: I am easily satisfied with the best.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “Peter would probably throw a party if I stopped breathing.'

author: Mark Twain
title: “Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it.”

author: Agatha Christie
title: “I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.”

author: Sarah J. Maas,
title: “To the people who look at the stars and wish, Rhys."

author: Cicero
title: “If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.”

author: Albert Camus
title: “Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?”

author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: “No medicine cures what happiness cannot.”

author: Anne Rice,
title: “None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “To be a Christian means to forgive the inexcusable because God has forgiven the inexcusable in you.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.”

author: Gayle Forman,
title: “Sometimes you make choices in life and sometimes choices make you.”

author: Douglas Adams,
title: “The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be.”

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: “If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.”

author: Veronica Roth,
title: “I have something I need to tell you," he says. I run my fingers along the tendons in his hands and look back at him. "I might be in love with you." He smiles a little. "I'm waiting until I'm sure to tell you, though."

author: George Burns
title: “Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.”

author: Patrick Rothfuss,
